review_body: All you need Clean room ✔️Excellent location next to subway, times sq, quieter street, felt safe all times ✔️Friendly staff massive shoutout to Geraldine who ran the breakfast she was amazing friendly offering advice and just there to talk to (she was in my view your star employee!) ✔️Breakfast was busy go earlier but the waffles were ace and filled us up nicely for the day and took the hassle out of looking for Somewhere to eat with two children.Nice roof terrace to enjoy a view uptown shame you couldn’t get a view downtown though We had an amazing 6 nights here and were able to feel relaxed and comfortableIn the hotel surroundings (free coffee in reception all day!) ✔️Thank you and we’ll be back

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed for 4 night with 2 friends, great location to explore New York by foot, subway and bus. Breakfast included is a great bonus as literally could fill up before setting off sight seeing for the day, lots to choose from and Geraldine is amazing always willing to go that bit over and beyond to make sure you are ok. We were on the 23rd floor although you could see some of the skyline it’s still very built up around the area so don’t exact the best sight. Lifts are fine don’t know what people complain about we didn’t have an issue. Free tea, coffee and other drinks in r3 epitomises 24/7 is great as well. Only thing I would say if you want theatre/broadway tickets go straight to the theatre in the morning rather than using ticket desk in hotel reception or queuing at TKTS as we got tickets for Beautiful for $69 in the Royal Box rather than buying them for $119 of the desk.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel location is really convenient if you want to be near Time Square - lots of action outside, but my room was very quiet. The staff is helpful and the room was clean. Nothing is luxurious, but it's all decent.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: It was a please experience. Going to a foreign place makes us feel quite uneay but meeting the very friendly and accommodating staffs made us feel comfortable and secure. The location is excellent as it is very accessible to the bus and train stations and it is situated at the heart of NY. We are looking forward to our next stay, this time with family.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great hotel, made very welcome. Rooms, bathroom spec, very nice, free hot drinks, cookies on reception breakfast choice variety, and beds were the most comfortable ever experienced....after a long tiring day. Staff fantastic, arranged taxi return at short notice to JFK. Brilliant experience....told Kevin it was my birthday, got given a bag of treats upon arrival...thank you all at Hampton inn, our holiday in New York last week was fantastic, helped by you all!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Cannot recommend this hotel enough the staff are brilliant to many to mention them all but Geraldine at breakfast and Olivia on reception are stars nothing was too much trouble always friendly and full of good tips for the city! Best to do breakfast as early as you can as does get busy around 8am onwards but the choice of food makes up for it!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We had a great experience at this hotel! The rooms are small but ok for NYC. It’s clean and well kept. Very close to the Subway and on a not-so-busy street in Times Square. Breakfast was good! Didn’t give it five stars because they charged us the wrong amount and we had to go down to the lobby to fix it but other than that it was great. I would definitely stay here again!!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Location was wonderful! Far enough away from Times Square to be less crowded onutside. The room was good size for NYC. Breakfast was crowded but good choices. Elevators are slow during peak times! Ask for a lower floor so stairs are an option. Call for a cab more than 30 before if early morning. Overall, a good, clean hotel in a perfect location. Water and coffee available in lobby was a treat!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I was exceptionally pleased with the accommodations, especially the fitness center. Super friendly staff and great location for tourists and business people alike.I was so pleased that the fitness center had such great equipment and was nice and clean, in great shape. The team at the hotel were always helpful in directing me to my business appointments and recommended a great place to eat for "famous NY pizza". I will definitely be returning in the future as the location and staff were wonderful!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Hampton Inn in Times Square was our first choice for accommodations in Times Square. The location is excellent for seeing various sights and convenient to the subway for traveling to other areas of Manhattan. We mostly walked to areas of interest. Very near the Broadway shows. The entire staff were extremely helpful and friendly. Would recommend this as a great place to stay.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed as a family of 6 adults in 3 rooms.This place ticked so many of the boxes on our wish list!The location is great- just around the corner from Times Square so ideal for sightseeing and getting around.The rooms are comfortable and well maintained.Cleaned everyday and towels and toiletries replenished.There are also coffee making facilities in each room and in the lobby there is tea, coffee and water 24 hrs- also cookies! The breakfast is a bonus - plenty of choices, fresh and plentiful. It does get crowded ( the seating area is not large enough to accommodate the number of guests) but you can use the lobby or take your breakfast to your room. It was not an issue for us.There can be a wait for the lifts at peak times but it's not that long and it's really not worth fussing about. It could happen anywhere!The staff are great- really welcoming and helpful. Super customer service at all times!!We all enjoyed our stay at the Hampton Inn.My only criticism is that the towels are a bit on the small side- I expected full size bath towels.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: When we checked in we met Olivia, she was so cheerful and welcoming. We chatted with her for quite awhile. She made my Parents, who were visiting NYC for their first time feel so comfortable and excites for their trip!At breakfast we met Benson who had a smile the entire time. We appreciated how efficient he was and how much he seemed to enjoy his job.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed 3 nights. Hotel was clean, comfortable, and staff was very friendly and helpful. Breakfast selection was different each day and Geraldine made sure it was to our liking and made sure we had everything we needed.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Just returned from a 3 night stay, my son selected this hotel as he’s familiar with NYC and I’m glad he did. Ideal location and the hotel is modern and clean. Our room was cleaned daily and toiletries replenished. Hotel staff polite, friendly, welcoming and helpful. If I visit the Big Apple again I would have no hesitation in booking this hotel again

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The number of hotel choices in NYC is overwhelming so I chose one I’m familiar with. We stayed here for three nights and found the room tiny (typical for the city) but clean and conveniently located. We were lucky to get a room on the 30th floor - wonderful view and the elevators were always empty when they got to us - and they can get quite crowded. Great desk staff. Breakfast had many choices but seemed subpar to other Hampton locations I’ve tried. Overall, a dependable choice if you want to be close to the Times Square area.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel was visitor friendly with lovely staff, nothing was too much trouble. The rooms were large, clean and comfortable and ideally placed for all of our sightseeing needs. We booked a package holiday from the UK and were delighted to have free Wi-fi plus complimentary tea, coffee, water in reception. The breakfast was self service and plenty of choice catering for everyone's needs. I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: They say it's the little things that count,well our stay here the big and little things were all fantastic.From the greeting at reception,our room cleaned everyday,the wonderful view from our room,the complimentary breakfast(yes it can get busy but a sign with a traffic light system stating what times are busy)was great prob saved us at least $40.The location for us could not be better,Times Square round the corner,Subway across the road,Port Authority Bus Terminal at the other end of the street!.The lifts can get busy but in the big scheme of things it 's not that bad. Then little things,comp coffee all day and night,a free pack up to take out with you if you are out for the day,free bottles of water offerd again to go out or on the way to the airport,complimentary cookies on reception,lovely and warm.....!!! Then there's the staff,all warm and friendly always willing to help and special mention to GERALDINE who we got to know at breakfast,so friendly and helpful,from Ireland but lived NYC 25 years,she can give you great advice on where to visit and such a lovely person..can't recommend this hotel highly enough,can't wait to go back.....AMAZING STAY!!!!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We booked this hotel because we were working a very large convention and needed easy access to the Javits. We were going to there for seven nights and saw all the glowing reviews. We arrived at the hotel at 3am after being stuck sitting on our place for a 2/12 hour ground hold caused by bad weather in New York. We got checked in and when the elevator door opened we saw the door to our room just opposite in a narrow hall. Tired and cranky, our reaction to the room was "why did we book this hotel?" After a night's sleep we saw that the room was actually nice and very spacious for Manhattan and we realized that we heard no noise from the elevator, hall or nearby rooms. The location is fantastic. The subway is virtually across the street. There are plenty of restaurants nearby, shopping, theaters. The room was very clean with lots of towels, storage, comfortable beds. Breakfast got crowded at times, but the food variety was decent and there was a lot of staff. They offered carry out boxes when they saw that I was trying to carry food up to the room. There is coffee round the clock in the lobby along with hot water and tea and cocoa packets. In the evening they bake cookies as well. The best thing about this hotel is the staff. Everyone was helpful and cheerful. Several staff members really went out of their way to ask if we needed anything. For Hilton Gold members, they offered daily water and had a selection of snacks to choose from. We found it was more than we needed, but they always asked if we wanted something more. All in all, this was the best staff I have encountered at any . hotel.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Close to Times Square and the subway.Within walking distance of several attractions.Clean rooms, with comfortable bed, pillows and complimentary toiletries were great brands! Staff were all friendly and helpful. When requested our vehicle it was ready out front for us in no time. Would stay again without hesitation.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed in the Hampton Inn Time Square Central for 5 nights in October 2018, 4 of us shared a double room. The hotel itself is ideally situated right in the middle of Times Square, at the end of the road is the Port Authority bus station and on the corner of the other side of the road is the subway station, 2 min walk to Times Square proper and all the hustle and bustle of the city. Our check in was quick and pain free, staff were great, friendly and welcoming after a long day of travelling. Our room was on the 21st floor, big enough for us and our cases (and later bags and bags of shopping!) and there are 3 elevators that service all the floors (only really really busy in the morning but longest wait was about 5 mins). We took the buffet breakfast option and have to say we were really glad we did, there are all the breakfast foods anyone could wish for, we mastered the art of the waffle maker by the second day (became such old hands at it we were demonstrating how it worked to the newbies), but there are fruits, hot items, yogurts, cerial etc....something for everyone. Also the breakfast supervisor Geraldine was a joy to talk to first thing in the morning, always humerous, pleasant, positive and full of useful info about the best way to get somewhere, the best places to shop, basically a mine of information happy to answer all our questions, which we really appreciated. Geraldine also kept the dining room ticking over with no problem, she would clean and clear your table without you noticing she'd even been there! The housekeping staff were great, the room was cleaned daily and to a high standard. Also need to mention Louis (concierge), what a asset to the hotel! Louis is one of those guys that knows all the inside/local knowledge and can furnish you with directions to anywhere, get you a taxi, and ensure you have a wee bag of supplies for the airport (water, sweets, nuts...). We were able to store our luggage at the hotel until we left later in the day, were able to access bathroom for quick freshen up and change before leaving for the airport. Would totally recommend the Hampton Inn Times square to anyone, we had a fab holiday and are already looking to book to back again....
user_name:
Saffron R
South Ayrshire, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Very efficient and friendly hotel staff. Rooms are very clean and well maintained, The location is great, close to many theaters, restaurants and subway lines. We really enjoyed our stay and the FREE breakfast available every morning is a nice addition.. Breakfast ambassador Geraldine will make you feel welcome and make sure you have everything you need. She is part of the reason I stay at this hotel. Great experience!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location if you want to explore time Square area! Its also a few blocks from the 5th Avenue store! Rooms are clean. Not as roomy as your other Hampton Inn hotels but you’re in NYC and space is a luxury! It comes with free continental breakfast. But I should say that to have breakfast as soon as it opens coz it can get very crowded and no tables avail when you come down around 8am. Though there some few seats in the lobby! Food is the usual. Long line on the waffle maker even when they’ve 3 waffle makers available. Staff are friendly and courteous! Reasonably price considering the location!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I booked 3 rooms for 1 night last weekend where price was a bit steeper than now; after all it was Columbus Day weekend where it was almost impossible to get 3 rooms. I booked with the hotel direct which was the same price as all the booking websites. The Hotel is beautiful, very clean and has a huge breakfast room with a great selection of breakfast items. The Hotel rooms are small, but modern and serve the purpose. No complaints and the location is perfect to everything you want to see and do; I love Hampton Inns, no matter where they are and I have never had a bad experiense.
user_name:
sandrahannelore
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We enjoyed our stay in your hotel. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast was very good and one of your breakfast staff (Geraldine)was a credit to your hotel- so efficient and friendly. The only two negative things were our first impression of the hotel when they couldn’t find our room booking. The other was the lack of room cleaning for two days. Apart from this we were satisfied with the size of the rooms and cleaning the other three days we stayed.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I visit NYC 3-4 times a year, and always choose this hotel. The staff is fantastic, everyone of them. They will “ bend over backwards “ to accommodate your needs. The rooms are clean, quiet, and fairly spacious. Hallways are kept free of any garbage or clutter, and the elevators are operating much faster I’ve noticed. Close to everything, but surprisingly quiet street, so getting a good nights sleep is not an issue. Plus the pillows, bedding, and mattress are very comfortable. The dining area is kept clean and runs smoothly. Always being cleaned and refilled. The complimentary coffee always hot and fresh. I can’t say enough good things, and can’t wait for my next visit.
user_name:
LauraD181
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: For ourselves this hotel was ideal for a 1st time visit to the Big Apple. Room was a decent size with all the usual facilities, hairdryer, toiletries, coffee maker, iron and ironboard etc. Staff were helpful with a concierge through the day to help with advice and bookings for excursions. Breakfast had ample choice with a grab and go option if so desired. Some travellers complained about lack of seating but we did not encounter this as there was always a quick turnover of fellow diners. Fresh coffee was served in reception 24/7 with free cookies available early evening. We opted for a room on the 7th floor and vad no problem calling the lift. Other travellers on higher floors seem to have encountered problems.Location is ideal for Times Square, the subway is a 100m walk. The street is not quiet but is not busy by New York standards. For a first time visit to this city we found the hotel suited our needs. It is certainly not extravagant but caters well for a short city break.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: There is a reason for the price! Despite them telling you there is wifi, we were not able to get a signal. It reached a point that we went to the ATT store thinking it was our phones. You had to go out to the sidewalk to look up items, check GPS, contact UBER, check email. Very frustrating for a business traveller. Three elevators constantly full forced us to use stairs. Free breakfast (carbs, carbs, carbs,) is so busy you better eat at 6:30 AM. Friendly front desk staff and free coffee in the lobby but I would not stay again.
user_name:
Debra B
Nassau, New Providence Island

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I come to NY often. Of all the hotels I've stayed at, this is the best one for the money. It's a good price, extremely clean, wonderful and polite staff and a great breakfast. It's ideal if you are planning to go to Broadway theater. It's also quiet!The subway is across the street if you are traveling around the city.I highly recommend this hotel and will stay there again!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Second time staying in this hotel in a month, the location was perfect, friendly staff, walking distance to about everything, 1/2 block from times square, confy bed, outstanding location in NYC. Highly recommended.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The location was perfect. Easy walking distance to everything! Best of all the subway station was less than 40 yards to front door so if you are flying in from LGA you can take a bus to the subway and be at the hotel for under $5 bucks. Although UBER is a good option as well for $30 to $60 dollars depending on time of day. Depending on traffic the bus and subway could be faster.The staff was super friendly and helpful. Could not be better! Who said New Yawkers are rude! Not this staff! Breakfast in the morning was great with a large variety of everything. Fresh and different each morning.I would stay here again in a second!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed three nights at this hotel and found it to be wonderfully located and close to all the things we wanted to do.The hotel is small, jammed up next to a Holiday Inn Express, which shares the same facade. The rooms are small, but comfortable and the wifi works very well.What doesn't work well are the elevators. There's two small and slow elevators in the building that quickly fill up and makes many stops. We found that it was easier to take the stairs from the lobby, rather than waiting for an empty elevator.The big attraction to this hotel was the room rate and location. It's lower than many of the mid town hotels in the area. It's within walking distance to many of the Times Square attractions and restaurants.The location is actually on the edge of the garment district, but it's also convenient for Broadway shows, if you don't mind walking 5 or 6 blocks.Breakfast in the hotel is served in a back room on the first floor of the hotel. It can get busy and crowded. The kitchen staff works very hard to please everyone. There can be quite a line for the waffle iron. Patience is key.We enjoyed our stay there. The Mercato Italian restaurant down the street is quite good, and there's 2 Brothers' Pizza place down on 9th avenue at the corner of 40th for takeout. Really good.We walked to the Intrepid aircraft carrier from the hotel as well as Times Square. It's very conveniently located.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This is our 3rd stay at this property. The hotel is about 1/2 block from Times Square and is close to the subway, restaurants and retail stores. The employees at the hotel are accommodating and pleasant from the moment you enter the front door. Especially noteworthy is Darron in the breakfast area. Darron always exhibits a "smiling and welcoming face". He always insures that you have everything you need for your breakfast. He obviously loves his job and wants the guest to have a good experience at the hotel.Our next trip to Manhattan will include a stay at this Hampton.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: All the staff at the hotel was terrific and check in was a breeze. The rooms were very clean and the bathroom was newly renovated. The service at the front desk was very helpful. We were especially impressed with Darren at brakefast.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed here for one night. It is in a good location in the Times square area. The staff was friendly and helpful. The breakfast in the morning was also very good. The rooms were clean. I would note that the shower was just a standing shower and did not have a tub. Not an important issue for us. The property has a modern decor.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed for a week with my son on a sports holiday from UK. Great quiet location. Delivered what it says, well appointed rooms can’t expect much bigger in NYC. Functional breakfast gets busy after 8am. Very friendly staff throughout the hotel. Wait times for the lifts can be longer during breakfast but hey if you are on vacation so what. Will definitely have this on my list for my next visit

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Amazing location. Friendly Staff. Clean room. Good breakfast. Very recomended. Close to the Subway and Times Square. Many stores and restaurants around. Good value. Second visit this month and very satisfied.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Perfect location, just 1/2 block up from the bus terminal and short walk to the theatre district. Plenty of shopping and eateries near by. Most importantly, the hotel was very clean and the staff was terrific. Breakfast was fine, with fresh fruit and bagels among other items.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed for a week and all was well, nice breakfast, clean tidy rooms, friendly helpful staff, had no issues whatsoever, great location for the main tourist attractions, Times square no than 10-15 minute walk, what more can you say other than definitely recommend.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: From the moment of check in to when we left, this hotel bent over backwards trying to help make our first time in New York City a happy memory. My brother and his wife met us at our hotel as we were checking in. When we were offered water and cookies, they were as well even though they weren't "guests." This was a very hospitable gesture in a place where everything is pricy. The room was bigger than most and the hotel itself was as close to "pristine" as I have encountered. We had room service each day. The breakfast was very good and lasted us until dinnertime. We were fortunate to find "normally priced" restaurant a block away. (Ruby Tuesdays) The proximity of the hotel to both the several Metro stops as well as to our "Hop on Hop off" Gray line tour stops. Because we were first timers, we didn't realize we needed to book a shuttle to return to the airport 24 hours in advance, but John, the Consierge, was able to find just what we needed in a couple of hours on a very busy day. A real advantage to staying here is that when you check out, they will let you check your bags with the bell boy to be kept in their secured storage area for up to 24 hours without charge. (That deserved a big tip!) Doing so made it possible for us to spend several more hours in the city. This is a great place to stay in a convenient location a minute's walk off TImes Square. It was quiet on our 6th floor. I loved how secure I felt when I realized no one could access the elevator without a room key. We'd highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I spent two nights here midweek for a tradeshow. After a long day, it was nice to come back to a quiet, clean, and comfortable room. I was on the 17th floor and on the street side of the building and aside from the periodic sirens, the room was quiet. I have stayed in many hotels in NYC and my room in this one was surprisingly large.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I was so impressed with my experience at this hotel. The location is excellent for a trip centered around seeing Broadway shows. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. Breakfast was very busy but well managed. I was initially concerned when I realized that our room was directly behind the elevators thinking that we would hear elevator noise, but I didn't hear a peep!! Any peep. Not the elevators, other hotel guests or the noise of NYC!! What a wonderful change from my first stay in NYC at a boutique hotel. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.The only minor complaint would be the elevators. The only time they seemed busy was in the mornings, but that was a painfully slow ride down to breakfast.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This was our first visit to NYC and it was a relief to be able to stay at a Hampton because we knew what to expect! We got the same wonderful service and room that we have gotten anywhere we have stayed when booking with Hampton! It was like home away from home!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed here for a week, the staff are very friendly and efficient. The breakfast is sufficient the rooms spotless and of a good standard. Liked- no in room mini fridge thus no you had this..... tea, coffee etc available 24/7 in reception free of charge. We calculated we saved around $300 in breakfast and drink costs over the week.Suggestions to improve larger towels in the bathrooms.Great time you can’t go far wrong with this place, 5 min walk to Times Square.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Hampton Inn Hotel exceed my expectations, even i had booked it last minute for a very decent price the hotel was amazing.My room was much bigger than most hotel rooms in New York and the bathroom was spacious.Breakfast is huge with more than enough choices.The hotel located steps away from Times Square and Port authority.Highly recommended.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location and great staff. Hotel has perfect amenities and it’s syaff makes you feel welcome. Definitely surpassed our experience of a competitor down the street. Will definitely look forward to returning.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: For the life of me I can't understand why this hotel is rated so high. The things deserve two starts are the location and that it's clean.I'll start with value for money we paid $307 per night booked a month ago on the hotel's site. When we arrived at the hotel we found out we paid 80% more than current rates (also directly to the hotel's site). With a cold laconic correspondence with Hilton that got us very annoyed at the very beginning of our stay.When we arrived at the hotel the receptionist was very kind and on a by the way suggested we will have breakfast early because the lifts might be busy between 6am and 10am... Little did we know...For a hotel with 25 floors and so many rooms you would expect the horel to provide suitable dining area and lifts. Hampton Inn forgot to do that. Or simply doesn't care.There are 3 lifts for the whole building. Stopping at every floor. We found ourselves cramped well beyond maximum weigh for the lift with people saying they have been waiting for the lift for 30 minutes. Worse than the subway!When we arrived at the fameus breakfast finally, it is nothing special or interesting it just not enough. Not enough food to feed the number of people at the dining area and not not enough room to sit. It was so crowded and loud and as result dirty as well.The cherry on the top is the use of paper plates and plastic tableware. Bad for the environment and basically disrespectful. I would expect a hotel proud of its Hilton heritage to have higher standards in service and operation.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The hotel is in the nice location - close to Times Square, central bus stops and numerous cafes. I had one of the most pleasant experience since I started travelling. The staff was super helpful, professional and friendly, they also checked me in early, gave me bottled water for the trip to the airport. I really loved the breakfast options, I went between 7 and 8 am and there were still plenty. Each day there would be an egg option, sausages/patties, fresh fruits, oats with dried fruits etc, yogurts, bagels with butter, cream cheese and honey and packed jams, morning pastries, tea and coffee, there even was a batter to make your own pancakes with fruits and whipped cream. It was very convenient and saved me some money on breakfast. There are some very good tee/coffee options 24/7 in the lobby too. The The building is 31 fl high, so even though I had the top floor, I couldn't see much of Manhattan, but at least it wasn't looking at a wall or someone's window.I loved the room - the bed and pillows were very comfortable. Plenty of power sockets next to the bed and desk. Because of the high floor, I couldn't hear the traffic. They also have very nice toiletries and the bath was clean and modern.Overall, I really enjoyed the experience and next time I'm staying in a hotel of the same level, I'll definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My spouse and I stayed at the Hampton Inn Times Square Central for one night on a Saturday evening in late May 2018. We reserved our room online using the Hilton HHonors website, and we remitted Hilton points for a complimentary stay. Although we were offered the option to check in online the day prior to our stay, we declined.The Hampton Inn Times Square Central opened in June 2015 on West 41st Street (between 7th and 8th Avenues) in Midtown, just one block from the Port Authority bus terminal (which also offers vehicle parking and subway stops). This property is centrally located to many tourist areas such as Times Square, Broadway theaters, shops and restaurants, and Bryant Park. It is a few blocks walk to Penn Station, Madison Square Garden, the Empire State Building, and Macy’s Herald Square.The hotel offers a 32nd floor rooftop observation deck, complimentary buffet breakfast (or alternately, a grab-and-go weekday breakfast bag), fitness center, private meeting space for 12 people, and a pantry shop (where you can purchase drinks, snacks, forgotten items, and souvenirs). Local artwork and photographs decorate the public spaces. This newer hotel features what Hampton Inn calls its “Perfect Mix Lobby”, which has seating and lighting options for both business and vacation travelers. The Hampton Inn Times Square Central offers 300 rooms in several categories: King, Two Doubles, King City View, or Two Doubles City View. Room amenities include complimentary Wi-Fi, flat-screen TVs, coffee makers, safes (that fit a laptop), irons/ironing boards, and clock radios. Bathrooms include oversize walk-in showers (most do not have a traditional bathtub/shower combination), hairdryers, and toiletries (soap, shampoo, conditioner, body lotion). Although we booked a king room, when we checked in early, only double-bedded rooms were available, so we accepted one. Our room was cozy, with a closed/desk/TV unit located opposite the beds, and a bathroom with a sliding door next to one of them. The bathroom itself was a good size, larger than some we have seen in the city. Although our room was located directly across from the elevator bank (with three elevators), it was quiet and we did not hear any hallway noise. But it was on the smaller size, the beds were doubles instead of queens, and the odd location of the bathroom door was bothersome and did not provide maximum privacy. (Positioned at the middle of the floor near the elevators, we think that our room was a bit smaller than some others and also that our bathroom door was in an alternate location than in other rooms, but we cannot say for sure.)Our stay at the Hampton Inn Time Square Central was acceptable, but we prefer alternate Hilton-branded locations in the same area for similar cost.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We went to this hotel just for a day/night. When we got there the valet guy was outside. He was so helpful, told us what we needed to do as far as getting our belongings out of the car, etc. We checked in early, our room was clean and perfect, as all Hampton Inns have always been. When we were leaving, the same valet guy was very helpful, made sure our car was ready at the time we wanted it. Would def return to this hotel.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We very much enjoyed our stay here. The staff was extremely helpful with issues we had about potentially extending our stay due to a hurricane in North Carolina. They went out of their way to figure out how to help us. It is so close to the theater district that we could walk to all of the plays we attended. We will be back.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed here for an overnight. We like the area and last year we stayed at a Hilton a few doors down and had a bad experience with their staff, and did not want a repeat of it this year. Plusses-It has a great location on 41st. Its near times square, but you don't have the crowds that are on 42nd street. Last year we stayed at the nearby Hilton and you could not walk out the door without people constantly coming up to you without pushing something in your face, trying to sell you something.-The rooms were clean and well maintained.-I thought their staff was very polite and helpful. You got the impression that you care about people and actually want to work there.Minuses-The hotel offers a free breakfast, but the area was cramped and the other guests were pushy. I joked to my wife that I was lucky not to have gotten an elbow in my ribcage. It was so crowded that I was ready to go to the nearby McDonalds for breakfast. The hotel has posted a list of times when the breakfast area is the busiest. Clearly more needs to be done.-The hotel advertises a rooftop deck, however it is small, there is no place to sit down there and the view is not that good. -Even though its near Times square, you will not get a Times Square view from the rooms.-The rooms need a refrigerator. There wasn't one in our room.-The lobby is small and seemed crowded.If you are not that concerned about the view, or getting an elbow in your ribcage at the breakfast, this may the hotel for you. Will we be back? Maybe.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed here for 4 nights early Sept. Hotel is clean,a/c is good, breakfast included and is so Central to everything. Staff were friendly. Breakfast was good with a choice of cereals,toast,muffins and pastries,fruit,waffles,yogurts and aalternate scrambled egg or omlette,bacon or sausage. This drinks and fruit juices too. Couldn't fault it. The hotel had free tea,coffee and water in reception and warm cookies were brought out in the early evening,these were yum! Room was decent size with tv,showerhead over bath. Towels and toiletries were replenished every day. No extra surprise taxes or fees though somehow our card had $200+ taken off it when we got bk to UK but after a few emails this was refunded on. Apparently it was money on hold but somehow it got taken. All in all a great hotel and would return

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This little gem is steps from Time Square, yet quiet, clean and comfortable. You are immediately greater by a super friendly staff. Check in took minutes! The room is very quiet and well appointed. Breakfast is included which is a bonus! Coming back after a long day of sight seeing my husband was thrilled to find warm chocolate chip cookies waiting for him at the front desk.I can't say enough how friendly and courteous the staff is! I recommend this hotel 100%!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed at the Hampton for 5 nights. From the minute we arrived late at night, until check out, the service was fantastic. The rooms was lovely and clean, the bed was really comfy. Coffee machine in the room, the staff are all so friendly and helpful. There is a free buffet breakfast available every morning between 6 and 10am. Lots of choice, free tea and coffee 24 hours a day in the lobby. The little shop area is idea for peckish people coming back from a night out. If we ever go back to NY, would definatley stay here again. It's literally 2 mins from the subway, and centre of Time's Square.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel is a great location to the heart of the tourist area for any visitor to NYC. The Hotel staff is always friendly and willing to assist in whatever you may need. If you come out of the building, walk across the street, you can go into McDonald's where you can walk through and find yourself on one of the busiest streets in NYC with lots of food and shopping

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I have been staying at this hotel for the past two years - I've visited at least 10 times. I have never been disappointed in anything. The staff members are very helpful and accommodating. The service they provide is great!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This is my 3rd straight year stayed at this hotel. Just like last year, points redemption for the 5 nights stay. However, on this year's stay, I'm beginning to care more about little things that I think this Hampton Inn could improve on. Perhaps, change the carpets and the showers. Regardless if they plan to remodel the hotel or not, I am still a big fan of this hotel.
user_name:
Anna L
San Francisco, United States

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We just stayed for one night so that we could see a show. The location of the hotel is perfect in that it is right between Penn Station and most of the Broadway shows. Staff was friendly. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Overall good experience, Clean rooms, Great breakfast. The staff was always present if we had any questions. Cant beat the location, steps from the heart of Times Square. The only thing is that they definetly need to put refridgerators in the rooms.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We visited NYC this past weekend to watch Hamilton and tour the other Hamilton sights in the city. I had originally wanted to book this hotel, but it was full when I was looking to book. Lucky for us, I checked again and was able to get a two double bed room. For NYC it’s a standard size room, but the bathroom seemed bigger than the typical room and even had a bathtub.Prior to checkin I received a text from the manager looking to answer any questions before we arrived. I was curious about the parking situation and received a quick reply to my query. Upon checkin, we were greeted warmly and were able to check in right away - with enough time to get ready for the play (which was incredible). The concierge was beyond helpful! Breakfast was the usual buffet fair, but was well stocked and efficient. The check out process was also seamless.Location and proximity to the Times Square subway is the best! I wouldn’t hesitate to recommend this hotel and will definitely stay here again. Thanks Hampton Inn!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed for one night before a flight the next day. Reception was very friendly and efficient. The hotel had a nicely decorated lobby and very friendly staff. They held our luggage for us the next day after checkout so we could explore the city before our late flight. The location was perfect! It didn't take long at all to walk to Times Square. Our room was small, but had a big, comfortable bed. The breakfast area was really crowded the next morning, so I would go down as early as possible. Our overall experience was good and we would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great staff and great location. Small room with high price. Parking accommodation takes a long time. Updated bathrooms are very nice. Small lobby. Good breakfast. The higher the floor the more quiet the rest. Lots of street noise.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Family of 4 adults , staying in a 1 room 2 double bed room. was a little tight, but we were able to get threw our 3 nights 4 days stay. It is very well placed . Just 1 block from all the action of Time Square, which during Labor day Week-end was packed. room was clean and bathroom was big enough for our family. keep in mind when visiting NY City you are not often in the room. Our room was nx to the elevator, but we heard nothing coming from the elevator. and the noise from the city was not bothersome to us while in the room. The WI FI worked very well.We found the price of $58/night for the car to be expensive, but than again, it is valet parking. you also do not have immediate access to your car, it is parked about 4 to 5 blocks away, when checking out, they advise to give them a good 40 minutes before getting your car, which took that exact time to get our car. The service during breakfast from the 2 employees that were there during our stay was very good. The breakfast was ok. Would stay here if we were to go back to NY.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The location and complimentary breakfast were the reasons we chose this Hampton Inn. We were very pleased with the cleanliness of the entire facility, the helpfulness of the staff, and the value. Every staff member smiled, asked how we were doing, made small talk, and offered to help with any question we had. The hospitality here matched that of the South, which surprised us for NYC. It is obvious that this staff loves their place of work, and the work they do. On another note, even though we were just a block away from Times Square, there was no noise at night.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My wife and I were in town for the US Open tennis. The staff here is super friendly and helpful. A big deal for us. The hotel was very clean. We had a great room on the 28th floor. Lovely view. The elevators were quite fast and not real busy despite the large number of people staying here. The location was one block off the main streets. Very quiet. Many many great restaurants close by. We always ate breakfast at a local restaurant. The Hampton Inn’s breakfast got very crowded. But with so many local restaurants nearby it was not a problem for us. The subway was very close to the hotel as well.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Location Location Location. Everything was excellent. Those staffs who work at the breakfast times were super super super excellent; Geraldine, Benson, Doreen, and Franics were extremely nice and were very high efficiency workers during breakfast peak time. As well as our clean lady who looked after our room, sorry forgot to ask her name; she made our room (606) was very clean and tidy, Like to give all of the above staffs TWO Thumbs Up of their super hard working job.Therefore, for the front desk Jeremy NG was a highly patient staff when there was a lot of problems on my booking. Jeremy tried his best to solve the problem even suggested me to talk to his manager next day; he did not leave the problem behind. Lastly, front office supervisor Hicham who continued to due with my issues next day and explained to me all the possibility how, why it could happen on my booking. As a result, problem solved and happy ending with a big happy face. Hampton Inn should keep all of the above mentioned names at work as they all are the treausre of the hotel.Excellent Excellent Excellent ==>highly recommend and certainly, surely,undoubtedly, and absolutely will stay again in the future.Hotel has free complementary bottled water, cookies, grab and go mini package, shower cap, razor, shower cream ....

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Good location. Front desk staff (Rachel and Natali) are very friendly and go out of their way to help guests. So is the young lady at concierge, who gave excellent directions on how to go to US Open. She was thorough. Breakfast place can be a circus in the morning with huge lines. Some one forgot to tell breakfast folks to SMILE. Or they must be under lot of stress. The omelette guy makes excellent omelettes and very friendly.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location and value for your moneyClose to all the shows and shopping and never more than a short walk or $5 taxi to anywhereFriendly staff to pamper all your needs, great breakfast if you choose that option and always eager to assist w anythingHighly recommend

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed here over Labor Day weekend. On our travels to NYC we normally stay in midtown, but for this trip we wanted to be close to theatres, since we were there for just the weekend. We booked a king studio...and it was big enough for two adults and a teen. The king bed was quite comfy. Sadly , the sofa bed was not . Our teen after one night decided to just sleep on the couch part...as the mattress sagged badly...and several springs were missing that supported the mattress. She slept better on the sofa. The room was clean... though lacking a couple of parts on lamps; no laundry bag. Not deal breakers. We were on a high floor facing the the river ... so it was quiet. We found breakfast at the hotel very busy ... but plenty of choices. Would choose hotel again ... if staying in that area.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The rooms were clean and they had complimentary breakfast. Everyone was so helpful and knowledgeable. Walking distance from time square which made it so easy to get any where. We definitely will be back.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We had three rooms for Labor Day weekend in New York. The rooms were clean and new and spacious for NYC. Jeremy at the front desk made sure to get the three rooms together as we requested which we appreciated since we didn’t want the teenagers too far away. Housekeeping was done well. The only thing I would suggest to improve is that the breakfast area is small for the number of people who use it and the toasters could work better. The breakfast itself was the standard Hampton breakfast which includes omelets, a breakfast meat, cereals, yogurt, fruit and breads/pastries. Staff in the breakfast area did a good job of cleaning tables as people left.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We loved the Hampton Inn. Perfect location and a great hotel with great service. Nice clean room and nice breakfast. Very friendly staff. I would definitely stay again on my next trip to NYC. We really enjoyed our stay

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We had an amazing stay at the Hampton Inn Times Square. The rooms were comfortable, the complimentary breakfast was perfect before a long day and the staff was friendly and helpful. We solely used the subway and it was literally across the street or around the corner. I would highly recommend this property. We toured the city the first day and were at the US Open the next 2 days.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great Mother- Daughter weekend. Location was excellent. McDonald across street. Safe & quiet location, one street away from the action on 42 st. Hot tea & coffee 24/7. Good breakfast. Near all subway stops.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This solution is really a very good balance between a not expensive solution (on a NYC point pf view) and a very central location. Rooms are very comfortable and clean with wonderful beds. People is nice.Soundproofing is fine also if your room is on 8th.Breakfast is included and international with fresh fruits; very appreciated.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location and clean and comfortable room. Easy access to the subway. Small room, but what do you expect in NYC? The rooms are nearly renovated, including the bathrooms. I'm not sure why 200 characters are a min for reviews?

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Couldn’t beat the location and cost for the time of year. Rooms were up to date and very clean. Front desk staff was terrific and very informative! Would definitely stay again and recommend to anyone!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Would consider staying here again. Great location. Quiet. Comfortable. Was perfect for our trip. Staff was very pleasant and helpful. Convenient to where we were planning to go. AC worked great. Very happy with accommodations.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The location of this hotel was Awesome. The staff was amazing and very welcoming. The breakfast staff did an AMAZING job of keeping the food hot and stocked; being that the hotel was sold out. My husband and I enjoyed staying at Hampton Inn Manhattan/Times Square Central and will be staying here on our future returns.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Lilly, thank you so much for catering for our amazing stay. The location, bedroom and breakfast far exceeded our expectation despite it being a 3 star hotel. It could easily be a 4-5 star hotel. The 24/7 beverage /refreshment drink and evening cookies offered at the lobby just added that extra comfort/ convenience after a long day out and about. Thank you too for accommodating our request for an early check in and allocating a baby crib ! Will definitely recommend friends / relatives to stay over at your hotel. Have a great week ahead, James and family.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Clean and comfortable hotel in fabulous Times Square location!!! Wonderful staff who will help you with any need. I highly recommend this hotel is a great value for this area!!! We live in New Jersey but wanted to spend the night in NYC after seeing a show and thoroughly enjoyed our stay!!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We booked a room with 2 double beds for Broadway show weekend. Our room was smaller than a typical Hampton Inn but I've learned to expect that in NYC where every square foot has value. We missed some of the usual amenities like a refrigerator and microwave, but we brought our own cooler and there was an ice machine on the next floor down. The staff was VERY friendly. They even offered water and snacks as we left the hotel for the drive home. The room was very clean. The mattress and pillows were comfortable. The walk-in shower was great. We were on the 7th floor looking out over 41st Street and didn't have much of a view but the views from higher floors may have been better. I would definitely return.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Myself and my Husband stayed here for my 30th bday from Thurs 23rd-Sunday 26th. The hotel was perfect for location & the rooms were lovely and clean. Staff couldn't have been more friendly or lovely and even after we'd checked out couldn't do enough to help us. Breakfast is free although a little busy. There is free coffee/tea/water in the reception area which is such a nice touch and much appreciated when returning after a busy day of sight seeing. Would 100% stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Good size rooms for NYC, great location and breakfast was plentiful. We did not experience big queues at breakfast but we usually had finished breakfast by 8.15. Plastic cutlery and paper plates are not ideal but the food and beverages are good and plentiful

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed here for a week and it was awesome! Right by Times Square. We were able to walk everywhere or take the subway. Super nice room. I thought it was quite spacious considering all I've heard about the size of hotel rooms in NYC. The room was spotless and we were given nice toiletries. The wifi was good. Safe in the room, good amount of dresser space and a smallish closet. Comfortable bed and pillows. The breakfasts were plentiful and a lot of fresh coffee. I liked that there was also iced water in the lobby and fresh cookies at the front desk. Nice concierge who was helpful and arranged for us to get back to the airport. Just a perfect spot. Nice pub a few steps from the hotel. Will definitely stay there again the next time we're in NYC, which I hope is soon! Friendly staff and very helpful!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Brought the family for a stay in NYC. We loved the place. The hotel was great. Awesome location right by Time Square. Was able to walk the square, to Broadway play, shopping... everything was close by.Staff was friendly and the breakfast was a good selection of hot and cold items.This will definitely be our go to hotel when we come back.Oh, and there were warm cookies in the evening!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Perfect location for a fabulous NYC vacation! It’s suoer close to the Port Authority and the 42nd St train station. We walked almost everywhere! The hotel was clean, comfortable and accommodating! The fitness center has a great variety of dumb bells!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Never actually made it to this hotel. Had reservations for a king-bed room; wanted to change to two double beds. Called and spoke to the front desk, and was told that I could switch for a minimal upcharge. All good, right? Wrong. When I received email confirmation for the new reservation, both the dates AND the price were completely wrong. It then took TWO HOURS to cancel that reservation (at some point, I gave up on the idea that it could be made right!), and the hotel staff did their best to charge a cancellation fee. Not cool at all. Needless to say, my better half and I will be spending the dates of our original reservation in a different hotel.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Front desk staff ruined experience of staying here. Terrible attitude, unfriendly, and unhelpful. Tried to sell us private car service to airport and pretended not to know what a taxi would cost as comparison. Treated groups of people differently for questionable reasons. Very unethical behavior.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed here for 4 days with a tour bus group. The hotel is in a GREAT location. Great location for walking around the town and for catching the subway. Staff was EXCELLENT! Breakfast in the morning was very good. And the warm cookies in the afternoon were a nice treat.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This is a great, clean, friendly hotel within walking distance of all the major Times Square attractions. It's easy to get to from the subway and grabbing an Uber is no problem. I was on the 16th floor and only a couple of times was I annoyed by the elevator situation - it is a very busy hotel but the elevators do move quick. Front desk staff is super friendly and professional. This is my second time staying here and I plan to make this my regular NYC destination.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Our room was on a top floor with a city view. It was very clean and pleasant with a comfortable king bed, soft sheets and fluffy towels. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful with check-in and check-out. Lobby is lovely with coffee, tea, cold water available 24/7. Breakfast was wonderful, again with helpful staff who made you feel welcome and comfortable. Location of the hotel is perfect for theatres, restaurants, shopping, etc. Definitely plan on staying here again!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Just stayed here 4 nights with family of 4. First let me say the rooms are very nice as is the lobby. Service was great and very friendly. Breakfast offering was pretty good. Location is great if you want Times Square/Central. Now for the downsides and reason for only 3 stars, some of which the hotel cannot change. #1: there are only 3 elevators servicing 30 floors so average elevator transport time was 7 minutes each way. During "off times" (ie middle of the day) you might only wait 3-5. The elevator waits are EXTREMELY annoying. I suggest you request a lower floor and use the stairs. #2 construction noise: We were awakened 3 of the 4 mornings by VERY loud construction adjacent to the hotel. We had "white noise" makers on to help with sleep, but it made no difference. It was a heavy pounding and it looks like construction just started. #3:. Breakfast chaos: while the food offering and area is nice (and staff very helpful), when you have ~ 300 rooms trying to eat around the same time in that small an area, it is very chaotic and hectic. You either get lucky and get a spot to sit, or need to take it back to the room (see #1 above). Breakfast was a stressful, unpleasant experience. The two closest ice machines to us on 22nd and 27th floors were both broken....I expect more from a $350/night hotel. Due to all this, I could not recommend this hotel as nice as the staff was.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed for 5 nights and loved it! Clean lobby with 24hrs access to cold drinking water and hot coffee in the lobby. Friendly and helpful staff. Hotel is very close to subway stations so it was easy for us to explore other parts of the city. It is a couple blocks away from the iconic Times Square area so the sidewalks are not too crowded which is nice. Continental breakfast includes waffles, fresh fruits, pastries, bagels, toasts, oatmeal, bacon/sausages, eggs (both hardboiled and omelletes), and drinks. Close to numerous restaurants and stores. Will definitely come back again!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel is located right off times square. Perfect for going to plays or sightseeing. Sightseeing bus was half a block away. Night staff was excellent. Complimentary breakfast was very good. Family friendly.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We basically went to see some shows but also to take some short day trips. Hotel is very clean and tucked down 41st street, just a few blocks from most theaters and also 42nd street MTA station which you can take you almost anywere in the city (get the 7 day pass if you are there for at least 5 days). Staff is extremely nice, breakfast is truly free and a really big variety. Seating is tight but they did a good job fitting as many tables in as they could, and they are ok with you eating in the lobby (or take it to your room). Three elevators that can be a wait at times, I personally would recommend getting a room on the lower floors and using the stairs sometime. Definitely a great family hotel for "kids" of all ages.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My wife and I spent a week at this hotel while in NYC to see plays, explore museums and Central Park,and visit Hamilton's home. The location was convenient to the theatres and the subway. The staff members were extremely polite and sincere about ensuring our stay was good. The room was comfortable and spotless. The housekeeper did a magnificent job keeping our room clean and towels replenished. Breakfast was delicious and free which saved us at least $150 for the week on breakfast. We will stay here when we return to NYC.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: For my son's first visit to NYC and since we were going to the theater, we decided to stay near Times Square for the first night. I chose this hotel based on the reviews I read and have to say what a great choice! The front desk staff were very nice and helpful-even tho the room wasn't ready (we arrived around 11 a.m.) they were quick to offer to check our bags and text us when the room was available. Cold water and coffee were available in the lobby. The room was a city view with two double beds and was very clean and comfortable. Enough outlets and chargers for phones. We were on the 30th floor and had good water pressure. We did not go to breakfast, my husband went down and said it was very crowded (10 a.m.)so grabbed some coffee in the elevator. They did let us know that it would be crowded around that time, so we weren't surprised. On our way out, we picked up a to-go bag at the front desk - a muffin and granola bar was just enough to get us started. We didn't have trouble waiting for the elevator as some have mentioned. The only thing was housekeeping knocked on the door at 9 a.m... This hotel is near Times Square but just far away so not to feel so crazy. It was nice to come back to after a long day of sightseeing. Felt like it was an excellent value-Would stay again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My wife and I spent three nights at this Hampton Inn while visiting NYC on vacation. We loved the location; convenient to theatres, restaurants, and the subway. The staff was very helpful, the room was clean and well appointed, and since we were on a higher floor it was pretty quiet. The only knocks are that the breakfast area is small and was extremely crowded and since it was mid-summer there was often a fairly long wait for an elevator.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: A great value for times square. They offer free buffet breakfast but to me it wasn't that great. The staff was extra friendly for New Yorkers. The location was just blocks away from the central location of times square. I would definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The location of the hotel is excellent, in Times Square close to the subway stations. The staff is nice and helpful, especially Jeremy at the the check-in desk. My room had two queen beds, a small desk, chest of drawers, small closet, in-room safe, coffee maker, iron and hair drier. It was nice that there were plenty of electrical outlets and USB chargers: 3 plugs and 2 USB chargers on the desk, and on the nightstand each bed had 2 plugs and one 1 USB charger. The breakfast is probably below average by Hampton Inn standards, with only two hot items: one egg (either scrambled or omelette) and one meat (rotates between bacon, Canadian bacon, sausage links and a polish Kielbasa-type sausage). That doesn't include the pot of oatmeal and three make-your-own waffle irons. Hotel had a lot of nice small touches: ice water, hot water, coffee and tea available throughout the day in the reception; fresh baked cookies available early evening; free bottled water at check-in; etc. The three elevators were slow and overwhelmed by hotel guests at peak times. At those times, one could wait a long time for an elevator.On the main hotel page they boast "32nd floor rooftop observation deck" and "Venture to our rooftop observation deck on the 32nd floor for panoramic views of Times Square." This is marketing baloney and the views are mediocre at best. 32 floors is not tall by Times Square standards, and the majority of the view is blocked by the nearby taller buildings. Yeah, you can see the hand sculpture at the top of Madame Tussauds and the "Yahoo building," but you definitely should to go to a place like Top of the Rock for a real view.Overall, a good stay and I would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Had a really nice stay at Hampton Inn. Nice rooms, a little small but to be expected in Times Square. Bath was nice, overall very nice. I think it was a good value and I would go back. Worth a visit for sure.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed here for 8 nights in July.Check in was very quick. We were on the 21st floor, we had a small view of the city.The room was spacious, the only thing I can complain about is there was no bath- shower only.The beds were made daily. They were very comfy.The breakfast is perfect to get you going for the day. The range is not massive but for free you cannot complain. it does get busy during peak times.We found an excellent diner on 9th for breakfast. Westway diner.The hotel is in an excellent location for times square.The free drinks is very handy when coming back. They provide tea. coffee or hot chocolate. as well as water We booked a trip via the concierge, the guys name who I forgot. was most helpful. We went to see the Mets play. He made the process of getting there most easy. We never got a free cookie, they were always gone by the time we got back.Although I have no plans to return to NYC, I would not hesitate in staying at this hotel again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The rooms are small as is typical in New York, but it is clean and safe with a very friendly and knowledgeable staff. It's the perfect place to stay, close to everything in Midtown, and right in the middle of the theatre district, which is why we stay there. They also allow you to store your bags on your day of checkout, which is very convenient. It's a great place and we stay there most times we go to New York City.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: While the rooms are smaller than most Hampton's you have to remember that you are in New York City. You don't spend much time in the room. Breakfast room was smaller but again it's NYC. Staff was amazing. Concierge John was so helpful. We were there the first week of this year and it snowed the last 2 days. Saw so much and was well worth the trip.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I'm a Hilton Honors member, so I try to stay at Hilton properties and this place had pretty good reviews. The staff were friendly, but I felt security was lacking. People could walk in off the street and go straight to get on the elevators. This area typically has better security. Breakfast was also not quite as good and fresh as some of the other Hampton Inns. For the price, I would have expected more.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We were greeted warmly by Luis on our arrival who steered us through the valet parking, shared helpful information and was generally delightful. Our reception staff member, Olivia, was so much fun to talk to! Mostly we wanted to talk about Ireland, since we are traveling there soon and she is from Ireland. She was just lovely!It was also helpful that when we were checking out and trying to get breakfast at a busy time, there was the option of a bagged breakfast to go at the front desk, The rooms were attractive, roomy for NYC and very clean and tidy.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Taxi was met at the kerb and luggage taken care of and delivered to the room in good time.The reception staff were efficient, cheerful and helpful and the bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was good with all amenities and the air conditioning very good.The complimentary breakfast was good as was the complimentary internet and as you would expect, there was a room safe for valuables.Located just off Times Square, the Hotel was central to everything - restaurants, cafes theatres and other attractions and the 42nd Street Subway Station was just around the corner. The Hotel is also very close to the Port Authority Building which would be attractive to those who wanted to take a bus from the Airport at minimal expense and there are a number of restaurants and cafes located there.We stayed 3 nights and overall we would recommend this Hotel to those who want a comfortable hotel with great accessiblity and central to just about everything you need

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The staff was fantastic, and the amenities were good and typical of Hampton Inns. The location was great - short walk to Empire State Building, Broadway plays, Times Square, etc. Our room was a little on the small side, but the rooms were contemporary and well maintained.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed in NYC 3 years ago and had a very uneasy feeling at the hotel we stayed in. NOT this time, this Hampton was great. Very safe, family friendly, breakfast was great and we even went up on the roof top. The staff was A+ and the maid staff was A++. Will stay again if I ever go back to NYC.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The front desk staff was friendly and very efficient at arrival and departure. There is a storage closet for luggage if you arrive prior to check-in. The rooms, lobby, and dining area were impeccably clean. The concierge was very helpful each day with maps, directions, and subway.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Location was perfect, only a few minutes from all the action. Rooms were very clean and bed was very comfortable. The entire staff was really helpful with anything we needed. The only negatives were... the breakfast was not great and the wait for elevators was an issue in the mornings.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This was a girls-graduation trip with grandmother/granddaughter. We loved the location - right in the middle of Manhatten, near subway, theatre, plays. It was clean and great service. Breakfast was one of the best ever at a breakfast included place both in terms of quality and variety.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I stay at Hampton Inn hotels in the Midwest several times a year for work - but this experience in NYC (for leisure) was by far my favorite! Customer service & hospitality were the best I’ve ever experienced - at any hotel! We received a text before check in welcoming us and offering help if we needed it. We replied asking if we could bring our bags before check in and they were happy to help! (We did so at checkout too!) We also tried purchasing from their kiosk and instead they recommended the store around the corner to save us money - you could tell the customer and not the bottom line came first! Ever staff member was welcoming, hospitable and wore a smile. You can tell they are true professionals! I love that Hampton Inn includes hot breakfast - the selection is wonderful, even if the buffet line and dining room are rather crowded at this location. The elevators, likewise, can be crowded and run slow during peak times. We received a pro tip from the front desk to take a lower level room and were glad we did! It wouldn’t work for everyone, but we loved taking the stairs to save time. A picky person might have complained that the room was small and had a big dip in the floor, but honestly it was super clean, comfortable, and in the heart of NYC! We didn’t mind. The location was a huge plus - it was central to most of our plans and we frequently chose to walk instead of taking the subway or a car just because everything felt so close! It was easy to pop in and out of the hotel between events (think changing for dinner, or dropping off souvenirs) because of the location. In the end, I would go back in a heartbeat and recommend it to anyone I know traveling into the city, mostly because the customer service was so phenomenal!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I personally witnessed housekeeping personnel knocking on two different doors in my floor at 10AM requesting checkout, when the checkout is advertised at 12pm. The guests were visibly upset, obviously. The first day of our stay, there was water dripping from the ceiling in the breakfast room. The hotel does not have a mini-fridge or microwave in the rooms. Also, there are only 3 elevators which can get very crowded from guests and also, staff (elevators are shared among staff too). The hotel has a great location, it is kept clean and does serve good breakfast. Found it too pricey though given the inconveniences mentioned above.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This was a great location for walking to time square, bryant park area, big red bus and subway. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was good and we never had a problem with lines. The elevator was always efficient. Always a coffee and water station. Cookies in the afternoon. A rooftop overlook to see some of the city . Great hotels for families or not . We were on the 21 st floor and the fire alarm went off at 6:45 am. It was handled very well by the monitor and everyone was calm. The concierge was pushing gray line for some reason and got rude when we chose big red bus. We were very happy with big red bus. The one negative was our flight was cancelled last minute and we had to change hotels for a night.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great and easy location to get to! Also very easy to get out! Staff is friendly and helpful. The valet parking is great! Easy access to subways and to the heart of Time Square. We had a view of the city but not Time Square, but still a nice view!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The hotel was wonderful. It was very clean and the staff was very helpful and friendly. It's close to a lot of attractions, restaurants and shows. You can walk around and feel safe and have fun things to do. Our room was near the elevator, which I am not a fan of, but it was quiet and not disruptive to sleeping.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Best location for theatre. Times Square outside! Breakfast so so but complimentary. Staff very obliging. Stay higher up and no noise. Very comfy beds and great pillows. Some times were difficult getting on elevators.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Excellent hotel, friendly staff. Very close proximity to subway station and Times Square. Easy to walk to many landmarks. Complimentary breakfast was a money saver, but had limited vegetarian options. Breakfast area was very crowded at certain times.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: A hop, skip and a jump from Broadway, Times Square, and all NY has to offer. The Hampton Inn 'team' from the reception, to concierge, the wait staff at the complimentary breakfast, and the management personal present, reiterates why I return yearly to the Hampton Inn NY!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Just a couple of blocks from Times Square. Great location. Subway was 1 block away. Its cheap and easy to use. Staff was fantastic. Free breakfast was nice. Large area and the buffet changed daily. Our room was clean, comfortable and quiet. Valet parking in a busy part of the city. Reasonable price, nice facility and great location. Great job Kris and Johnny.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel was a great find, truly a gem in Times Square. Excellent location with less than a one minute walk to the Times Square Subway Station. The staff was warm, friendly and helpful. Free breakfast was a bonus. We were able to leave our car and luggage after we checked out and came back much later in the day to retrieve everything. Will definitely stay again when we are back in Manhattan.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: There was loud music playing at a nearby bar from 11 pm-4am. We complained to the front desk and no action was taken. We were told that the hotel was full and we couldn't change rooms. It was disappointing that they didn't try harder to deal with the situation.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
