hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed here for 5 nights on a trip away with my girlfriend. The hotel is in no way a super fancy place to stay but the rooms are really nice, relatively spacious and have a good sized bath/shower room too! Location is perfect, 30 seconds walk to Times Square, 15 minutes to Central Park, 5th Avenue and the Empire State Building. Staff are really friendly and helpful, you're always greeted with a "good morning/evening" and if you ever needed anything they are more than happy to help. The hotel also served breakfast in the morning which not all hotels in NYC do. This was really nice and there were even waffle makers (which I may have used a few too many times!!). Only pain point, a very small one at that, you sometimes have to wait a while for the lifts. In no way a major issue but became a little frustrating towards the end of our stay.All in all I can not recommend this place enough!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed at the hotel 6 nightsWe can say Only good things about the hotel Most important are the hotel stuff, very kind, helpful and smiley, our one request was addressed quick and with good manor.The room was very comfortable and with space to walk comfortably.Good bathroom with hair dryer, but, the electrical wire was too short.Location – great!! Sooo close to times square, Bryant park subway just across the streetGood breakfast was included in the price

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Amazing location right in Times Square and walking distance to a lot of main attractions. Staff were friendly, tea and coffee served throughout the day. Breakfast and the waffle maker were amazing!! Bedroom was large and so was the bathroom with a lovely walk in powerful shower. Ask for a high room due to noise of constant building work and traffic etc. Very happy with our stay.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Clean, Great location, breakfast had plenty choices, fun self making waffle section. Rooms are updated modern design. Tea/coffee all day being served. Plus evening cookies was a great touch! Morning complimentary bags are great for people who need to run!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great hotel and not unreasonable pricing either! Rooms were always immaculate, the bed was very comfy, great TV, good wifi. Thee rooms were really up to standard and always cleaned early in the morning.Breakfast is included, the choice isn't amazing but what I was expecting. Easily will fill you up for the day! The free hot drinks 24 hours was good and it also had a little shop. Free computers were good along with a free printer! The only thing I would comment on is the customer service through the reception staff, they seemed disinterested most of the time and i found weren't as helpful as they could be when it came to questions. I was traveling with my partner, we are both young and have never been to America before so was obviously confused and trying our best. I felt rushed but I felt this way in a lot of places while I was there so maybe its NYC thing...

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The room was very good but what really impress us was the quality of service we received from the people working at The Front Desk. They were very helpful and the courtesy , Also the location of the hotel is very good.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel was great. It was a good price, 100 steps from Times Square, clean and Updated. The staff was nice and accommodating. We stayed to attend Wicked on Broadway and the $9 Uber was very reasonably (we could have walked but being from Florida with 40 degree weather was not an option). The rooms are a nice size as well.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Have stayed here 4 nights, 2 different stays, while we wait to move into our new apt. in the city.Excellent choice for business or pleasure. Quiet, clean, good breakfast, easy check-in. Rates are reasonable, so I didn't use my points for the stays.The location is really good, as it's away from the Times sq. crowds, across the street from a major subway stop, and a half block away from the M104 bus which goes up Broadway, and is convenient for many places.Our 2nd stay, the room, an 09, had a wonderful view facing south. We enjoyed our stay very much.
user_name:
UpperWS
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This facility is located about a block from Times Square . This is a great location for business in New York City. The room was clean and adequately equipped -- the bathroom was very clean. Nice experience

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This is my second time staying at this hotel. I will be staying again! Clean and quiet. Courteous and friendly staff. Had one small issue with a key that was fixed immediately and the desk clerk apologized several times. Close to the Hard Rock and many other venues but quiet.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My daughter and I stayed here for her first NYC trip. Everything at this hotel was just right. The staff was super friendly, the hotel and room was very clean, a comfortable bed, nice complimentary breakfast, and it was very convenient to Times Square , the Theater District, and other attractions. I would stay here again for sure.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel has an amazing location which was why we booked it and it was great for all our activities. It was perfect to walk to Times Square or any of the broadway district theaters. It is very close to the subway also. The rooms are tiny, but I'm pretty sure that's the normal for downtown NYC. They were clean and bedding was cozy. My only issue with this hotel was the breakfast buffet experience. We paid a little extra to have this location and the buffet breakfast Hampton is known for and both mornings of our stay the breakfast area was so crowded we had to eat standing up and/or bring things back up to our tiny room to eat. The food was great, but the crowded tables and buffet area made this part of our stay not enjoyable at all. We actually got snowed in due to a storm and we moved hotels the last night of our stay to avoid the morning chaos and decrease the price a bit. I'm hoping it's only because we happened to be there during a busy time, but I did see it on previous reviews as well. As long as you go in expecting a wait for breakfast, you won't be disappointed with any other aspect of this hotel!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This property is perfectly located in Times Square. You can walk to anywhere you want to go and the subway is less than a 2 minute walk. Highly recommend this property if you're staying in the Times Square area!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We begin with fast and efficient valet service and professional concierge staff members. The hotel room was smaller due to a king size bed but it was clean, cozy and had a great view. We checked in around 6pm, so we were given a higher floor (23rd) and glad for it because of the view. Complimentary breakfast was good, there were bagels, eggs (scrambled and boiled), lots of muffins, pastries and donuts. You can also make your own waffles. They offered coffee, hot cocoa and tea all day in the lobby. The location was exceptional and we walked through your midtown and Times Square Area. Close by to many restaurants.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: For my son's 16th BiRtHdAy, we traveled to NYC for a family getaway! We chose the Hampton Inn for its convenience to Times Square and we were not disappointed. The hotel is a perfect location to the subway and buses. The staff is very helpful. Our check in process was very welcoming and they took the time to make sure we had everything we needed. The valet service was very helpful. The breakfast staff always greeted us with a smile regardless of the many people they were trying to keep HaPpY. The rooms were very clean and comfy beds! The concierge was so helpful when we asked about a bus tour of the city. She was able to get tickets for us and directions and we were on our way. We will definitely stay here again next time we visit NYC!
user_name:
Amanda M
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We had a great mid-week stay here, we just came in for an overnight to see a show. Convenient location (we drove into the city) easy to get to and valet parking available for an additional cost. Our bellman was super-helpful both on arrival and departure. No line to check in, room was good sized for NYC and very clean. No issues, no stress, just the way we like it!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Our family stayed here during the Christmas holiday. No question, the location was wonderful...one block from the heart of Times Square. Now, one thing to keep in mind, NYC hotels are notoriously small, which we were expecting. The Hampton Inn room was clean but small. The double beds were only full sized, so with two adults and two teenagers, it was a tight squeeze. No refrigerator. The elevator system was an exercise in patience. Because a lot of people were traveling on these very small elevators, and if you had a room on one of the mid to lower floors and wanted to go to the ground floor...good luck. The elevators filled up quickly. Likewise, going up was difficult as well. In order to go up, you have to swipe your room key on the interior panel, then push a button. Imagine 20 people having to crowd one side of the elevator in order to go up to their rooms. On to valet service. Our car was parked across the street. It took AN HOUR for valet service to get our car when we checked out. Even the desk clerks were getting annoyed with the delay by valet staff. First time we did not tip valet service...ever. We were given a discount on our bill because of the delay.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location, between the Broadway shows and great restaurant options. They allowed for early check in and late checkout. The free breakfast was packed with a queue for the waffles, but, tasty and well staffed. The room and public areas were clean, a wait for the elevators is the only less-than-perfect thing. Will absolutely stay here again!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Its at a great location, just right there in 42nd street, 200 steps from times square..! Subway is right there in 42nd street, so you don't have to walk much to go to different places.. This Hotel is in the backside of Madame Tussade/Ripley's/McDonalds.. so great location.. Staff was very friendly, Rooms very clean, they din't have any mini fridge or anything like that ..Breakfast buffet could be better, small area compared to the number of guests/rooms they have, and the variety and quality could be better.I'd definitely recommend this hotel for a family !!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stay was good. Very central to times square. Was very busy during our stay. Only 3 elevators and 29 floors with 9 rooms per floor so the wait for an elevator was sometimes long. Breakfast was chaos because of so many people and not near enough space for everyone to sit. Room was small but suitable for a fee nights stay. Overall was good.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My partner and I visited for New Years--to see friends, not to deal with the insanity of Times Square--and stayed here for 3 nights. The location was just on the edge of TS insanity, and for NYE we needed letters from the hotel to access the street. But it was generally pretty quiet otherwise, even on the 8th floor. The room itself was a little drafty (cool air coming from under HVAC wall unit) which made it feel a bit too warm while the unit was running and a bit too cool when it wasn't.The staff was good, particularly for breakfast. The breakfast got totally slammed about 15-20 minutes before closing on 12/31, and a long line formed (they do post signs advising you to go to breakfast early). However, the staff handled it very well, keeping food coming out even past scheduled closing time, and remained patient, friendly and professional. The breakfast food itself was good, and there was a nice variety.At breakfast time the wait for elevators was quite long, and many people ended up taking the stairs, but otherwise we didn't have any issues with elevators.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Overall good experience. Hotel location is excellent. Easy access to subway and Times Square. Staff is friendly and helpful. Rooms are small (typical of NY City hotel rooms) but you’ll spend very little time inside anyway. Rooms and public areas are clean. Parking is a bit pricey, but it is NY City.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We had a very pleasant stay at the Hampton Inn from the first day we arrived. Excellent customer service from all employees and specially Luis from the front desk/lobby area. Luis was very helpful and always pleased to help us with a smile on his face. Thank you very much.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed here during New Years Eve and loved the location to not only Times Square, but plenty of good restaurants and stores near by. I highly recommend staying at this location. The hotel is clean, the staff is friendly, and of course, the city is beautiful!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Excellent location and fantastic staff. Very close proximity to Times Square, Theater District & Hell's Kitchen. My only complaint would be the elevator situation. Be prepared to wait for 20-30 minutes for an elevator if you are trying to go downstairs.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My hubby and I were very pleased with the location, service, and cleanliness of the hotel. I was a bit hesitant as I can be difficult to please when it comes to cleanliness (yes, I've been known to change hotels or purchase Clorox wipes and Lysol upon arrival and use them). We had a late flight and did not arrive at the hotel until after midnight. No problem. The front desk clerk was very welcoming and efficient. We were in our room within 15 minutes of arriving. Not only was our room ready, the location was perfect for us. Our window faced another building on a quiet street. Remember this is NYC- the city that never sleeps! We heard the occasional siren but nothing extreme. Considering its proximity to TS, I expected more noise. Thankfully, that was not the case. We opted for a room with a king bed and were not disappointed. Our 16th floor room was efficient, but nicely appointed considering that we were not in a 5 star hotel. If you are looking for luxury be prepared to pay for it and look along the Upper East Side/Central Park area. If you prefer a clean, nicely appointed, efficient space, serviced by hospitable, helpful employees, then this hotel should fit the bill perfectly. There are only 2 of us, so we did not have the same considerations as those traveling with children. We maneuvered the space with no problems. I suspect those that travel internationally or spend a lot of time in NYC will be more familiar with hotel room sq footage. It worked fine for us. As others have mentioned, during our stay the elevators were at capacity during the normal meal/arrival/departure hours. We did make the 15 flight trek downstairs a time or two in order to get to breakfast because we did not want to spend time waiting for the elevator. The breakfast options were standard for Hampton Inn and were replenished often. The breakfast crew was hard at work on the mornings we chose to eat breakfast at the hotel. They were also very kind when approached by guests making requests for specific items. We enjoyed hearing various languages (mostly European) at breakfast. The concierge was quite helpful when asked about area restaurants and made some "off the beaten path" suggestions that were appreciated. We thought the location was perfect for accessing the subway or walking to area attractions. The front desk also took care of hiring a car for our red eye departure on the last morning of our trip. The driver arrived a bit early and dropped us off at the airport without incident. If you are flying in/out of LGA, be aware of construction. Travelzoo provided a great rate for our trip.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Excellent value, excellent location, highly recommended especially for families. Breakfast room and food left much to be desired. Hard to get a table. Elevators were terrible especially in the morning. One morning it took over 10 minutes to reach the lobby.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Good location near Times Square and close to subway at Times Sq and 7th Av. Rooms clean and tidy and reasonable quality. They are small and feel a little cramped. Staff are exceptional led by Farrell (manager) who seemed to always be around and helping out. He was even busing tables at one busy breakfast. Everyone seemed happy and real team feel. Jonny (bell desk) was always helpful and available.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Staff was actually 5-Star, from check in with Jeremy until check out with Farrell...the staff went beyond what was expected! I do believe that hotel should have incorporated some package with added access to the ball drop.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I can’t say enough good things about this hotel and their excellent staffIf you are looking for a NYC getaway, this is where you need to go. It is right in the middle of NYC Theatre Distict and is very close to many great restaurants This is a Must Stay if traveling to NYC

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Traveled first week of December w sisters . Reserved a city view room. Wonderful hotel, accommodating staff and great breakfast. The staff could not have been more pleasant and helpful. Concierge services, outstanding w local restaurant referrals serving great food. Can’t go wrong w this location.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We have just returned from a week at the Hampton Inn. Our room was very comfortable and the hotel had free wifi and - very importantly - an included buffet breakfast (get down early for this if you want a table). The staff are very friendly and helpful and the hotel is in a great location to visit anywhere you wish with most being within walking distance or just a short subway journey away. We recommend the Hampton Inn to all visitors to New York.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My family and i traveled during New Year’s Eve so we were prepared for a hectic stay but it was quite the opposite. Valet was quick and easy and because we arrived early our room was not ready but the staff stored our luggage for us free of charge. Breakfast was delicious and there is a subway station across the street so traveling to the other parts of the city was so easy! From start to finish this experience was one of the better ones I’ve had, thank you everyone!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We had two rooms booked here over the holiday period. Upon check in, we found our rooms to be very close to the elevators, one directly across from the elevator doors...so not the best location. That being said, I realize that someone has to get the undesirable rooms, but you never want it to be you.Rooms were relatively small, but that is to be expected by NYC standards. They were clean and comfortable, though. We had a couple of badly frayed towels in our bathroom which seemed a bit odd. They clearly should have been taken out of circulation. Also, on my second night, I noticed two long dark hairs on the bed. One was actually in the bed and one was on the duvet. They clearly were not ours, so that was a tad gross.Staff here were ok, but definitely not what I would call warm.I have been to NYC several times in the past and this was my first stay at this location. I won't be returning. There's just too many other appealing options.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed here on a recent trip to NYC. I used points but the cost would have been under $200/night. To me, this is a great value, especially with breakfast included. From the moment we arrived until the time we departed, the staff was courteous and our stay was enjoyable. The tea, coffee and hot cocoa available near the front door was great to battle the frigid temps outside. The hotel is about a 5 minute walk from Times Square itself. Convenient to the subway, Theaters, and landmarks to visit. Breakfast offered a selection of warm food (eggs, sausage, oatmeal, waffles) as well as muffins, donuts, fruit, yogurt, and cereal. I like that there are to-go containers so you can bring the food back to your room if you don't want to deal with trying to find a seat. The valet service was great. We arrived at noon and left our car with Luis who gave the run down on cost and tips for calling ahead to have the valet retrieve the car when leaving. I called prior to leaving and the car was in front, waiting for us in 30 minutes. They called our room to tell us the car was in front of the hotel. It was warm and running when we arrived downstairs. SO MUCH EASIER THAN HAVING TO PARK AT A NEARBY GARAGE AND WAIT IN THE COLD AS IT WAS RETRIEVED (and most likely at the same cost as valet at the hotel)!!!!! I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Arrived 14/11/17, got a yellow cab from JFK $58 plus tip, check in was pleasant and the room was ready for us, when I first walked in the room I was a little disappointed as it looked a little basic with a bed, wardrobe, coffee machine paper cups and sealed coffee bags tea and hot chocolate, bathroom with a space saving sliding door, the bed was the comfiest bed ever the best I have ever slept in a hotel, the coffee machine was a great bonus even though there was hot drinks in the lobby 24hrs, the reception staff were very friendly and helpful and the breakfast was great there was something for everyone (Geraldine) in the breakfast room was so friendly she made you feel so at home and relaxed great girl an asset to the hotel.The location is fantastic, turn left when you go out the hotel to the end of the street 41 on 8th cross the road you will be at the Port Authorities if you want to take a bus anywhere, or once on 8th turn right and walk upto 60 will bring you to Central Park highly recommend walking around the park grab coffee at the boat house. To get the underground to Statue of Liberty go to 42nd get the 1 red line whilst at that side go visit ground zero a must see and do. Walking distance from the hotel to Bloomingdales, TOTR, ESB all easy walking. We got a black car back to the airport $70 plus tip booked at the hotel door much better than a yellow cab felt a lot safer. Would definitely recommend and stay there on our next visit to NY

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Very friendly staff, checked in early in the day and they were able to accommodate. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Rooms clean and comfortable. Recommend this property and look forward to our next visit to NYC.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Look no further than the Hampton Inn, Times Square Central. Fabulous location and such a great base for exploring New York. The staff were all amazing with two special shout outs for Geraldine, Breakfast Supervisor, and John on the Information desk. I had read the reviews about the breakfast and how ‘busy’ it got - I can honestly say that it really wasn’t as bad as other reviews have suggested. The variety of food, hot and cold, was excellent and I particularly enjoyed making fresh waffles each morning. Geraldine and her team were so friendly, warm and welcoming and they could not do enough for you. Thanks Geraldine! As for John in the front desk, what a guy and what a laugh! So helpful and friendly at all times. Rooms were warm, modern and clean with a generous sized bathroom/spacious shower. From the moment we arrived to when we left we could not fault this hotel. With so many hotels to choose from in New York, we could not have chosen a better one for our budget - it was everything we had hoped for...and more. You won’t be disappointed.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed here with family Dec. 17-19. Called ahead to double check on reservations ( had been made online with booking.com) Farrell assisted us - couldn't find our reservation - was super nice took our number assured us he would figure it out .. he called back shortly and problem solved! (It was an issue with name and spelling) we arrived about an hour later our rooms were ready early! All front desk staff were super nice - very accommodating- the breakfast is excellent - rooms very clean and pretty spacious for NYC! The side street location was nice! Would stay again! Thank you

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Right in the centre of things but we didn't find it noisy at all - maybe because we were in a room (1805) at the back of the hotel with no others adjacent to us. Very close to Times Square, Macy's, Madison Square Gardens and a lot of the main attractions. We used the Hop On Hop Off buses to get out bearings and then walked from the hotel to the Rockfeller Center, Empire State, Grand Central Station. Public Library and 5th Avenue shops. We also walked to see Anastasia at the Broadhurst Theatre three blocks away.The rooms were very clean and the beds comfortable. They weren't large rooms with only a single wardrobe, one bedside cabinet between the two double beds and one three drawer chest of drawers but there was enough room to put two large suitcases down on the floor. There was a large keypad operated safe in the wardrobe that would have been big enough to get a laptop in plus additional items. All the usual things in the room - hairdryer, coffee making facilities, shampoo, shower gel, tv with lots of channels, iron and board. Free WiFi which we found served all four of us well. Three lifts serving the 31 floors so at times there was a wait but never particularly long I felt. You needed your key to get it to go up which was reassuring. Credit card was asked for on check in but nothing untoward appeared on it and local phone calls were free. Reception staff were helpful and looked after our cases as we had to check out earlier than our pick up from the airport. Coffee, tea and water were available in the lobby as were warm cookies on occasion. There was also a range of groceries and medicines that you could pay for at reception but you should note there is no bar here although there are plenty of places to eat and drink in the area e.g. turn left out of the front door to find Schnippers a good burger place only a couple of minutes away. There was a good choice of items for breakfast all served with disposable tableware which we had expected and were fine with. Cereals, oatmeal, muffins, toast, bagels, fruit, yogurts, fruit juice, coffee and tea plus make-your-own-waffles were supplemented each day with a different variety of eggs and sausage or bacon. We never had a problem finding a table for the four of us but the hotel has a poster advertising the busiest breakfast times in the lobby which I have added to this review. I chose this hotel because of the location, breakfast, Wi-Fi and Hilton Honours reward programme. We would definitely return.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I am not overstating facts here, but this hotel is A.M.A.Z.I.N.G in the real sense of the word. Rooms and Ambience- 5/5Staff courtesy- 5/5Breakfast- 5/5Location- 6/5 The best part is the location where it is just on Times Square and the subway station (42St Times Sq) is just a minute’s walk away. Staff is very friendly and would always greet you with smile. Pro tip- Opt for a room high up or low down. Middle floors can be excruciating in terms of elevator waits. Especially during peak breakfast and check out times! The positives however outweigh the negatives by a galaxian margin. Enjoy your stay at the Hampton.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: While the rooms are not fancy, you are in a central location for tourist activities. The hotel is clean and the staff is friendly. The also have a well stocked shop with drinks and food you can charge to the room which was convenient for business travel and when I saw the bill on the room - it was very reasonable.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Enjoyed our stay here. Near all the places we wanted to see in the city. Small rooms but we weren't in the rooms very much. Rooms were very clean. Staff was friendly. John, the concierge was extremely helpful. Would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: In general, a good experience. We were on our honey moon. However, the failed to register the name of my wife at check-in, which caused that, in our SIXTH night at the hotel, when I was visiting a friend without my wife and had no cell phone signal or internet available because I live in another and my carrier doesn’t cover the U.S, they DID NOT LET MY WIFE IN!! She had her key but it stopped working, and she presented it at the front desk to a lady and a man that treated her VERY badly. My wife had been walking all day, she was tired and needed a bathroom. The people at the front desk had seen us all week, we had talked to them many times, we laghed together and they even helped us with pictures and cookies and other stuff the previous nights, and they pretended they had never seen her and told her that I had to call them to tell them she is my wife to let her in, because it is not costumary in our country that women take the husband’s last name, so our last names are different. For me this is unacceptable behavior. They had her stay at the lobby for about an hour, when luckily I was able to get in a wifi connection and saw all the messages she had sent me. I had to ask my friend for a phone and call the hotel just to literally say “she is my wife”. It is supposed to be a security measure but they didn’t ask me for personal data or any data that could tell them it was me calling... do you see the irony? It could’ve been anyone that she asked to call and say “she is my wife”. The man on duty, an almost bald guy, was the SAME guy the checked us in!! I could’ve understand if this happened the first nights, but we had many interactions with these people before this event occurred. A black spot on what was a fantastic trip courtesy of the people at the front desk.
user_name:
Jose Pablo M
San Jose, Costa Rica

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We decided to spend Christmas in New York and we were eleven family members who came along . The hotel for one is centrally located and the rooms were insulated from the noise of Times Square . The staff were hospitable and friendly despite the volume of guests for the Christmas Season. Farrell who was at the front desk was very accommodating to all our requests . Grace under pressure is best to describe him . Housekeeping was always regular in tidying up the room daily including Christmas Day . Breakfast buffet which comes free for guests and constant coffee and tea at the lobby are definitely pluses and desirable . The wait at the elevators can be a downside at times but definitely tolerable . This is a hotel that I will be coming back for years to come . It is a no frills , simple and clean hotel . Nothing luxurious but it certainly makes you feel at home .

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Hotel is new and modern. Bathroom has very good size, and room is not big but is functional.Location is excellent! Couldn't be better! Very close to Times Square but on a quite street.Breakfast is another advantage of this hotel, as it is varied and tasteful.On the other hand, the hotel has some significant issues.As soon as I got to my room I found out my bathroom was disgusting! All dirt of previous guest was still there. And bathroom's cleaning didn't get any better during my stay.Additionally, common areas are too small for the size of the hotel. You can take several minutes to take the elevators - in fact, we gave up and took the stairs to go down all the time. The breakfast room is another tiny area. It is too small for the amount of people that should eat there; as consequence, getting a table is a pretty challenging mission.In summary, I would stay here again for the location and the coffee, but it is too expensive considering the full experience.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I was on U.S trip with my wife. We spent two nights in the Hampton Inn. The location of the Hotel is actually great !! Although It took some time to reach the hotel from the NY airport. Now let me share my experience of the hotel:The Hotel: It is a typical Hampton Inn, Very good AmbianceLocation: The best part of the hotel is its location. It is perfectly located in the Times Square.Staff and Service: The staff of the hotel was very generous and helping. We Checked-in 4 hours early due our flight timings. At first the hotel receptionist asked us to wait but then on request she allowed us later. The hotel is offering free coffee and tea 24x7 which was great. Food: The Buffet breakfast was great with many varieties of the food and it was free too :) Good Part was they relaxed the buffet timings as well for us :) They even gave us packed food when we checked out. Amenities: The hotel is having almost all the basic amenities which you need.Rooms: The Room was good and spacious with all the basic amenities.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I stayed in your hotel with my visitor from Munich Germany and we had a very good experience. The location was perfect, close to all points of interest. We were able to see a show which was convenient as well.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The staff here is so friendly, especially Jeremy at the front desk. Our king bed was a good size, extremely comfy and the pillows were excellent. The room was well equipped with charging options for electronics, and was spacious enough to not feel cramped at all. Complimentary breakfast is varied and tasty. I would recommend this hotel to anyone!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great pricing with great rooms and exceptional staff. Very close to Times Square and Subway. Free breakfast was a plus. Highly recommend a stay next NYC visit. Will stay there again when we visit NYC!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: With all the choices of hotels in Times Square we finally chose this one for several reasons: excellent value senior honors member rate; high floor king room with a view; hot breakfast included. It proved to be a great choice. We stayed on the 27th floor with a partial but good enough view of the Empire State Building. We loved watching its light show every night. We also loved the sunset as we faced west, and could even see the Hudson in the distance. Breakfasts were truly hot (always an omelet and of course hot oatmeal, and waffles you can make yourself); plenty of good hot coffee too. Our room was very clean and service at all levels excellent, from the cleaning staff to the breakfast room to the front desk. They bend over backwards to help make your stay comfortable. My only complaint: the bedding desperately needs a refresh. The extra blanket had a large hole in it, a pillow case was stained, and the fitted sheet did not fit the thick mattress and kept coming undone!We are Hilton Honors members and as a rule we have been very satisfied with their brands. We have stayed at Doubletrees many times (our favorite brand) and the Hampton Inn.For some reason the star rating will not click on my i-pad so I will verbally rate: 5 stars for value and service, but 3 stars for room only because of the bedding.
user_name:
Blubrd
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: very good hotel,service from everyone was excellent. great location our family enjoy the breakfast each day,with a lot of hotel having only 1 or 2 waffles makers this hotel with three and the staff was on top to keep everything fresh and good

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I surprised my daughter with a trip to NYC for her 13th birthday. We had previously stayed in Times Square and loved it. I chose Hampton Inn Manhattan/Times Square because I wanted to stay in Times Square and the cost was much less than other area hotels. I am so thankful of the choice I made. Everyone was very helpful and went out of the way to help with anything needed. The hotel was in a great location, but much quieter than where we previously stayed. I will definitely recommend to family and friends and will stay again the next time I travel to NYC.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed here during the hectic holiday season and NYC was packed as expected. This hotel is located in the heart of Times Square, next to the Nederlander theatre. You could see the stage door of Aladdin from our hotel window. I would have expected to hear more city sounds, but this room was quiet as could be. It was clean, well maintained, and a really good size for a NY hotel. Staff were friendly and welcoming. They held our luggage all day on check in day, and half the day on the day we checked out. I'm never truly confident about that, but this was safe and secure. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to be based in Times Square. It was affordable and it was perfect. I couldn't have asked for a better experience. Breakfast was also well done.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Excellent service from the front desk to the breakfast to the valet. Very much appreciated from my end to remove all stress.Arrived early after a long drive and I was able to get into my room upon arrival. Breakfast area was clean and also had a variety of choices.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location, free breakfast, free hot chocolate in the lobby, clean room, and a pleasant staff; combined this makes this an easy choice when staying in Times Square. And while they don’t have a lounge, Gleason’s, a few doors down served as a convenient location for a nightcap, or a cold beer watching the game.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel is not really as nice as most Hampton Inns, and it's pretty expensive also (as are all Times Square hotels), but the staff truly go out of their way to be accommodating and professional - they really made our stay so much better. In fact, if not for the amazing staff, we probably would have switched hotels. The location is good for most people - very near to the 42nd street metro station, though it felt quite a ways "off" Times Square if you are looking for a central to Times Square location- it is nowhere near the DoubleTree or Marriott Marquis or the TKTS booth, for example. But it was just a short walk to the theaters we needed to go to and Bryant Park is just three blocks away, and the Port Authority hub is quite close. It's also close to a bunch of restaurants as well as Starbucks, CVS, Joe's Pizza and Whole Foods, so we found it convenient overall location-wise. And it's a ten minute walk or so (13 blocks) to Rockefeller Center, so not too bad. The rooms are small (as are the rooms in many NY hotels, but these felt smaller) and the hallways are super small/narrow. There are three elevators, so you don't have to wait too long if it's not a busy time of day. ice is on every other floor, so you have to walk up and down stairs to get ice. there was no refrigerator in the room (or microwave) so that really cut down on convenience (there's a microwave downstairs though). The beds are quite comfy but the shower is basically useless -so little water comes out that it takes quite awhile to actually shower! The heater and A/C worked well and the view from the upper floors was very good. Security is also quite good at this hotel and the area is nice, so you don't feel unsafe. There's plenty of homeless people you have to walk by to get to the hotel, but that's also quite normal for the area.... We tried the breakfast and found it pretty basic and not at all really appetizing, so we just walked outside and got food elsewhere each day. There is coffee/tea/water and hot chocolate in the lobby all the time and cookies in the afternoon - so that was really great. And the lobby is quite nice - easy to sit in and read or do work. I would recommend it to those who don't mind staying just a tad "off" the main drag and who are like the Hilton brand (there's another Hilton literally across the street!) and who don't mind small rooms with minimal amenities in them.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Very nice hotel. Convenient to subway. Convenient to so many places! The rims are clean,the beds comfortable, date staff has been very friendly and helpful. Lilly at the front desk is just precious!!! Always smiling. Friendly. I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We came for an overnight visit to NYC with our kids (5&7) and had a great experience - from the minute we pulled up in our car (valet experience was exceptional) to the time we pulled away - the service was awesome! The rooms are very clean and the staff was so nice - especially to our kids. The continental breakfast was typical for a Hilton hotel - provided all the basics (waffle makers and all!). If you’re looking for a place to stay that’s affordable and close to Times Square- this is it!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I stayed on the north side of the building, overlooking W 41st st. My room was right by the elevators which was convenient. I spent my Wednesday night here, and it was a little noisy outside from garbage pickup. It wasn't horrible though. The first impressions representatives (front desk employees) were efficient and friendly. Upon checking in, you are offered two FREE bottles of water. The rooms and lobby are clean and large. The rooms had a powerful hair dryer. Normally I bring my own since I can't rely on hotel hair dryers to produce enough flow, but this one did. The FREE breakfast was delicious and had a nice variety and spread. The attendants were friendly and gave good suggestions to hotel guests when asked and asked how they enjoyed previous explorations. All in all, no complaints whatsoever for this hotel!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: It was an amazing experience with my family. The staff were quite helpful. the hotel was really clean. It was located in the ever busy Times square vicinity with access to shops and restaurants. However, the restaurant was really crowded and very busy for the morning breakfast.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central is a relatively new hotel and it shows. Clean, modern and well organized. The staff is super friendly. The breakfast is complimentary and delicious. Probably the best value in Manhatten!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I really enjoyed my stay at this Hampton Inn. The location was convenient in Times Square. The complimentary breakfast was nice. The room was small but it was very clean. The bathroom was the same. I do wish the rooms had mini fridges for drinks/leftovers.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We just stayed at this hotel for a second time and love everything about the hotel. The staff is friendly and very accommodating. The lobby is beautiful and inviting. The rooms are a comfortable size (huge for NYC standards) and very clean. The location is perfect for seeing shows, great restaurants and easy access for anything in the city. We highly recommend this hotel. It won’t disappoint!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: First off, great team, but thanks especially to Clarence who helped solve a lot of problems!A clean and comfortable room with giant bed,well appointed [what went wrong with the room service - bed not made?. no prob's though].A good breakfast and very much worth it on cost and convenience grounds.....and the location. Ideal for rail and bus connections, but especially for Times Square and Broadway and Blue Circle boat tour.
user_name:
Keith G
Great Malvern, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Very nice hotel. Great location. Off the beaten path, so it wasn't so congested when coming and going. Rooms were comfy and cozy. The bathrooms were in great condition, hotel hallways and elevators were always clean. Anything we needed the staff was willing to help in any way they could.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We attended 2 shows and were ableTo quickly walk to the theaters. The breakfast was good and they have little snacks at various times of the day. We took the subway several different places and the hotel was super convenient to all of the stops. We will definitely stay here again if we go to New York for anymore family Trips.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: All around excellent experience from start to finish.Rooms were clean and cozy. Beds were comfortable. Excellent location in Times Square! Hot breakfast was good. Best of all was the top notch customer service!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed 4-nights and All was excellent. A very nice hot breakfast, very friendly staff 24-7, lobby coffee-water-hot chocolate always stocked, cookies every evening and replenished when empty. Great location of course! This morning there was a major news event 1-block away creating traffic congestion with major police presence. Jonny at front desk arranged transportation to LaGuardia for us and escorted to the corner to a car since street in front of Hotel was closed. We really appreciated this assistance!!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We chose this hotel for two reasons: 1) to be near the things we wanted to do - Broadway, Central Park, Lower Manhattan. it worked out great. Half a block to the subway, but we visited most places by walking. Many great restaurants nearby. And 2) because Hampton never fails to deliver. So consistent in their product offering and delivery and Times Square Central fit the bill. The team was friendly and accommodating throughout our stay. The place is kept in pristine condition despite the winter weather and wet attire coming through all day. One less meal to have to "eat out" since breakfast is included. Hot coffee and chocolate all day long. Elevators were prompt, it didn't take 10 minutes for the hot water to get hot enough, and nothing beats being able to pick up water (and ice cream) right from the lobby pantry. Rooms are small as in most NY hotels, but everything we needed was right there. We love Hampton.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I went with my 2 boys 10 and 8 yrs old. Everyone was very kind to my kids. I have never witnessed a better collective hotel staff. They where all happy and very helpful.To name a few Johny, Jasmine, Tobo, Will, Ferrell where all amazing. The room attendant was also very nice and helpful. Rooms are big and very clean. Breakfast is very good and diverce.I stayed there on Nov 26, 2017. If I ever return to nyc I will only stay there.Thanks,Teodoro Morales

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel is in a great location - within walking distance to a lot of attractions. Our room was clean and I would give it four or five stars if not the poor customer service. A couple examples are we asked at the front desk for an extra blanket and they said they would bring one up. It took two more requests over the next two hours before they finally did. Also, they warned us that it could take as long as 30 minutes for the valet to our car. It actually took over 60. The only positive experience that we had with the staff there was with a maintenance man named Adale. My wife had left her purse in our room after we checked out. She went to the front desk and was informed that Adale had found it and was bringing it down. Nothing was taken. This could be a really great place to stay if the staff was better

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: In town to see some Broadway Shows, I was very pleased with my stay here. The reception desk staff were all very friendly, the location was close to many of the theaters, and if you were in a hurry in the mornings, they had grab & go brown bags to take with small water bottle and a muffin. I did not eat in their restaurant or try to use wi-if in my room, so review doesn’t cover those aspects.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel is Well situated in the heart of the action in manhattan .we were greeted by very friendly reception staff who explained all about the hotel and amenities they offered us free teas/coffee before showing us to our room ,it was clean ,spacious ,quiet and very comfy with a great street view . We had a fab sleep and woke to an even better breakfast everything you could eat buffet style breakfast ,the kids loved the make your own waffles they were helped by a lovely lady Geraldine who was so welcoming and helpful with all our question regarding attractions etc and as we left for the day staff offered us goodie snack packs to keep us going through the day (free) apple water and cookies . We have stayed in New York many times and never been treated so good we will defiantly use this hotel again . Also the day we left the concierge organised the safe keeping of our bags all day the order of a straight fee ride to the airport he even supplied the driver with a coffee while he waited for us !the last 2 hotels we have stayed in were 5 star but we would have still rather have stayed here well done Hilton

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location.It was our first time visiting New York . We were able to walk to major attracations. Hotel staff very kind and helpful. Check in was easy and fast. Continental breakfast is also very tasty. Rooms clean, housekeeping service also very good. We were on the 26 th floor, nice view of New York mostly at night.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The location of this hotel is ideal. if your are traveling by car and go through the Lincoln tunnel when you exit stay to the left travel one block to 42nd St right on 42nd right on 7th Ave right on 41st and half way down the block on your left. The valet was easy and friendly, the room was typical NYC every square inch is used, but clean and comfortable. Complimentary breakfast was filling with a good selection. The location is great to walk to Time Square, Rockefeller Center , Bryant Park. The staff is extremely friendly, and helpful. We asked where to get a good burger, and Luis suggested good spots that were a block walk east or west. Would Highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The Hotel is very centrally located for the people that, like me , want to walk all over New York City. The people are extremely nice to you and the rooms are big and very, very clean! Everything at the hotel was 1st class including breakfast and of course, the Concierge!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location; perfect base for first time visitors. We travelled up from JFK Airport via air-train and tube and walk to hotel was 200 yards. $20 for both of us one way .....Free tea and coffee 24/7 in hotel lobby and handy shop for your necessities.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: A lovely hotel in the heart of New York within walking distance to most of the main sights. Stayed here 19th-24th November for my Wife's birthday. A lovely clean room and a good view from the 31st floor. The hotel does serve a hot and cold breakfast with enough to eat to set you up for the morning. Free fresh coffee 24hrs in the lobby is a bonus along with internet/printer facilities. Lovely staff helped store our bags when when checked out as had a night flight. Must say the cleaners were lovely and friendly and hard working. Hotel only 15 minutes walk from the Empire State Building, 5 minutes from Bryant Park and round the corner from Times Square and a few doors down is Gleasons Irish bar, fantastic and friendly and open till 0400hrs. Got a taxi to Battery Park for $14 (4 miles away). Overall this hotel is excellent, good size clean room in a great location with friendly helpful staff. Would highly recommend.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Last month we stayed 8 nights in the hotel. Great location near the times sq. The stuff was very Helpful. very good breakfast. the room was big enough. the only thing that was missing was a refrigerator in the room.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My cousin and I stayed here from 18 - 23 November and would highly recommend the hotel. The staff were all very happy and helpful. Geraldine the breakfast supervisor was particularly helpful, remembering and greeting everyone with a smile each morning. It’s a great location for walking to most of the main attractions. The bus station is at one end of the street, and the subway round the corner. I would highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed here recently and have nothing but praise for this hotel. The hotel is clean and the room was quite spacious given it is in New York City. A lovely double shower after a long day was very welcome. Our check in was very swift and easy. Breakfast is included which has quite a good selection from fruit, cereals, waffles, hot foods, cold and hot drinks, definitely enough to start the day off well. There are computers and printers you can access if you need to print tickets, boarding passes or anything else really. The staff were really helpful with us when it came to ticketmaster messing us around with some tickets, they made phone calls etc for us and I can’t praise them enough for their help. There is a never ending supply of complimentary hot drinks and water in the foyer and a small area to buy little essentials and snacks, plus a microwave to warm an instant meal up if necessary. There is a desk where you can book tickets/taxis/shuttles etc and give advice on the area if needed. We had a later flight so we used the left luggage area which was great for us. As good as a hotel and it’s facilities are, they mean nothing without a great staff and this hotel has an abundance of great staff on all levels. I would definitely stay here again and would have no qualms in recommending it. Thank you Hampton Inn for making our stay enjoyable!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great Hotel & location..The staff is very friendly & accommodating in every way. The free breakfast is a plus! Check in & Check out were very easy! It’s within walking distance to some great restaurants & shopping locations.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel location is great! The staff is friendly and helpful. They were very accommodating and even gave us some suggestions for locations to visit and shopping. Rooms are nice and clean. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. The staff made all the difference.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I was redirected to this property after the Hilton property I had booked had a delay in completing their renovations. I originally was disappointed, but that all changed. From the moment of check-in to the departure, my friend and I experienced nothing but genuine and friendly hospitality. The new front office supervisor was splendid and most helpful. The other front desk staff were friendly, too. The breakfast buffet, although crowded, was very good each morning. Geraldine was so friendly and kind--she deserves a raise. She was extremely gracious. Our guest room was plenty big for my friend and I. The bedding was the BEST--comfortable, high quality, and amazing. The bathroom amenities were also very nice. The breakfast on-a-go was a nice treat as well. John, the concierge, was knowledgable and helpful also. I highly recommend this exceptional property---you will not be disappointed.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I would highly recommend the hotel. The rooms are small, but it is NYC. The staff was happy, warm and welcoming. The breakfast supervisor, Geraldine, was exceptional. Remembered us each morning, always had a smile on her face. The location was excellent!! Everything was within an easy walking distance. We would happily go back again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Saw another great show at the Sondheim Theatre . Walked6 miles feet and back ached but kept going, thank god for Tylenol. Walked by window dressings on 5th ave looking up most of the time trying to find the sun and found it on 8th ave South to Penn Station

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Well what can I say about this hotel?. Its amazing. I stayed here 24th to 28th November with my mum for her 80th birthday. The hotel itself is very clean warm & friendly. We had a large room with 2 very comfy double beds. There was tea coffee hot chocolate & iced water available in reception 24/7. We were offered bottles of water at reception before we'd even checked in. Also, at 8pm, fresh cookies were brought to reception for guests to help themselves. The breakfast really sets you up for the day. Cereals, fruit, yogurt, pastries, muffins, eggs, bacon, sausage & more. Lots of it too. The icing on the cake for this hotel is its staff. Jasmine on reception couldn't have been more helpful but the prize certainly goes to Geraldine breakfast manager & Olivia. Every day they made sure that me & my mum had everything we needed. We were treated like royalty. They even gave us advise on local shows, shops, restaurants. Nothing was too much trouble for them. (& they are hilarious). Thank you ladies. You made our holiday. Hilton Hotels, I hope you appreciate them. One last thing, Gleesons Irish bar next door is a hidden gem. Great fresh food & really reasonable. Enjoy X

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Excellent hotel in a 1st class location near times sq and broadway. Walking distance to many of the other attractions.Would highly reccommend this hotel . Woodbury common is a muat for all the bargain hunters.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: In the middle of all the action but completely quiet when it’s time to sleep. Staff is lovely and helpful. Most folks would avoid Times Square but the property sits between two great transit stations so you are just 10 minutes from everything in the city via the MTA. Favorite room is 2609-it’s like a vault-you can’t hear any of the city noises!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We love Hampton Inns, and this must be the flagship! Our first trip to NYC and where to stay? The newest Hampton Inn, pretty much in the heart of Times Square and within short walking distance of Broadway shows. So glad we stayed here - a place we were familiar with (maybe we'll venture to boutique doormen hotels next time) but we felt comfy and cared for with 24/7 coffee bar and of course daily breakfasts which were very good, especially considering the property averages 300+ guests each morning! Would definitely recommend!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The location is great, close to Time Square. Had some issue when checking in but Mr. Ng at front desk took care of everything. I would like to thank him for dealing with the issue so fast as I was tired at the time checking in. Overall I was very satisfied and will definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Good 3 star hotel. Great location and decent breakfast service in the mornings. Family rooms a little compact but clean. Friendly and helpful staff. Really good wifi. The lifts sometimes take forever in the mornings especially if you are on one of the middle floors. We came to NYC for a wedding and the 10 of us were really happy with our stay.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Hotel is conveniently located between 7th and 8th Ave. Lower floors can be noisy with street traffic, but it didn't seem to bother us as we were so tired from exploring the city.Hotel room was fairly large (for the city) and extremely clean. The bathroom was spacious, there was a big closest, and a lot of counter space for your belongings. There was a safe located in the room as well. Complementary breakfast was served every morning. We arrived early and did not have a problem finding a seat or ever running out of food. The hotel also offers "to go breakfast bags" which we did not use, however we would have if we were short on time. There is no restaurant located in the hotel, but they do have a mini store as well as access to a microwave for quick snacks. We arrived to the hotel early in the morning before our room was ready. The staff graciously stored our luggage so we could get a head start on exploring the city.We will absolutely stay at this property again!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The rooms were clean, stylish and comfortable mattress. Service was fantastic from check in to check out. The breakfast is included with hotel stay. Great, fresh selection of breakfast foods. Hot coffee, hot water for cocoa and tea available all day and evening.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The rooms were tiny and the rates were very high. The hotel has very few amenities with the exception of a hot breakfast, which has the same breakfast items every morning. It is a new hotel, but I still wouldn't recommend it unless you are traveling alone.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We took a dozen of our family to NYC for Thanksgiving week. Hotel was very helpful with our group and accommodated us without compromise or issue even with several other large groups present.Way to go Hampton!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location. Well thought out room. Perfect for us. The rooms are somewhat small but typical of N.Y. breakfast was free and plentiful. Staff was superb. Free coffee and cookies and breakfast to go bags.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I have been to Manhattan many times, both for work and pleasure. This hotel was the best one I have stayed at. The room was good sized, compared to other properties in the city. The room was very clean, bed extremely comfortable, and very quiet. I was on the 25th floor, and literally heard no traffic. The breakfast was fantastic. Better than most free buffets I have seen. The staff couldn't have been more accommodating. If I needed anything, I got it within minutes of making the phone call to guest services.The location of this property was perfect. A few minute walk from Bryant park and Times Square. The location couldn't have been better. Hot cookies at the end of a long work day, was certainly a nice little bonus.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: It’s 3 stars hotel location is good walking distance to time square and other places .room size is not small bigger than other 4 stars hotel in Manhattan but before 3 weeks I was stay in other 4 star hotel you feel different especially in the breakfast area and kind of food even the customers so it’s all depend on money if you can pay more it’s better to stay in 4 stars hotel .For reasonable cost stay and also comfortable room this hotel I recommend staff also kind and helpful .

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: First time in the city hotel was very conveniently located, room was nice breakfast was good stuff for very courteous and helpful. John the concierge was great- a character right out of a Seinfeld episode!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed at the Hampton Inn Manhattan/Times Square South. Price was reasonable and typical Hampton amenities. Easy walking distance to Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Radio City Music Hall, Broadway Theaters, and even Central Park. Convenient access to the subway to expand your exploration area. My wife’s family had a medical emergency in another state. I asked the hotel to get me a car to JFK and the doorman went and got one. We ultimately had to check out early and no problem from the hotel. The room was comfortable but small. A few feet around the king sized bed and that was it. The shower wasn’t much bigger than the cruise ship I was on a few weeks previous but there was plenty of hot water. Six rooms per floor, 30 something floors. Elevators were fast. A typical Hampton breakfast. I would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This is an excellent property, centrally located in the heart of everything you want in Times Square and Manhattan. The staff is exceptionally courteous and willing to assist in any way. We were especially impressed with housekeeping; they went out of their way to make sure we were comfortable. The rooms are smaller than usual, but that is to be expected at a moderately priced property in Times Square. The room was clean and comfortable. We had nice views of the city. They have fresh cookies every night and a beverage area with coffee, tea and hot chocolate. The hotel is close to many nice restaurants. We felt very safe and comfortable and the hotel seemed appropriate for all guests, including children. We would stay here again in a heartbeat. Very pleased.
user_name:
Wallyworld59
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Thanks to Farrell and Matthew and all the staff. Fixed bathroom door promptly and room looks great. All the staff here are friendly and helpful. Hotel is in a great location for first time visitors to the city. Thanks again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My family of 10 was in NYC for the weekend. From the moment we entered the Lobby of the Hampton Inn Manhattan/ Times Square Central, we were greeted by their friendly staff. They were extremely helpful and very eager to please. They had many free refreshments in the lobby. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. When it was time to leave and our uber didnt show up to take us to the airport, one of the managers ran to the corner and hailed us a cab and with very kind words convinced the cab driver to take us to the airport. The cab driver was so impressed with hotel employee that he didnt stop talking about him all the way to the airport! Thanks so much Hampton Inn Manhattan/ Times Square Central Staff, You are AWESOME!! Also, the concierge got us GREAT tickets last minute for the Radio City Rockettes!!! Thanks All!! Happy Thanksgiving to you all!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location and the staff is amazing! It was perfect for a mini vacation with my girlfriend and our daughters! My daughter loved the hotel and area. It was their first time in NYC and the Hampton made it special.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We came up to see a show for a friend's birthday. She cannot stop talking about her stay and the fantastic location. We were steps away from all things NY (SUbway, theater, restaurants, etc).We plan to stay here for all future stays in the City.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The hotel was clean. Staff was pleasant and helpful. Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Radio City Music Hall, shows, tour busses and shopping all within walking distance. Brooklyn Tabernacle Choir was Fabulous. Many restaurant choices near. Subway access nearby at 42nd st.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: For the last 3 years i am staying in Hilton Hotels and found the experience extremely satisfying. ease of booking, courtsey of staff while checking-in and checking out, decent breakfast and round the clock coffee are some of the features that a business traveler look for. further rooms and amenities are excellent.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: If you want a very nice hotel, in the theater district, close to Time Square and the Metro system, this place is for you. The rooms are excellent as well as the breakfast. There is something for everyone.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My family and I had a nice stay here. The breakfast is great, the staff was friendly, and it's literally a hop, skip, and a jump from the main area of Times Square. It's nestled away from all the hustle and bustle, but it takes less than five minutes to reach the main area of Times Square, the location is perfect. The rooms were cozy and clean as well. The rooftop view is also pretty cool, I loved going up there in the mornings just soaking up the view.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Super location!! Just steps from the 42nd st./Times Square Metro Station where you can access eleven subway lines and a shuttle (as far as I remember). Also you have many restaurants nearby as well as theaters. The staff is nice, always willing to help you. The rooms are clean and they have a good breakfast (including excelent coffee). I'll stay there again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Staff is ALWAYS friendly and helpful, rooms are clean and breakfast is decent. Location is close to Times Square if you want that area and yet you can turn left when departing the hotel lobby and be far enough away from Times Square to miss all the madness of the crowds there. The rooms are clean and quiet, elevators are fast.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The hotel and staff were great. We were on the 26th floor and it was great. The staff recommended great restaurants. I would definitely recommend the hotel to friends, family and would absolutely stay there whenever in New York again. We came as strangers and left with new friends.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Good location, clean lobby and rooms. Some of the staff, nice and friendly, others not so much. Rooms were actually nice size for New York. 2 blocks from Times Square. Lots of nearby restaurants and bars.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The room was small but pleasant. Everything I needed was there. The reception desk had 4-7 people behind or near every time I passed by or walked up.Unfortunately, no one seemed to be able to know what they were doing or appeared distracted. I needed to retrieve my key fob before valet parking took my vehicle to the garage to get my cell phone. I counted five people working on this project when the fob was next to one of the computers at the desk the entire time. No one seemed to mind that I was standing wearing a knee brace and leaning on the reception desk to lessen the increasing pain. The motel requires that the room key be used on a key reader while selecting the floor in the lift. No employee told me this. I found out from another guest when I asked him to press "7". Using the key reader is not easy when one has the key in one hand, a cane in the other, and a bag hanging off the shoulder. Kudos for making the premises safer with this feature, but aren't you supposed to tell guests about it and help people with it if they are using a cane and a knee brace and have two bags. Problems like this are magnified when staying only for one night because there is little opportunity for the staff to display their competence.
user_location: East Greenbush, New York, United States
user_name:
Ruff B
East Greenbush, New York, United States

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We had one night to spend in Manhattan during a trip for my niece's Bat Mitzvah in NJ. The location can't be beat. It's in the Times Square and Broadway area, but just a couple blocks away so the lights and noise were not an issue. What made this hotel stand out was the front desk customer service. My sister in law dropped us off around 1:30. I had gone in with my kids to ask if we could store our luggage before check in at 3:00. Gentleman at the front desk said they could, but to cross my fingers and he might be able to do better than that. Sure enough, he checked and our room was ready. What a relief after getting up at 3:45 AM and flying half way across the country, to be able to check in and lie down for a few minutes before starting to explore the area. Everyone at the front desk had a smile and was very helpful. The room was bigger than expected. It was actually larger than the Hampton Inn in Joplin, MO where we have also stayed. In Missouri my girls and I could barely move around, in NYC we had space. I'd seen comment on Trip Advisor about the rooms being small, so I was pleasantly surprised. I heard much less noise than I expected from NYC so that was also awesome. Morning of checkout, I asked if I could store my luggage since our train didn't leave until 2:40 PM. I thought since we were done, they might want to flip the room for the next customer. The gentleman at the front desk said to stay until checkout, then Luis would be able to store the luggage. After returning and checking out, we stored the luggage then went back out. Luis offered to get us a cab when we collected our luggage, and when the cab drivers refused to take us on a short ride, he personally took us to the cab line at 8th Ave, telling us they could not refuse us a ride there. What a great help! With a heavy suitcase, the fact he took the extra time, was over and beyond. I just wish I could remember to the names of the two people that worked with me at the front desk. So, if a manager reads this, the front desk on November 9th and 10th were awesome. Great staff, so happy my search lead me to your location.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: As indicated, the property is conveniently located in the Times Sqiare area. Close to theaters, restaurants, and Bryant Park. The hotel is small but it has everything you need. Free coffee and water in the lobby along with computers to use. The front desk staff is attentive and professional and overall the entrance is inviting. Rooms are very small, but attractive and clean. This is a great option for business and personal travel. I will stay there again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Very good, clean facility, room, and breakfast area. Good food and fine staff. Well located with good access to transportation including subways and buses. No problems, just a great stay, and fine experience. I will be returning.
user_name:
Dan L S
Tucson, United States

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: As every realtor would say, the three most important words in the industry are location, location, location. This place has it! In NYC, where would you stay? Why Time Square of course! Located on the edge of iconic Time Square, the property meets the Hilton standards. Great service, bed is of course, comfortable and restful, and quiet, the room was a bit small, but it’s expected for a NYC property. Close to the subway, very convenient for using public transportation. The hotel has a bar/restaurant on the same floor as the check-in as you get off the elevator and a gym. Unfortunately, I was unable to visit both as I was tired from a long day in NYC. I will have to stay again to visit the bar/restaurant and gym.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: It was our first time visiting New York. Our travel agent offered us 3 different hotels, all very similar price but we chose the Hampton Inn as it offered a free breakfast. Check-in was quick and easy. Rooms clean and modern. 4 of us in a room and we managed fine. The breakfast was a bonus, waffles , eggs , bagels and fruit and yoghurts are on offer. We always got to breakfast early as the dining room isn't big and can get busy. We chatted to Geraldine one morning , your breakfast supervisor , she is lovely. Also on offer is free tea, coffee, hot chocolate and cookies. Hotel is in a great location just off Times Square. Very good value for money. If I returned to New York I would stay here again .

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We have just returned from this fantastic hotel, it is in a great central location to Times Square and theatres. The Front desk staff were more than helpful, rooms were clean and tidy and a decent size for the location. Bathrooms were well equipped, hairdryer, toiletries and towels. The room had a safe which was great. Lifts can be slow, but you can take the time to indulge in the free coffee/tea/water available in the lobby along with free muffins/cookies during the day, a great touch as you rarely get something for nothing these days, especially in New York. The buffet breakfast was well stocked cereal/toast/bagels/sausage/bacon/eggs/waffles/fruit and yoghurts-something for everyone, does get quite busy, but as it is free you may as well take advantage of it, the breakfast staff especially Geraldine were lovely and attentive an asset to the hotel.
