The staff were very good, all were very pleasant and easy to talk to. The rooms are very clean and modern, beds very comfortable. Only the wardrobe was a little small but we just used our suitcases. The hotel has complimentary toiletries should you forget something and 24hr free tea and coffee, and I must say the coffee was excellent. The breakfast was ok, yes its busy but they also provide grab bags if you're on the go. They even provide lovely fresh cookies with the hot drinks during the day.Location was perfect. It was quiet at night and everything we wanted to see was in easy walking distance. I found the yellow cabs, surprisingly very reasonable. There are loads of places to eat and drink in easy nearby. It's the little touches that make this place special, please don't change. And thank you to all the staff. I would gladly stay there again and again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Teddy was such a sweetheart as she greeted us in the morning. She made sure we were doing well and taken care of as we ate breakfast. Teddy was a pleasure to be around. She definitely deserves a raise.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel is conveniently located near Times Square & public transportation. The hotel was clean and the room was larger than we expected. The breakfast was great with a wide variety of food. We would recommend going early because it can get crowded at times. That's to be expected when you're located in Times Square. The staff was very friendly & always willing to help. We would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: GREAT Customer Service! Convenient location! Provides fantastic breakfast! Need i say more??? We really enjoyed our stay, had a nice quiet room. Loved the quick access to Times Square. We were able to walk to a lot of our activutes and restaurants.
user_name:
Trina B
Los Angeles, United States

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location near Times Square, theaters, public transportation (Grand Central Station and Penn Station). Excellent breakfast selection, but breakfast room was crowded. Concierge service (John) was outstanding, providing Broadway show ticket options and deals.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Staff were excellent and always welcoming. Location is very near to times square. Breakfast is the usual continental one, the staff who served breakfast were very good and always helpful. The breakfast area get bit crowded around 9am so would recommend to get breakfast before 8:30am.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location - easy access to all the main sites. Free breakfast was very good although busy every morning. Olivia was super friendly at breakfast and all the staff worked hard to keep things stocked. Reception staff very friendly. Loved the free coffee and water available all day and the warm cookies in the afternoon. The room was clean and remodelled. I would absolutely recommend and stay there again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We have just returned home after seven nights at this hotel. After reading lots of positive reviews we were not disappointed. It is in a great location, with great staff from reception right through to the housekeeping . Each and everyone friendly and happy to help.Breakfast was a bonus, with plenty of choice for everyone. However the dining room did get crowded at times, that said we did not wait any more than a few minutes to find a table. Our room was clean and plenty big enough for the 4 of us. I requested a small fridge which was not a problem.It is in a great spot for many of the attractions and near great transport links for others This was our first visit to New York made all the better for our stay here. We would most definitely stay here again and would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to friends and family.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We had a family bonding trip with the kids this month of Aug. We loved it a lot. Will definitely come back again!Pros- Good deal/price from Travelzoo, Free breakfast always helps lot in the morning, location is perfect- Time Square is close to everything, the subway is just a walk away, modern and newly renovated hotel- nice ambiance and feel. Has a rooftop just for picture taking- especially at night with the lights! And of course the staff are very helpful and friendly...Con- No pool. Small rooms. Tiny lobby. Of course- it's NYC!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed at Hampton Inn last week for a girls trip to broadway and some shopping. The hotel is in Times Square area but off a side street. Easy walk to all attractions we wanted to see. The hotel is clean inside and out. Our room was excellent and the daily maid service did and excellent job cleaning daily. The front desk staff were helpful, efficient, and friendly. I wish I would have paid closer attention to their names. All amazing. We asked for both food recommendations and subway directions and were very helpful with both. I would definitely stay here on my next trip to NYC.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Cool location but there was one glaring deficiency. I usually expect a breakfast to be the best meal of the day. i couldn't make sense of the offerings in the breakfast room in this establishment so i will have breakfast somewhere else. As a member of the Hilton chain, i would expect the breakfasts to be above the quality of those from a junior school refectory. Please get a professional chef to do a review asap.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Hotel was clean and in a great location. The staff was helpful and friendly. Able to walk to many places. would stay at again. Decent breakfast provided complimentary water at the from desk. Coffee served all day in the lobby.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The hotel is clean, cosy and comfortable. The staff is polite and helpful. The breakfast is good and diverse. The wifi works very well. It's in a great location only a few meters to Times Square, Bryant Park and multiple subway stations.Highly recommended.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Clean hotel, clean rooms, good location. The complimentary breakfast area was extremely crowded each morning. Breakfast items included yogurt, mixed fresh fruit (which appeared to go very quickly), bread items, dry cereal, and two hot items. The milk ran out as well. There was just so many people and it got crowded as early as 7 am.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Room was small but adequate as we were only there to sleep. Free breakfast was a waste because it was always so packed we couldn't eat there anyway. Would have been nice to have a fridge. Location was perfect for us.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great experience! Very convenient location, quiet street but near Times Square. Helpful staff. Good value. Decent restaurants nearby, subway stops just down the street, taxis readily available. Very helpful staff. Coffee and water always available in the lobby.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The location of this Hampton inn can't be beat! Complimentary breakfast was good...yes, it's crowded and hard to find seating but that's to be expected. Room was clean. I will stay there again and have already recommended to a friend.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: As a Hilton Honors Diamond member, I try to stay with the chain whenever I travel. I used points to spend 5 nights at this location at the end of July. The Customer Service was prompt and outstanding. After using the iPhone App to check in, I wanted to see about maybe choosing a different room, so I used the "send a message" feature in the app. They responded in less than a minute and changed the room assignment for me. I asked them about a refrigerator because the person travelling with me needed to keep their medication cold, and they put one in the room free of charge. The breakfast was quite sufficient, though we did walk to Grand Central Station to enjoy Zara's bagels once we realized they had a location there. :)The location was perfect! Easy walk to Times Square, the theaters, and multiple mass transit locations - Metro, Port Authority, etc. No problems at all taking the F Train out to Citi Field to see "The Classic East" concert. We put lots of steps in enjoying the sights.One little tip: The TKTS booths are great, but if you go to the remote location down at Seaport, you'll find a lot less traffic than Times Square, better hours, and great ticket availability. We walked right up to the window at about 1:30 to purchase tickets for a show on Friday evening.I would happily return to this hotel on a future visit to NYC. BTW, I called this hotel "Budget" because I thought the rates were quite reasonable for NYC. You have to keep the location in mind when reviewing the room rates.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: If one is on a tight timeline and a first time visitor to this city looking to cram in as many touristy activities and sights then would strongly urge you to consider this hotel.Located smack bang in the middle of the theatre, broadway district , next door to the iconic Times Square the hotel is 10 minute easy paced walk to the Penn station . Access to metro abounds and there never is an issue getting a cab from the hotel.Stayed in a standard room on the fifth floor for four nights. The rooms are functional of a fairly decent size as per New York hotel room standards , bathrooms again compact but well designed . The room was fairly well insulated though the room didn't have much of a view. The bed was large and quite comfortable . The TV had all the mainstream popular channels including a couple of movie channels as well.Given we were going to be out through most of the day and evenings and merely returning for a nights rest we found the room and the hotel facilities fairly acceptable . However if you wish to spend more time within the hotel property then maybe this is not the place .The hotel organizes breakfast for those who opt for it and while one lauds their effort unfortunately the venue is way too crowded and the self service buffet table hard to access . The fare on offer is not fancy but wholesome such as cereals milk, fruits some form of bacon and eggs. Also there is free flow of tea and coffee through the day in the hotel lobby and a specially nice gesture was for them to organize freshly baked cookies every day in the lobby .The biggest improvement area I felt was the wait time for the elevators during peak hours in the morning. On a couple of occasions I had to trudge down from the fifth floor as there would be no lift access at all possible .To sum up if you are a first time visitor on a budget looking to spend around $130 to $170 per night for a clean centrally located hotel then this place is for you.
user_name:
Nawabofdelhi1
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Location is excellent if you want the full Times Square experience. Staff wonderful. Easy to check in and out. Free water and coffee always available which was so refreshing after being out all day. Did not wait long for elevators. Quiet at night. Can't wait to return.
user_name:
Bullmastiffmom2max
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I've stayed here several times and never been disappointed. It is my go to hotel when other Hilton options in Midtown are too expensive. Great location within easy walking distance to theaters, restaurants, subway, etc. Newer property with clean, tastefully decorated rooms, comfortable beds and decent size for NY. Staff is very friendly and helpful. They always get me the type of room I want. The only reason I don't give it 5 stars is because it's not a full service hotel, nor is is trying to be.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed for three days with the family. The hotel is clean and modern and the rooms not quite as small as I had dreaded. The breakfast is good although the room gets very crowded at prime time. (They have take away containers so we just took the food back to the room). They also have generously have free cookies for afternoon snack and take away bags for travel with water and a snack. Broadway theaters are steps to a few blocks away and you are in close proximity by walking, subway or cab/uber to others. The only drawback is the elevators. They are slow and small and there are only three. One was out of commission for half our stay. Luckily I knew about this and got a room on a low floor. We hoofed it up and down a few times because of the long waits. Otherwise a great family hotel for a visit to the city.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My husband and I stayed for 4 nights in August. This is a great hotel as other reviews have said. Yes breakfast area gets really crowded but its workable. We ended up getting our food and sitting in the lobby. Room was clean and large enough for two people. My only pet peave is the bathroom door. Hampton Inns are now using the barn door concept. I cannot imagine why this was put into place. It is not private nor does the door fully close so every sound echos into the room. Please have these doors changed Hampton Inn!! Also, the towels that are placed in the rooms are extremely thin. And we only received two at each room change (we didn't ask for more and should have). Hope that this hotel will upgrade their towels so that they can be a perfect hotel! That being said, we will be back. The positive attributes far exceed these minor problems.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The Hampton Inn Manhattan is a good hotel. Rooms are confortable and the breakfast is excellent. The attendants are very educated and gentle. Very good localios, near times square, macys, Empire State Building.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great hotel. Great staff. Great location. This as a very fresh,clean and high-end feeling hotel at very reasonable rates. It is close to all broadway theaters and restaurants. This will be our go-to hotel for all of our future NYC trips.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: As always, a most warm and hospitable four days at the Hampton Time Square. When I arrived, I noticed Jai-Paul standing at his spot with a wonderful smile and his hand waving me in. He immediately had my room assignment ready to go, as always exactly where I wanted to be. Wilbur and Stewart were standing on guard, making sure that my baggage was ready to be taken to the room if I couldn't take it. And as always, a "Tell us if you need anything" from Wilbur's mouth was heard as the elevator door closed. Also, Laurence welcomed me back, allowing me to give him a big hug and asking us how I was doing and what he could do for me while staying at the hotel. In the morning, Rosa was at the breakfast bar asking if I needed any assistance with a big smile on her face and a "glad to see you are back." When my visit was over, I knew I would see them in December and always look forward to my family away from home.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Unlike other hotels in that area, the Hampton Inn is an excellent choice for families. It is just 5 minutes away from Times Square, in a much quieter street. The free breakfast is excellent with a wide choice. The breakfast room is therefore very crowded!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This was my first visit to NY, the hotel couldn't have been better placed. Very close to Time square and all the theatres, subways etc. Clean secure hotel. 24hr complimentary drinks in the lobby and around teatime complimentary cookies! Staff were extremely helpful and knowledgeable about how to get to locations and what was worth visiting out of the usual sites. We did not manage to see everything we had hoped to but that gives us good excuse to return! I loved New York. The people are so friendly and helpful. They must be used to seeing lost visitors! We used subway and buses and the ferry, no problems on any. I would return to this hotel anytime.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Whithout a doubt, this is a very clean hotel and the staff very hospitable and helpful. This hotel boasts the perfect location to everywhere in New York City and is walking distance to Bryant Park and of course, Times Square! Stayed for one week and had absolutely, positively a positive experience. Highly recommend! Daily buffet breakfast is included which is a bonus...get there early though, as place fills fast!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed for 3 nights and had a comfortable stay in a convenient location by Times Square. There were tons of dining options nearby and it was really close to the subway to go uptown or downtown. The staff we encountered were friendly and helpful. Breakfast and the elevators are very busy at peak times in the morning, which is to be expected. We were pleased with our stay and would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Room was decent size, comfortable bed and friendly staff. Can walk to either Grand Central or Penn stations. What more do you need in NYC?Breakfast area was crowded with lots of choices but overall not great food. I would rather pay less and skip the breakfast (so many options in NYC).

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Hotel was in a great location, minutes from Times Square, Staff was very nice and accommodating.. but you need to bring your patience.. a BIG backlog waiting on elevators both going to your room and coming down to the lobby. Once you cleared the elevators it was a very good experience.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We really enjoyed our stay at the Hampton Inn Times Square central. The staff is beyond helpful and friendly rooms are updated and very comfortable. Great location! Breakfast is great although very crowded. Could benefit from a little bigger room. Definitely would stay again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: 3 nights stay with family and 2 kids under 10. The rooms were spacious and no street noise although I requested a low floor to avoid the lift wait in the morning - which was good as we used the stairs from the 4th floor it was such a long wait.Breakfast was the usual Hampton - in a nice room, but as usual with city free breakfasts - it was VERY busy at peak times.We walked from the hotel to see the 4th July fireworks on the East river and it wasn't too bad. Hotel is placed excellent for everything, and if you want to get onto 42nd street without going round the block - just cut through the back door of McDonalds across the street.Hotel staff were extremely friendly and helpful - really makes a difference.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This was a last minute reservation, so I payed full price :(But it wroth it. It was in the center of Times Square, close to all major activities.You are only a block a way from Times Square, 2 blocks from Bryant Park, and one block from the Subway.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: HH was really nice and good choice when it comes to location.Shopping area is very close.. Safe place to stay. Our room is clean and front desk staff are very nice. Breakfast was good.. will definitely book my next trip again in this hotel

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Our family of four stayed for 4 nights in July. This hotel is in an excellent location, right next to Times Square and the subway station, easy walk to many places. The continental breakfast was great, it was a bit busy at times but the food was good. Excellent service at the front desk, we were able to check in early and able to get a fridge in our room. It was a nice touch to have the warm cookies and travel bags with snacks and water every day. Only complaint is that the beds were a bit small but other than that very clean, decent sized rooms for New York City. We enjoyed our visit and would definitely recommend and stay at this hotel again!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed here earlier this week. The hotel is overall ok even though it is a noisy part of town with small rooms as you'd expect in NYC. Not many amenities but what got me is that when I checked out no one offered to give me a copy of my bill or say that it would be emailed to me. I ended up having to call in several days later and after about 5 atttempts finally found someone who could help me. Not a business friendly hotel that I would recommend to fellow business travelers :{
user_location: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
user_name:
Rasheq R
Washington, District of Columbia, United States

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We spent a few nights here in June (family of 4). room was clean and quiet. The breakfast area was crowded in the morning, but the staff there was awesome! Convenient location to Broadway theaters and mass transit to get around the city. I would recommend going to the roof for city view. We would stay here again recommend this

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The staff was super friendly at check in and I didn't have to wait at all! The rooms were bigger than ones I have stayed in while in NYC before. Very clean and modern! The free breakfast was a great way to start our day, just wish the space was a little bigger. The location was GREAT! We were so close and in walking distance to Times Square, Bryant park herald square, and Madison square garden. The Times Square subway station was a two minute walk when we were going to the bronx and Brooklyn. Overall, a great stay!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Last spring, I stayed at this last spring, and decided to return for the summer. When I checked in, Rochelle (the front desk agent) remembered me and my family from my previous visit. She provided stellar customer service throughout my stay. This hotel is in a great location. We were a short walk from the subway and many popular restaurants. After seeing Aladdin, we dropped our bags off at the hotel and went across the street to wait for the cast (which was quite convenient). They took pictures with us and signed our Playbills. The breakfast area could have been bigger (it tended to be overwhelming). We ended up bypassing the complimentary breakfast and grabbing a quick bite elsewhere.I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This was our first visit to NY and we started out with a stay at this Hotel the first night between the 9. and 10 of Juli. Very fine Hotel, very good service, as there in the receptionarea also is free water, free coffee a.s.o. Superb breakfast! The room was nice and clean, the best greetings from a danish Family of 4, which had to move to another more expensive hotel (Mela), which didn´t has the same service and was quit poor in comparation wiht this Hotel....The best greetings to Hampton Inn from Denmark.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Right in the heart of time square! Beautiful new hotel small rooms, but perfect for a tourist visiting the city. The price is super great, better then staying off island. Huge breakfast buffet. Can't go wrong!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We were able to check in about an hour early, our room was beautiful and clean, and the breakfast was the nicest free meal I have experienced at a hotel. We'll definitely be back. The location in Manhattan cannot be beat!! Highly recommend.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This is just one of the many premium hotels the Hilton offers in the Times Sq area. Clean, neat , new, great breakfast. Close to everything. A fifteen minute walk to Central Park or the Union Sq farmers market

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Had a Great experience! Staff was very friendly, eager to assist and informative, especially Luis (he rocked). Rooms were on the smaller side but were very clean and had the essentials. Complimentary breakfast for the fam was a plus but seats were limited during the late morning, we brought ours back to the room. When waiting for an elevator in the morning, I thought I was standing in line for a Disney ride. The stairs are quicker and was a great morning workout (11 floors glad it was not 30). Location was perfect with Time Square only steps away. We took the CitySight tour bus (good price on groupon) which was the next street over taking us to all the main attractions, walked to Central Park and was close to John's Pizzeria which had the BEST NY Pie ever! We will be back...

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Nice size rooms for the area. Very clean. The beds are full size instead of queen size you normally expect with Hampton. Breakfast is too crowded and you should expect to wait for the elevators for a very long time

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I enjoyed my stay at this like new property in Manhattan. I received a great rate for the location and service received via AA booking site. I visited The Counter restaurant many times during my stay which is on the corner. The room was of adequate size and it was very clean. I got text messages daily to see if I needed anything. I will definitely be back thanks!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I would definitely stay here again! It was in a great location, very clean and attractive, and extremely nice staff! The price was reasonable and the breakfast was great. Our room was very nice and larger than other places I have stayed in this area.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: comfy rooms, allowed early check-in, funky, fun lobby and hot breakfast buffet. a bit of quiet in midtown madness! only wish i could have added that extra night at our group rate - would have stayed longer.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Love staying at The Hampton Inn Manhattan Central. The location of hotel was excellent for us because it was so close to the theater district and Times Square. Uber is a plus for anything that wasn't close in proximity.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I spent a week in this hotel on a trip to New York with my mum. The hotel is in a great location close to Times Square. The room was a good size, very clean and modern. Breakfast had lots of food on offer, although did get very busy. My favourite part of breakfast was the waffle machines, such a good idea! One lovely thing about the hotel was the free hot drinks and water available in the lobby all day, this was nice after walking around the city. All the staff were friendly and helpful and while we were there they were having a week for charity and did different things each day such as wearing a funny hat or wig.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel is very well located and it brings you the basics you need. It provides you breakfast, good location, reasonable space in the rooms and good bed. What it does not provide ? Good service. The elevators are completely crowdy. You can be waiting for a place to get in for 20 minutes, mainly during breakfast pick hours. The attendants are some what rude, if you ask for something differently than what they are supposed to know and they do not have any interest in learning. I asked if I could put my bill in the HHonors since this is a Hilton brand, and I was treated like asking for the kidney of someone. The guy treated me like a dumb and like if I SHOULD know the answer. From my experience this not not NYC. But the value is fair. T

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We enjoyed our stay at the Hampton Inn Times Square Central. The rooms were clean and staff was helpful and courteous. We easily found a table for our party of 7 to have breakfast together. We'd definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Just returned after a 4 night stay at the hotel. If you want to be just off Times Sq and 'relatively' quiet then this hotel is a good choice. Rooms were fine - we slept 3 adults in one room without difficulty; yes - I have had larger rooms but if you want to go to NYC and sit in your room then you are mad. Hotel has no dining (other than breakfast) and no bar, although it does have a pantry with outrageously priced drinks, food etc ($6 for a bottle of Heineken). Big negative - the lifts. Absolutely outrageous waits for a lift and the maids monopolise them using bypasses to move around at peak times. wasn't unusual to wait 5-10min for a lift at 9am in the morning. Get a room on lower floors and get some exercise and use the stairs! Breakfast - free but pretty lame. Cooked option everyday I was there was poor - better to keep to yoghurt, fruit, muffins etc. Also - no space so people have to eat in the hotel lobby, in the business area etc.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: $415 (including taxes) for one night is really high for a hotel of similar quality to most Hampton Inns, but I suppose that's New York. Or at least the Times Square area. This, like most Hamptons, is a nice hotel -- no question about that. The staff are friendly and the rooms are comfortable (though quite small) and are unexpectedly quiet. If you want to be right in the Times Square area and this hotel is competitively priced to similar hotels around it, then by all means I would consider it. But do compare prices, as many less expensive and very nice hotels are often just a few-minutes walk (or subway ride) away.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I've stayed at many hotels in the city (midtown, times square, financial district), and I must say that although there is much room for improvement at this hotel, as of now -- it's simply mediocre. First of all, there are only 3 elevators for 31 flights, and none of them are service elevators. This means, the room service & housekeeping staff uses their key cards to bypass the elevators to meet their needs. The outcome? Paying customers have to WAIT. Advice: When checking in, ask for a LOWER level room so that you can take the stairs!! 2nd beef: The continental breakfast HOARDERS!!! A word of advice to Hampton....if you want all of your customers to be able to grab a bite for breakfast, PLEASE make it a rule that NOBODY leaves the room with more than a plate of food (not a take-away container). I realize some people bring food up for kids/family who are sleeping a bit later (acceptable), but people will take FULL advantage of the word "FREE". I witnessed families taking 3-4 plastic take-away containers, filled with ALL of the muffins, banana bread and pastries -- to the point where the other guests were left with NONE, then proceeded to fill their pockets with bananas and oranges. One lady zoomed to grab the last 4 omelets, knowing there were others behind her in line. Don't allow the selfishness of some to ruin it for your other paying customers. Set a standard of etiquette for these gluttonous idiots, to get a life and buy their carbs outside!! Finally, perhaps it may not be standard anymore, but there are no doormen at this hotel.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The friendly staff were welcoming and greeted us at check in with bottled water and yummy cookies. The room was small, but clean. Elevators were slow. This hotel was a good value with complimentary breakfast and a great location to walk to many destinations in Times Square.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My son booked this hotel for me by his Hilton credit points. I had a good experience about Hilton. But this hotel is different. When me and my wife was entering with our luggage nobody went to help us, though I've observed later that even they help to bring out luggage from taxi .....depending on skin color! The reception people are very reluctant to talk and never they smiled at us. The room was small and there was no easy chair in my room, which I found in other room. I was astonished to find that there is no freezer in the room! The toilet is ok. The breakfast area is small and after 7.30 it's very difficult to find a place to sit. The breakfast is very basic. There should have been some readymade waffles as it's difficult for elderly people (as we are) to prepare by themselves. The only thing I liked is their whole day coffee/tea facilities and free fresh cookies in the afternoon ( though the timing is not maintained). The location is good. You can find some good restaurants within walking distance. It's a good place for cinema/theatre lovers. For a short trip you can stay here!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We really enjoyed this hotel from the 14/07 till 25/07. We are particularly thankful to Makeda and Teddy , at the restaurant, who have been so nice and helpful to us during our stay. They did everything for us and our children so as to make our stay as comfortable as possible. We shall leave the hotel tomorrow with nice memories from NYC , but also from the nice members of the staff we mentioned above. Thank you and take care:-) Dr Peerally ( France)

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location on times square and close to the subway. Hotel was nice, clean, and the staff was friendly and helpful. I especially enjoyed the ice cold water that was available in the lobby. After hours of walking the city, it was so refreshing to walk right in and get a cup of ice water.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: $34 lyft from LGA. lobby was well decorated and the couple of fellows at the check in desk were pretty nice. one guy rattled off a list of complimentary items that became slightly comically long. room on high floor was small (expected) and clean, comfortable bed and good wifi.cant remember the exact hours for breakfast but they were pretty standard for hotels. think it stopped at 10:30 but hold me to it. breakfast room got really crowded and we had to search/wait a few minutes for seats. line for the fresh waffles backed up. good food tho.they had a secure room where they kept our luggage for a few hours after check out. $54 lyft to JFKsummary: decent price, 5 minute walk to times square, clean rooms and good breakfast.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel was a good value, with a prime location, great service. No complaints at all! Room was small, but nice. Breakfast was a nice touch and saved lots of money in a pricey city like New York City!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The staffs are great and very helpful. They do their best to do whatever I asked for, housekeeping is perfect, and it definitely worth the money. Location is very good, not too crowded, still 2 minutes away from times square. Really feel comfortable.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: great hotel, great service, the stuff are very nice and welcoming .the location of the hotel is a minute walk from the time square the breakfast was good a lot of options for eating There are washing machines and dryers at the hotel and at a cost of $ 4 you can wash

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Friendly staff. Good location. Rooms Clean and fresh daily. the only downside was thatthe windows were a bit small and could not open wide enough.Breakfasts were limited, but enough for me... will definitely use again

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We chose to stay at this hotel because it was centrally located for Times Square and we had stayed WAY too far out on other occasions. We loved the hotel. The free breakfast was good, even though it could sometimes be a little crowded - go earliest or go later, 8 am was a zoo, but you could grab a plate and take it back to your room if there were no tables available so we did that.Staff were friendly and helpful too - no problems there at all.We could hear some traffic noise and see some of the lights of Times Square from our window, but heck, isn't that what us yokels come to NYC for anyway?It was close enough to walk to most places from (except the most Uptown and Downtown locations) - near to the Subway, but honestly we started to take taxis as it was cheaper and faster.It was only a short walk to Penn Station with our wheelie luggage, so that was great too.As to the room, it was spacious for NYC for sure and had places to store clothing outside of our suitcases, which not all rooms have these days. There was a room safe too, so we didn't have to carry everything.We had 2 beds and both were very comfortable - they were soft and no signs of dips or popping springs.I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone and we plan to come back here next time we stay in NYC too - this would be the first time we've liked a hotel in NYC enough to want to return to it!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed overnight for my birthday July 4th. The hotel was very clean with nice personal touches such as round the clock free coffee and tea station. It is a very convenient location to all the spots in Times Sq. and the theatre district. The bed and linen was clean and comfy. The check in process was efficient and the clerk was very professional. We would totally stay here again!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My kids and I went to NYC for a long weekend and stayed here. I would recommend this hotel for several reasons.... First, it's in the heart of Times Square, with all the hustle and bustle. The hotel is only a short walk from several subway stations, so hopping on going to other areas of the city was really easy. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Our room was clean and had a great view. The breakfast was plentiful; even when you go down right before service ends. They offer snack bags each morning with bottle water and muffins/granola bars at the front desk. I would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: MarLen and Shagana who staffed the breakfast area were always smiling, personable, and helpful as were the staff at the front desk. This hotel is within easy walking distance to Grand Central Station. We would definitely stay at this hotel again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel offers a short walk to the Bus Terminal, subway system (go anywhere), Times Square, Rockefeller Center and a lot of Restaurants to choose from. Only small issues we found were the three elevators were alway in heavy demand and wait time for one could be up to five minutes. Also, the complimentary breakfast was fair but the room was always full so nobody was complaining.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: excellent location, friendly staff and nice spacious bedrooms. I don't think you could ask for better in NYC complimentary breakfast was nice but a little crowded, but they do give you fair warning about peak times to avoid. I would stay there again anytime.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I was very impressed with the hotel and with the staff at the hotel. The room was larger than I expected for New York. With it being a newer hotel, it had the much-appreciated modern features like USB charging stations, extra plug-ins, and everything was updated and in good condition in the room. My room was very clean and was quieter than I expected with the proximity to Times Square. Great central location so it was easy to walk to many major attractions or to hop on the subway. If I get to come back to New York, I will definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed at the Hampton Inn time square north July 10-13 2017. Have to say excellent location 3 blocks from time square. The staff was excellent and very helpful, breakfast was included and it had enough variety to keep most people happy. My only complaint was that the room we were in was a king suite And the bed was rather uncomfortable and some of the furniture was outdated. Other then that would definitely recommend this property

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I've stayed in similar chain hotels in the same price category and this is by far the best. The location is great if you want to spend time in the Broadway/Times Square area. We had a double room (two double beds) which was the very spacious considering size limitations in the city. The bathroom was big by comparison as well. There was a tub/shower combo and in my past experiences (Marriott/Hilton Garden Inn/Holiday Inn) there had only been a shower so this was a surprise. The room was clean. The beds were fine, again, it's not the Plaza, but they were comfortable. The public spaces are clean and tidy. The staff really knocks it out of the park. Everyone is smiling, helpful, and courteous. That really makes a difference. I will definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed here on our latest trip to NYC. The staff was extremely helpful with any questions we had. They had great suggestions and a wonderful sense of humor. We were on the 3rd floor which I ended up being grateful for because the elevators were a little slow. They do have breakfast here but the room is very small and very crowded. To me if you are in NYC, go our for breakfast. Real close to Times Square, Hudson, and Central Park. I would stay here again!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The location is great, right near Times Square. I checked in using the Hilton Honors app and the front desk was very efficient when I arrived. The included breakfast was great. Room was extremely clean and very nice, albeit a bit small, but that's NYC. A quick stay that was very comfortable for a weekend business trip.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel is in such a great location! We had a very pleasant experience here. Our flight got in early, and they kept our belongings so that we could explore the city. Very Clean, and we had a GREAT view from our room. We will be staying here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The location was great, this was not the over-the-top service where multiple employees were involved (i.e., multiple tips). Everything was nice and just right. This location is very close to subway stations and Times Square. We valet parked and everything worked out great.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This Hotel is right in Times Square. Near Restaurante, Thearted Stores, Parks and even the Subway. It also Has great service, confortable beds, and a very good Breakfast. It even has a Laudry. A must stay.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We had a fantastic stay at this great value for money hotel. The staff were very friendly and couldn't do enough to help, especially the lovely Geraldine at breakfast! The beds are really comfy and our room was very quiet even though you're only a block away from Times Square. I would definitely recommended this hotel to friends and family.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We chose this location because of the location and the value of the room and hot breakfast. I wasn't sure if all would be OK but our family doesn't require a lot of "high end" amenities. The hotel was very clean. The staff was extremely accommodating. Breakfast being part of the hotel rate was well beyond a continental buffet.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel was in the perfect location to walk to many iconic NYC sights. The staff was very helpful and it was so nice to be steps from a subway station, next door to a broadway house, and near so many awesome restaurants. All of this without being to congested.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I was very happy with my stay. The room was clean, the bed was comfortable, breakfast was substantial and the staff was amazing!!! The location is very convenient as well. It's a short walk to Times Square and theaters.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The hotel is perfect because you can trust your guest room its going to be perfectly clean, white perfect sheets and pillows. The hotel is conveniently located in front of Mc Donalds and a few steps to the Subway station. Choose higher floors to avoid street noise. Room 2609 was small but enough for a couple and you get a view of the Empire State Building which looks so pretty by night. Totally recommend it!!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My mom, cousin, boyfriend and I stayed here this past weekend. The hotel was very well priced for what you get. The beds were extremely comfortable, the rooms were very clean, and the free hot breakfast was perfect before hitting the city. The location is prime! You walk out and you're In the heart of the city. I was worried about the elevator situation since that seemed to be a common complaint in other reviews but it only seemed to be an issue around breakfast time when everyone was trying to get out and it honestly didn't take that long. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Overall, it was the perfect stay ! Highly recommend

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I was able to walk to the hotel from Penn station which made it convenient. We were able to walk to almost everywhere we wanted to go or grab a subway and were there in a few minutes. I was looking for an inexpensive hotel in New York that wasn't a dive and this one did just fine. The rooms were small but we weren't there to hang out in the room so it was fine. Everything was clean and the beds were comfortable. The TV was big and worked fine. No view because of the building around it. The air conditioner is the old floor/wall kind but it worked, just a bit noisy. The shower was made of tile and not fiberglass which I found nice. The employees were all very nice, helpful, and prompt. The breakfast was a decent continental - they had make yourself omelettes and bacon if you got up early enough, otherwise it would be ham. It was just fine for the price and it was close to time square. there were some fun bars around too, and a dave and busters.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I love Hamptons because the guest rooms are perfectly clean. White sheets and fresh pillows. Bathroom comfortable and very clean. It's perfect. In this Hampton the room is smaller but of course in NYC. But the shower has enough space. Breakfast is good. I chose room 2609 which had view of Empire State Building. Top floors avoid noise from street and the elevators are fast. Just I few times had to wait for other guests in the elevator. Oh and it's conveniently across a Mc Donald's and a few steps from the Subway Station.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Hampton Inn Times Square was in the perfect location. The hotel made our stay so comfortable. There are some wonderful perks with this hotel that I have never seen before- *coffee/tea/flavoured water, all day *fresh baked cookies *snack bags to go with fruit, bottle of water and a snack We had a fantastic experience with this hotel and would definitely recommend.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: From check-in to check-out we were very satisfied with our stay. I would love to see improvements to the breakfast options but it is complimentary so we cannot complain too much! Everything else was !
user_name:
Michael D
Lake George, New York

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We arrived in the morning, well before check-in time, and checked our bags at the hotel. The young man who did so (don't forget to tip!) allowed us access to the bathrooms near the fitness center on the cellar level.After a day of sight-seeing, we returned to check in to our room. The room was cozy but not too small - I'm guessing it's probably a pretty good sized room by NYC standards. The bathroom had a sliding "barn-door-style" door to save space, as well as a large shower, sink (in the bathroom) and hairdryer. No refrigerator in the room, but there was an iron and ironing board.The 3 elevators in the building are fast, but with 30+ floors and around 10 rooms per floor, we did have to wait, especially from about 8-11 AM, around check-in time, and right before showtime. We had a room on a middle floor in the building facing 41st Street. Perhaps the views are better higher up or on the back of the building, but if I were to reserve again I would have chosen a lower floor and used the stairs more.Access to the Times Square subway is half a block away and across the street - very convenient. We took the Q70-SBS and 7 subway to and from LGA with a small amount of luggage and saved lots of money in the process!The breakfast is fantastic - lots of options and it changes daily. It does fill up around 8:30 AM but there is additional seating area in the lobby and it seems to "turn over" pretty quickly.Overall I would highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We are visiting from California, and only stayed 1 night here because we are booked at 2 other Hilton properties due to a previous commitment.Our room was tucked away in a corner, quiet, and clean.Hot breakfast is always a plus but what really stood out was your employee named David , who absolutely went above and beyond for us and needs definate kudos and recognition.Well Mama ( me) accidently left behind a pair of shoes when checking out and didnt realize it until I went to put them on and thought uh oh looks like im gonna have to go buy another pair of shoes and its 10pm .So we had just gone to see a play across the street so we went inside & asked by any chance did u find them? David was so kind, he dug thru the office and when he walked away our 8 year old daughter sprung on us " i accidently left my new outfit hanging in the closet" sure enough David walked back out with a bag and I thought oh no i cant see myself asking him to go search for her outfit as well... but sure enough as I started to tell him he just smiled and said "disney outfit?" we were so grateful, and lobby was busy and he didnt have to do this and couldve said " sorry lady call back tomorrow and talk to housekeeping" I asked him ( since he looked really young) how old are you? He said 21..and then i thanked him profusely and he simply said " I wanted to help and make you guys happy and not stress" We were so impressed.His service and work ethic at such a young age is a great example for others to follow .Hes going to go places .Thank you again.I want the boss to see this.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Yes we liked the stay, but window scene towards the city was nothing great, for which we paid extra money.Hampton Inn charged 20+20 = 40 $ on my credit card as security but it is not yet refunded means it hasn't credited in my credit card account as yet. Kindly convey & inform me.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed for a week. Clean rooms but the elevator situation is terrible. I was on the 29th floor and had to wait up to 15 mins to get an elevator. Staff don't have a service elevator. So cleaning ladies ride with you in the same elevator. With their cleaning carts.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Better WiFi, elevator accessibility, and some kind of breakfast scheduling, let's say....per floors, or similar.... would be great....not much one can do about room sizes, so, you are forgiven on that one......otherwise, we had a good and pleasurable stay at your hotel....

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My daughter has decided she would like to go to college in New York, so we came for a site tour. We stayed at the Hampton Inn based on the price & location. Boy, did we make a good choice!!! Wonderful hotel, clean & new. Great, helpful staff & remarkable customer service!!! We will return & I highly recommend it to all!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We were in room 2905 - pretty expansive view for the 29th floor. Could see most of the spire atop the Empire State Building (but not the entire spire or any of the ESB itself). We actually loved the view - hundreds of different buildings in a thick skyline looking directly south. We had reserved 3005 on the online check in but were given 2905 when we got to the hotel - were told whoever was in that room extended their stay. Sounds fishy to me, but what's the real difference between 29 and 30? The high floor was good - there was always room for us to get on from the 29th floor while much lower floors had to wait for subsequent elevators sometimes. We heard zero street/outside noise from our room. I was expecting a walk-in shower from the website's photos, but it was a standard Hampton Inn tub/shower combo. Very comfortable beds. Just 1.5 blocks from Times Square and loads of Subway lines, close to most Broadway theaters. Nice lobby with good "hang out" seating. Strong wifi. Breakfast was good - great that it starts at 6am! Something for everyone in our group of four. Seemed always to be plenty of front desk staff eager to help with anything. A quick 10-15 minute walk to Penn Station. Coin laundry in the lower level of the hotel.
user_name:
citysuburb
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The customer service it was just amazing.Excellent cleanliness of the room, breakfast more than enough . The ladies at the breakfast location they were so helpful.I totally recommend this location Thank you

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I had so many issues with the staff I don't know where to start. couldn't check in at the promised time. had to call housekeeping 3 times (out of a 7 day stay) because they forgot to tend to the room. 15 minutes wait for the elevator 24/7. bad breakfast. barely workable internet connection. for everything you need to come to the front desk because they are too lazy to pick up their phone. excuses from the staff instead solutions.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed at this hotel for three wonderful days in June. The location was wonderful, close to Times Square, the theater district, and a major subway station. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Views were terrific too. The hospitality was super, from help with luggage to fresh baked cookies daily. Having a free breakfast was great too. Staff was friendly especially Teddy in the breakfast area. Her warm smile and helpful ways could not have been better! We will stay again when in NYC because the Hampton Inn Central offers hotel and hospitality at its best!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: great stay and great location. The staff was extremely helpful. We would definitely stay here again. Breakfast had a great variety. Clean rooms, nice rooftop overview. Tobo and Luis were helpful, cookies and beverages available were a nice touch

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Nice, clean hotel room. We were on the 20th floor and had a decent view of the city. Complimentary breakfast was good- there is limited seating so you may have to walk around a while until someone gets up. The only complaints were the towels were extremely thin and small and the toilet paper was extremely cheap- felt like sand paper after a few uses.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This was our first trip as a family to NYC. Hotel was perfect location to walk to most everything we wanted to do. Only had to take Subway twice the entire week. Hotel staff were helpful and patient. It was just far enough from Times Square and we were high enough that the noise wasn't as bad as I had heard it would be. Would definitely stay here again and recommend this hotel to anyone. The only negative thing we experienced wass sometimes we would wait 10-15 minutes for an elevator but it was only during popular "breakfast" times it seemed.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Another reviewer said that the beds were hard-SO not true! I used to travel a lot, and hard beds hurt. The beds at this hotel are firm, but they don't hurt. The hotel is new, and the beds are great. Everything was clean, the rooms are a good size, and even though we were close to the elevator we never heard it or our neighbors. The complimentary breakfast was stellar, great selection of food. We recieved a free early check-in, and were able to leave our luggage at the desk after check-out until we were ready to leave that night. This was a great experience. Thank you, Hampton Inn!!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I have been to NYC several times and have stayed at many hotels but this may be my favorite so far! I was very impressed with the customer service. From the moment I walked in I felt very welcome - from the valet outside to the front desk workers. Check-in was quick and easy, and we were given a welcome bag with bottles of water. The beds were so comfortable and the bathroom was spacious and beautiful! I slept great! Breakfast was very good - just about everything you could think of, hot and cold items. Delicious! I was very impressed when I came down in the morning and was greeted by name by the valet! Luis was great as he hailed us a cab and offered help for whatever we needed. Will also hailed us a cab, and even went down the street and around the corner to find one! Every employee we encountered was very friendly and greeted us. The location was great, right around the corner from Broadway and 42nd St. and close to the subway. Free wifi, mini-fridge upon request, snacks and drinks in the lobby. Valet parking was quick and easy. The only thing was that the elevators were slow, but I expect that in NYC anyway with all the people coming and going all day. I would definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location. Very friendly and knowledgeable staff. Excellent free breakfast to help start your day. Nice rooms. Complimentary wifi to help keep you connected. Exceptional service that go above and beyond to make your staff memorable.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We had a wonderful stay at the Hampton Inn. Free breakfast was great and food was really good. Very close to subways and Time Square. I would recommend to anyone and would stay there again. Staff super friendly.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Excellent hotel. Great service with caring staff! Complimentary coffee/water 24-7. Room clean, bed wonderful. Quiet on the 12th floor. Luis helped us with our bags for us after we checked out but before we left. Teddy was great at breakfast! Only negative was morning use of elevators not very practical.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Perfect location in heart of Tines Square and steps from subway. Decent size room for Manhattan. Very clean friendly service. Free breakbast was ok...than again it is free. Would definitely recommend and come back.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The Hampton Inn Times Square Central hotel is an absolutely beautiful hotel. The lobby is sleek and hip and the room is designed beautifully. We were greeted with bottled water right when we checked in. The front desk staff were so friendly and fast at check in. The bed was so comfortable. We called down to the front desk on 2 occasions (once for extra towels and once for extra shampoo). Both times we called, someone arrived at our room in less than 5 minutes. Such amazing service! I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel to anyone. I wouldn't stay anywhere else in NYC, especially with the amazing price I got on this room!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel is relative new, very clean and great location in Times Square. You can walk to many attractions. Free hot breakfast, great staff and free wifi. The staff was great and aimed to please. I am not adding my pictures because my room looked exactly like the hotel pictures.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We were greeted by a staff member who made us feel unwanted from the very beginning with his rudeness and it only got worse from there. He was was dismissive and Arrogant when we tried to query a one too many withdrawal on our credit card prior to our arrival and cut my husband off when he tried to explain what had happened, in fact turning to another customer mid check-in to serve someone else when he hadn't even finished ours. We thought if this is the face of this hotel what were we in for! He refused to explain and help us with our inquiry and even listen to what we were trying to say. When he finally finished the check in and gave us our keys it was the bell boy that stepped in and help us with our question to our room and where to go, at least he was lovely. Our parents checked in straight after us and the desk clerk was just as rude to them. I would of rated this hotel a 1 based on this and other frontdesk experiences but to be fair to the hotel itself I included the full experience.The hotel itself was nice enough, we've stayed at many Hampton inn's around America and have always like them for value and service. Our room was clean and amenities comfortable. I loved the beds here, we found them so comfortable. The breakfast is included when you stay and it gets extremely busy, the sitting area is small for the amount of guests that stay here so once we couldn't even have our breakfast because there were no seats left. I suggest you go down early for best selection and a seat to sit in. The range is good, both hot and cold, and freshly cooked waffles are always my favourite. The location of the hotel was right in the thick of things so if you want that, it's great. The theatres right there at the doorstep, restaurants by the dozens, people everywhere, bus terminal only a couple of minutes walk away and the lights of Times Square a short walk away. If you want a less "full on" experience, because the people are so many here, then stay further away from this area. We have been to New York three times now in the past 7 years and our best experience has been when we stayed in Harlem in an brownstone apartment. At this stay, the amount of people were just overwhelmingly crazy.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We recently stayed at this Hampton Inn for 2 evenings as a family. Our double room was actually quite spacious by NYC standards, up to date and clean. The hotel seemed to be fully booked and the only downside of our experience was that the three elevators were really slow due to the volume. We walked up and down 12 flights a few times rather than wait. The highlight of our experience, however, was meeting Teddy in the breakfast room. Teddy has got to be one of the hardest working and most pleasant people in NYC. While we were there the breakfast room was PACKED. Lines for waffles, people sharing tables with other parties, etc. Teddy was constantly on the move making sure everything was fully stocked and interacting with the guests with an incredibly positive attitude. Kudos to Teddy!!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel has a great location. About a block from Times Square, and a subway station with multiple lines at the end of the street. The service at this property is top notch. Everyone there goes out of their way to make your stay enjoyable. And as mid-town hotel prices go, this property is quite reasonable. However, be aware there are several issues that keep this hotel getting an Excellent rating. First, the three elevators are inadequate during the breakfast/check out rushes in the morning. So be prepared for a wait. Second, the breakfast room gets crowded around 9am so you may have a short wait for a table. Finally, while we heard no noise from the adjoining rooms, the street noise (even on the 16th floor) is noticeable at night. So request a back room if this will be an issue for you. We were fine by just running the A/C fan continuously. Other than these issues, this is a great hotel and we would definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We have stayed in other hotels in Time Square and this one was the best for our money. Spacious rooms, complimentary breakfast (which is rare), friendly and attentive staff, reasonable prices. We will come back to this hotel.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This was my second stay at this Hampton Inn...once in the winter and now summer. Both times it was a pleasant stay. The staff is very helpful and welcoming. Delicious cookies in the evening and a nice buffet breakfast in the morning. Also available are a light breakfast to go. The location is perfect for theater goers and near the subway too. Many restaurants are within easy walking distance. In the spring and summer the hotel has a observation deck on the 32nd floor with a nice skyline view. A very clean and well maintained hotel.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This property is in very good condition, staff was courteous and the room and bathroom cleanliness was outstanding. The hotel is pretty close to Times Square, Empire State Building and other attractions. Regular internet access was fine, although not available to enjoy my Netflix or AmazonTV. Complimentary breakfast is certainly a plus.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great staff, great room, great service. And all half a block from Times Square. The staff is young and enthusiastic, ready to help find a cab, carry luggage and answer questions. The room was clean and comfortable. No want went unanswered to include the kitchen staff providing gluten free toast to my wife upon request.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Front end service was superb!!! My 2 daughters stayed there while we were at another hotel. Bill was paid by me. They said hotel was great, service was great, they did not eat breakfast as we all ate elsewhere. Only issue they had was no refrig in room! Other than that all was good.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I was guest of this hotel for a whole week, and it was an great experience, all employee are receptive, friendly, and always prompt to help.The hotel is located in one of the best area of Manhatan, in the middle of Times Square, 5th Avenue, and Most of Theaters.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel is a great location, time square it at the end of the street and either way out the hotel takes you to a subway. The room was clean and just what we needed for a city break. The staff were helpful but the best thing about this place is the breakfast Yum yum yum! Cereal, toast, bagels, pastries a doomed selection AND freshly made waffles it set us up every day for all the trekking around NY we did!
user_name:
charlotte g
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Location near subway, Time Square, Central Park, Empire State Building, Rockefeller Center. Quite easy to get to from the airport. No need to change rails. Be advised you do have to pay to get to the subway terminal once you get off from the airport train. So you really pay twice. Don't be afraid to use the emergency doors to bring your luggage through. Friendly staff and informative. Rooms comfortable. View..well just ok. Breakfast... average and does get quite busy. There are few tables so try not to eat the same time everyone else does.Elevators can be slow and quite close to the rooms. In fact you can almost step right into some from the elevator.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I normally don't stay at a Hampton Inn but I was pleasantly surprised. My kids loved it... was a great stay! Comfortable rooms, beds. All day coffee and tea was great. Good breakfast and perfect location. Would definitely come back!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed for 4 nights. Good location. Extremely friendly service, but small room. Was upgraded to a 2 bed room & complimentary refrigerator. They ran out out cookies early each night. Roof top terrace was locked too early in the evening. Enjoyed my stay.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel has a great location,5 minutes walk to Times Square .Rooms are a good size for NEW YORK . CLEAN AND TIDY. Staff are knowledgable and very helpful.Included is a breakfast (unusual) .Hampton inn have breakfast ambassadors ,one being Geraldine ,a very helpful and friendly lady . Full of good advice and tips for seeing the city. A credit to Hampton innI would certainly recommend a stay here

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My family stayed at the new Hampton Inn. The location is great. The hotel is very modern. Probably the best Hampton Inn I've ever stayed at and in the heart of Times Square. The service was also great. The rooms were very modern. I liked the stand up shower instead of the tub. The lobby was clean. They had tea and coffee as all Hampton Inns do. However, they also had cold water which was great. They had heavy doors which blocked the hallway noise. Now for the areas that need improvement.... the elevator traffic in the morning was pretty bad. My suggestion to the hotel is to dedicate one of the elevators to the hotel cleaning crew and staff. You had to wait a long time for the elevators in the morning due to the breakfast traffic, people checking out as well as the hotel cleaning staff. The breakfast area was also over crowded. They were consistently good up of food and could not keep up with it. Perhaps they need to allocate more staff to the breakfast area in the morning.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The location of this hotel is amazing, but there are others just as convenient with friendlier staff. After reading reviews we decided to try the Hampton instead of going where we usually stay...mainly for free breakfast. The staff was rude on a couple of occasions and not helpful at all as far as subway directions (gave incorrect stop once) or suggestions for shuttle to airport when concierge wasn't on duty. A little extra effort and a smile would go a long way with some of these employees. We asked for different pillows and it took 2 days to get them. We received no coffee several days and no new shampoo, lotion on some others. We were there 7 days. Next time we'll be going back to our usual NYC hotel. Some reviews had mentioned a rooftop which they had, but there wasn't so much as a plant up there nor chairs to make it a cool place to spend a moment or two to relax. Can't imagine why it was even mentioned or why it is there! The entire hotel had no ambience...could have been anywhere except most Hamptons are nicer and larger.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We recently stayed at this hotel and had excellent service. Our hostess Teddy went out of her way to make sure everyone was served and the dining area clean. The conceige was amazing and had lots of helpful information. Also the curb service was super and handled our car & baggage quickly.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The right balance of location, quality, convenience, and price. New York is expensive. Here we felt that we got fair value due to location, cleanliness, staff, room quality, and helpful staff. Walking was easier than we expected, as the blocks are not as long as we had expected. Good shoes are important. In three days, we did not need a taxi, except to arrive and to leave. We appreciated the car service that the hotel found for us. Breakfast, free, was good and well managed, even at busy times. The first contact for us was Gifston Wignal, whose title is Director of First Impressions. Very appropriate, as he was got us off to a good start.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Rooms are clean and on the smaller side but for the value and location, this hotel would be tough to beat. Free breakfast and complimentary internet are a nice bonus.The three elevators are small and slower compared to larger upscale hotels so you might experience longer wait times especially during peak times like 5 to 7pm and 7 to 9am.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I brought my kids to NYC for my birthday 5/17 for a one night stay. The location could not have been better. Beds were super comfortable and bathroom was well stocked. It was 95 out and we were greeted with H2O and the next morning a goody bag for the road. We were able to check out bags so we could explore the following day. And the breakfast buffet was terrific- hot and cold foods, well stocked by a friendly and helpful manager(?) named Teddie- she was great:)

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Yes, a chain, but you know what to expect, and all is good, and at a reasonable price. Breakfasts varied, and plentiful. Rooms adequate, no noise issues, staff helpful. Location is awesome. Very central.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The location cannot be beat. Less than a block to the Times Sq subway stop, right in the heart of everything. The rooms are decent sized for NYC. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. We had a delayed flight and they went out of their way to store our bags for several hours, loan us umbrellas, help with a car, etc. The breakfast was good. Standard Hampton Inn Fare. While busy every morning, there were multiple (think 3-4) attendants. They were quick to clean tables, refill, etc. So it went smoothly. We had a room right next to the elevator and were initially worried about noise, but there wasn't even the slightest. Thumbs up on sound dampening as we didn't hear street noise on 20th floor. The beds were the only 'not 5 star' item. We had 2 rooms. One had older beds that were a bit noisy and likely soon to be refreshed. The other room had very firm (too firm) beds. Again, would certainly stay here again. It was very clean, great staff and location with reasonable rates.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Very nice staff Teddy&Keda are so very helpful. My husband doesn't eat pork, Teddy &Keda made sure my husband had turkey sausage set aside during our stay there for breakfast. I will be staying there next time we are in NYC.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great place to stay in NY.Great location,friendly people,very clean ,and serving a convenient breakfast.I reserved this room 1year prior to this vacation and was able to get a great price.The week we selected was a very busy week in N Y so the prices did increase for the hotel but our lower price was lock in.
user_name:
Marlene K
Grosse Pointe Farms, Michigan

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Fantastic staff. We were there for 9 days. Front desk staff excellent - Tabore, Nini, Allain & Emanuel. Needed a tub in my room and they graciously changed to a room with a tub. Breakfast staff was wonderful and did a tremendous job of keeping up with replenishing the food and cleaning the room. Food was good and plentiful. The bottled water, fresh coffee and hot tea/chocolate in the lobby was a wonderful as well as the freshly baked cookies. I have never stayed this close to 42nd street because of the chaos, but will now make this my NYC hotel of choice. Within 40 yards as the subway for the orange, red and yellow lines as well as a connection to Grand Central for the green line, and a half block away was the bus station with the blue line connection. You can get anywhere in the City via the Metro by walking less than one block. I did miss a refrigerator in the rooms and think this would be a good investment for the company. And, yes the elevators are slow at times because there is no service elevator. But I recognized this was NOT the staff's fault and did not hold them accountable. Concierge was wonderful too. The laundry in the basement was a plus. While we did not wash clothes, one day it rained and our clothes and shoes were wet. We dried them in the dryer. This hotel is NOT for someone who wants a lot of amenities and food and beverage options. But if you are there to explore the city and attend plays, this is a great hotel in a great location.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
