Helpful, kind, playful and handsome to boot! I liked the security the hotel had in the elevators, requiring guests to touch their room keys to a pad in order to select their floor. (I've had this on "select" floors before, but never for everyone. It was a comfort, knowing the elevators are right off the street and anyone could walk on.) We stayed in room 2409, which had a nice view south, and met all our simple needs, but was rather tiny. I reminded myself that it is Manhattan, and I wasn't paying top dollar for this room.... for what I paid, and where it was, it was perfect. The room was well maintained, and the bathroom renovated in a decor similar to the other Hilton family brands. My only gripe about Manhattan hotels (this being the 3rd in the Times Square area I've stayed at in the last 3 weeks), is the food service hours. This hotel doesn't have room service (which ended by 10pm in other hotels), but it does serve breakfast. Unfortunately the breakfast ends at 10am, and we missed it when we slept in late. Other than that, the hotel is clean, well maintained, pleasantly staffed, and only 1 block off of Times Square (41st between 7-8 Avenues), so is perfectly located near it all!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I do my homework so I knew that the rm was small but it's NYC and sometimes we need to think more like a European and less like a Texan (where I also lived). We had a king and yes, there wasn't more in the rm than that, but was there a closet, bureau, desk, chairs- yes of course - and it was clean-Mommy clean-everywhere in the hotel - Now the staff - major thanks to Jessica in the breakfast area - what a kind, sweet soul she is - my daughter was very sick this trip (urgent care sick) and I went down to get her some mint tea - Jessica saw my face (it was really bad )and asked how she could help with suggestions on teas and to get me really hot water to help my child. And every day we were there she asked - kindness ♡-we also had to stay a day later bc the docs wouldn't let my daughter fly and Elizabeth, the manager as well as the head of housekeeping (sorry, didn't get her name) were very, very accommodating. The breakfasts we did have were crowded, but the food was pleniful - Get a room away from the elevator-we were in 1404-very quiet - one elevator was broken so maybe a lower floor in case. Yes, I would stay there again -no doubts - no regrets

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We just got back from our first trip to New York. I was clueless about the best location to stay, especially since when a hotel says "walking distance", it is not really what I would consider "walking distance"! This hotel was clean, with comfortable beds and pillows, on a pretty mellow street. There was a 3 level McDonalds right across from the hotel, which was a one way street. You could walk in, go all the way through and come out the other side onto a bustling street with cool lights and shops. The wax museum and Ripley's were next door to the McDonalds on that side. We walked comfortably to the theater, Empire State Bldg, Rockefeller Center, Times Square, New York Public library and the MOMA. There was a Walgreens that was a 5 min walk and it was also close to the subway. The only negative was sleeping in on our last morning and trying to get to breakfast with only half an hour left. It took forever to get an elevator and there was barely standing room in the breakfast area, forget about finding a seat. Avoid that by getting to breakfast early, we had no trouble on our other mornings. We would definitely stay here again and were really pleased with our choice!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Nice Rooms, just wish they had a small fridge and a microwave. Awesome Staff, very helpful! The Hot Drink Station in the lobby with hot cocoa, coffee and tea is great in the winter! Delicious breakfast every morning! Highly recommend!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This is a relatively new hotel with a very friendly staff and a very central location, at a very reasonable price. We picked it for its proximity to multiple subway lines, as we ranged from the West Village downtown to Spanish Harlem way uptown during our five day stay. The room was perfect for two people (and we loved the tiled shower). The fitness center is spacious and well-equipped -- and we mostly had it to ourselves in the early morning. We like the quality and variety of the complimentary breakfast at Hampton Inns, but you are advised to get there early, as this hotel has 300 rooms, and the dining area can be very crowded.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: It is a fairly new hotel in the middle of time square. First, I was making a chocolate drink and I noticed that the hot water was not hot. I asked for a microwave since I poured out already water on my paper cup. The guy who is cleaning the table says there is no microwave in there. Then I looked around and found one just besides the lobby or front desk where the microwave is. I catch the attention of the staff and showed him the microwave and apologized. I appreciate him acknowledging that he don't know where it is if he does not know, but he could have asked the front desk personnel if where it is. Even the front desk personnel who is right in front of me never did any extraordinary thing even they are just the 2 or 3 of them stooping down on their computer not bothered by a guest who is desperately looking for a hot water. No initiative. Secondly, the other guy who is doing the vacuum cleaner. I was sitting right at the lobby again. Suddenly right in front of me where he turned on the vacuum cleaner as in a motorcycle just about to ru over my toes. Of course, I was amazed that not even an "excuse me or I am sorry, I have to clean this portion where I am sitting, (even the whole lobby is so huge) why picck where I am stitting? No sorry, no excuse me. I cant just imagine such training the manager of this "new" Hampton Inn get here training the way she trained the staff. She should be trained first before training people under her; This is a Hotel or a place where they paid a lot especially in New York to get such service and no such morals. I am just glad to notice Ms Geraldine from the breakfast room. She is a very sweet girl who is so nice and very responsive to the guest. It just very natural for her to know what the guest needs in her area of responsibility. She caters well to the place of of work. They should appoint supervisors or managers like her who knows the department well and can be responsive especially when they are exposed or can be with direct contact particularly to the clients of the hotel.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: It was our first visit to NYC. The hotel was clean, nice and the staff was friendly. The location is steps away from Time Square, walking distance to restaurants and shops. We will definitely go back and stay at Hampton Inn

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We came into New York for Xmas vacation and used points to stay at the Hampton Inn Times Square Central. Check in was a breeze as always since we used the mobile check in, unfortunately the elevators are in short supply and the staff use the same elevators as the guests but can bypass floors and get where they need so that creates a little dilemma when the elevators are in short supply.... Overall the room was very nice and updated but the usual size for New York which is about as big as my walk in closet. The hotel is located just off Times Square so it is a little more quiet than the hotels right on the strip which was nice. The hotel is also located right next to the port authority so you can get anywhere you want to go without having to take a cab or Uber. Breakfast was the standard Hampton Inn breakfast but there are not enough seats for the amount of people that stay at the hotel so you might as well take it back to your room. Overall a nice stay with a helpful staff.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I had nothing bad to say about this hotel and will stay again. Literally just minutes from time square and very close with any type of food you want. You can walk practically anywhere in Manhattan from Central Park to 30 rock, Time Square, Fifth Avenue

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Good experience great location staff is knowledgeable kind and helpful. Good breakfast has all your basics. Room is clean The only complaint was that shower didn't have any happy medium between cold and hot. I would recommend the hotel

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed and are staying at the moment in this particular hotel. This is a new bldg I believe because I asked the front desk. I even mentioned their laundry area on site which. First issue. We were at front desk lobby asking to fax 1 pc of paper. I ask Ms Maria to reset my key and then ask for my name etc etc, then that's fine. She initiated the statement telling us "I'm sorry if it's taking so long" then I noticed that she just ignored me and hand over the key to My partner. For me it's kinda insulting. I hand over the key to be restarted corrected then he hand it over to the other person. My name is on the room also. Though it's kinda different since I hand it to her and gave it to the other person, in front of us. I don't mind it not raising it as an issue but insulting. Probably she just don't know and it's fine. Secondly, the wait. We reserved thru HH App because of the promo. Now while I check the reservation on the app, the reservation was doubled and we only need one room and are checked in. I went to front desk again and told the person the situation. He then told me to call the HH 1800 number. As I called the lady at HH line was very nice like the true spirit of the hospitality as the true meaning of a hotel. She called this hotel itself and it made my call to them 50 mins. We have to cut our call since it's super extra ordinary for this type of issue for a A corporate office calling the branch or franchisee to have this Loooong wait. Ending issue unresolved but sending me an email for this. Then come the Manager of the particular hotel whom I felt being discriminated (pardon the wrong use of word - if it comes that way-I'm a tourist guess to this hotel). She just as the same case with Maria whom I believe is white like the Manager, I even asked my partner to introduce me to her but just kept on ignoring me. Finally, my partner just acknowledged the error even he don't understand technical issues with the HH app on our phones. Ms Manager said as a courtesy. She is waiving the cancellation fee for being HH member. Seriously? Then I really interjected for me to step in and my partner then told the manager to speak to me. The she looked at me. I finally started my piece and just said "my issue is not ended since I was the one on the phone that have your beach made me and the corporate on the phone for 50 mins just because of that". and she just said that's why she had taken care of that. It just made me think again, if she did paid attention to what I just said and I realized that no she did not, when I'm already at the elevator going to my room. " for me issue was only partially resolved. Because the detail becomes more because of her very intelligent reply to my issue which is not fully understood and have paid attention. I will just communicate with the HH corporate because for me, this was just another not so good example of what customer service business they are in. New York hotel rates are expensive among the cities that I have been to any of the states that I have been to as well. New York, NY it's fabulous that's why they named it twice. Like the song New York, NY, when you survived it you'll make it anywhere. This quality of customer service for me is not among that will pass my standards as a tourist coming from the other part of the world. We pay high price to stay in a not so luxorious hotel from our hard end money that somewhat contributed to the salary of the hotel employee as well being a Diamond tier (which is the highest and last tier) membership for this hotel chain. I'm sorry, if my standards for the quality of customer service satisfaction become so low if what I felt it is not met. Anyways, this is just a review and it's readers decision still remains valid or not if their ways are good enough to survive particularly to the business Hampton Inn is in. For now, it's only this branch that I noticed and had this issue had made me call my attention.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I had an early appointment the next day so I decided to spend the night in Manhattan. This was very reasonably priced and close to where I needed to go. Upon arrival, I was greeted with a very friendly staff member, given all info needed (along with a water) and proceeded to my room. I was surprised how quiet the room was - as well as spotless and updated. The breakfast was included and again the staff was very friendly and the assortment of breakfast items amazing. Highly recommend.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Friendly staff in all areas of this newest Hampton Inn Time Square location Central (already had a North and South) steps from theatres and Time Square lights of Broadway and the 42nd street Subway. Ten minute walk (with 6' foot sons to Madison Square Garden or Empire State Building or Macy's Herald Square. Generous, tasty breakfasts with super friendly staff who made us feel like we guests in their home kitchens. Crowded, but worth the wait and also happy to pass out to go containers for rooms. Nice savings for family of four with hearty breakfast and hot drinks and bottled water available all day. Ask for a room five floors up and/or on back side of hotel more to minimize street noise. Rooms are "New York big" but very clean. Elevators were well used so plan a few minutes to get up or down, especially for rush times. Front desk staffer recommended her favorite nearby: John's Pizza on 44th street. We love our Chicago Pizza, but this was excellent whole pie--really tasty sauce and yummy pizza rolls with dipping sauce.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights in December 2016 over Christmas and were really pleased with the hotel. The rooms were a comfortable size and the bathroom was nice with a decent shower. The room had the usual amenities, hair dryer, iron & ironing board, safe and coffee facilities. The bed was nice and comfy but the duvet cover did look a little tired and the pillows were extremely soft. They felt like feather but when we changed them for foam ones there was only a little bit of improvement. Other than that, we slept well, after exploring New York City theres not too much that keeps you awake (other than loud patrons who slam their doors rather than allowing them to close gently). There are 3 lifts which operate on all floors so they do get a little busy from time to time. Particularly around breakfast time, after 8:20 roughly. The breakfast was nice, not many hotels have breakfast included so this helped with our selection. It can get busy so again you want to get down for breakfast before 8:30 to get a table. The usual food offerings were available, make your own waffles, fruit, toast, pastries and some cooked items. It's not a massive selection but it certainly fits the bill for a few days. The location for this hotel was perfect for us, just off Time Square made it very easy for us to walk to many attractions; Empire State Building, the High line in Chelsea, Madison Square Garden, Bryant park and Rockefellar centre were all within reasonable walking distance. It is also close to several subway stops which helps when you want to head to the very bottom of Manhattan. Most of the staff that we spoke to were very friendly and helpful and offered advice when we asked about the return journey to the airport. They confirmed that have a car service back to JFK for a set fee of $70 plus tip. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others and would consider the hotel on a return visit.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed there New Years weekend, hotel is clean and staff are friendly and helpful. Free Full hot breakfast is good and changes every morning so it's not the same thing everyday. Rooms are smalll which is typical in NYC. Needs way more elevators also, always had to wait, sometimes so long we would contemplate using the stairs and we were on the 11th floor. Elevators are always crowded too!! I feel it's overpriced though, even for New Years weekend and this is not my first time in NYC either.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel is first of all located in the best place for a Manhattan visit, right in the middle between 41st and 41nd street, seconds walk to Times Sq., Times Sq. Subway and the PABT, giving you basically any subway line you need at the door. The staff is super friendly and helpful, the hotel's been recently renovated, business center is free and the wifi is complimentary. Breakfast is great and most importantly - free as in every Hampton, you can ask why do I need a breakfast in central Manhattan when I have hundreds of options right outside the door?, and you will be right to ask, however it's filling and it's free so why not? prefer to eat outside? that's ok, you didn't lose anything. We had a room on the 30th floor, great view, some wind and traffic noises and there's a long wait for the elevators but other than that, I extremely recommend.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We came here on an anniversary trip and stayed on Hilton Honors points and paid for an extra night. Since our extra night was a city view and our HHonors room was not, I inquired about if we could get the same room for all of the nights so we wouldn't have to change. Rachelle assisted us and we got the level right below where city views started and while it was obstructed a little, it was still cool. While the room was smaller than I expected, the hotel was clean and well-managed. I thought the bed was comfortable and the walk in shower was very nice. Breakfast is busy unless you go early. I didn't have elevator wait times that were super long like I have read that other travelers had. Rachelle was great and she definitely helped with making our stay the best it could be! Also, being so close to subway stations and across the street from the back of the New Amsterdam Theatre which houses Aladdin, was extremely convenient.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We arrived at the hotel around 9:30am after a very early flight to drop off our luggage... and gave us our room early! Kris (at the front desk) was so helpful and kind. The rooms were very clean, bed was comfortable, and it was nice and quiet! There is hot coffee available 24/7, and the free breakfast was the standard for Hampton Inn - just fine to get get something in your tummy before heading out to sight see. All of the staff we encountered were very friendly. The location is excellent; Times Square subway access is a 2 minute walk away. We highly recommend staying here!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I loved the room, the breakfast, the service, the location. Its just a couple of steps away from the New Years eve drop of the ball. Only con I will say are the elevators. There are 3 small ones. It could take you a while in the mornings and afternoons to get to or from your room to the lobby. There are restaurants really close by for all kinds of budget. A lot of places of interest at a walking distance. They have a tour, shows, tickets and transportation booth at the lobby with very friendly personnel. Which I have to say, made my stay an easier to plan.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great hotel. Good location, clean rooms and public areas, very friendly staff. Quiet room, but hallway noise was easily heard, especially on the weekend. We stayed 5 nights, but they never changed the bed sheets, just made the bed, disappointing for what we paid. Breakfast was really nice, not having to go out, it's all right there, with very helpful breakfast room staff. Bad elevator wait times during peak hours (morning/evening), but one out of 3 elevators was broken during a portion of our stay. No big deal, we were on vacation. We booked our stay well in advance and prepaid the full amount. At checkout, they had $490 of extra charges on my bill, and had already charged it to my card on file!!!?? Front desk staff insisted that they were right, until I got out my paper receipt from the original online booking showing that I was paid in full. They reluctantly refunded the charges to my card upon seeing all my paperwork. This whole ordeal checking out took 45 minutes and nearly caused us to miss our flight. I would stay there again in a heartbeat, just check your bill before leaving.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed 12/30/16 through 1/4/17 - If I hadn't already experienced the spaciousness of the Hilton across the street I would have given this 5 stars. I've never stayed in such a small place in all of my travels and I am mostly loyal to Hilton brands. Check in was great. Couldn't have asked for better. It was a busy weekend so I didn't expect much. The elevators were small although there were three. With that being said I spent a lot of time waiting on elevators and even had to take the stairs up to the 12th floor a few times. Thank God I didn't get the 20th floor room I had originally requested. We did take advantage of the coffee and tea bar. That area stayed crowded but it worked. Two people can't walk down the hallways at the same time. The room was sooooo tight that we had to stay packed at all times. Any thing outside of your luggage made the room look junky and cluttered. We couldn't even store the luggage in the closet because it was small too. It was the size of a small coat closet with a safe and tray on the floor. We parked the luggage against the space by the window to move it out of the way. I will say the room was very clean and housekeeping was on top of keeping it that way. The bathrooms on the concourse were very clean with the amount of traffic. They get an A+ for cleanliness and service We did get back to the room one might just in time for cookies. Don't understand how cookies can make you feel so thankful but they do. The price we paid was astronomical but we expected that for New Years Eve on Times Square. You could literally walk out of the door to the corner and see the ball drop and you are inside of the police barricade so that's goes along with the price. My husband is f firefighter so his badge allows us to go a little further, down to the center, by the stage. This hotel is a perfect location for your TSQ visit. It is out of the way of the 42nd street traffic but just steps away from everything. We only ate breakfast there once but was so crowded that we decided to forego breakfast and just do lunch outside of the hotel. Would I stay there again....Maybe.....but only if the Hilton is completely booked. Space is very important to me. If space is not important to you then definitely book your next stay here.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The hotel itself was very nice and there was a good atmosphere about it. The rooms were spacious and clean. Tourist desk to find maps and tour information. An amazing all you can eat breakfast with a wide selection of foods. The only faults of this hotel were the long waiting time for lifts and the minimal seating in the breakfast room, but you always managed to squeeze in somewhere and the great breakfast made up for it. Would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We loved our stay here. The location is perfect for walking to Times Square and theaters. The Port Authority is a half a block down so it is easy to catch the subway to Central Park or down to lower Manhattan or wherever you wish to visit. The staff and service are great and there is always hot coffee and tea waiting by the front desk. Breakfast is packed no matter what time you go but the workers keep it stocked well. It is hard to get a table but you can bring your food to your room if you wish. There are also prepacked brown bags with muffins and fruit always available during breakfast hours that you can just grab and take with you. I loved that that are three separate coffee stations so there is never a wait for coffee. I requested a room on the third floor because of the reviews that I had read about the elevators being packed. I was really glad I did and most mornings we used the stairs to get coffee and breakfast instead of waiting for an elevator. The rooms are clean and not worn. We will definitely stay at this hotel when we return to NYC.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This was our first trip to NYC (2 weeks before Christmas) and finding an affordable Manhattan hotel was tough... I am so glad I stumbled upon this hotel! The location is great, just a short walk from Times Square, and it is fairly new. The room size was adequate, the bed was comfortable, and everyone was very friendly. We checked out the breakfast buffet and it was your typical free breakfast hotel food. My only wish is that I requested a quiet room since I have a hard time sleeping in unfamiliar places, and they only put us at the 15th floor, which you could still hear a lot going on in Times Square, even later at night. I wish they would have put us in a higher floor, as sometimes it was a bit tough for me to sleep with the street noises. Also, bring a pillowcase from home (I was so glad I did) because the bed coverings are a bit rough and scratchy. Other than those two minor things, I think this is a great place to stay and I would certainly stay here again!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed here for a quick birthday trip with my husband and a friend from 12/05 - 12/07. Despite a hiccup with our room (they sent us to a room that was still occupied), they were quick to resolve the problem. Not a huge hotel, but good enough for us. The room is quite spacious for NY standards, and very clean. At the time we stayed there, we noticed that there was construction on a building behind us. They used the air horn all the time in the morning, which could be annoying to some, but it wasn't a problem (and nothing the hotel could do about it, anyway). There are only three elevators, so sometimes you have to wait a bit, but it wasn't that big of a problem. The best part of the property is the location. We had the subway, Times Square, Penn Station, Broadway, etc. within easy walking distance. At no time did we feel unsafe in or around the property. And there are lots of great restaurants nearby. We did not avail of the free breakfast, but we didn't go to NYC to eat there! ;-) Would stay again here with no hesitation. The price was a great value for the area.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We enjoyed out time back again in New York & this time for New Year's Eve.We had a great time visiting the various sites,shopping @ Macy's & Century 21 & others.Enjoyed our journey & the views @ The One World Discovery.Plus we went on a Circle River Cruise - which was Very disappointing & New York's Fireworks were the poorest we have ever experienced in any city @ anytime.Our stay @ The Hampton Inn was enjoyable

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: All though our trip was short it was sweet! We had a wonderful time in the city. Its our favorite city. We love visiting at Christmas time. This was our 2nd year in a row that we have done a wk-end Christmas trip! We really enjoyed it.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: There are a lot of good things about this hotel, its a great location on 41st. The Nederlander theater next door was dark, so the block felt a little gloomy, however, walk half a block more and you're at restaurants, the Subway, etc... We paid more for the City View so we had a partial view of the Empire State Building. If you have theater tickets, its a close walk to many attractions and restaurants. Good price, includes breakfast, coffee all day long, computers, and the staff was all very friendly.We traveled the week after Christmas so the hotel was packed. 3 small elevators are clearly are not enough to support 30 floors of guests. I felt bad for guests on lower floors as we would pass floor after floor of disappointed people trying to get inside to go downstairs to breakfast. Which leads to the next constraint, table seating for breakfast. The staff in the kitchen actually did a great job of keeping the food stocked, I have seen much worse but this group stayed ahead of the crowd. What was lacking was a place to sit once we had food. With the poor elevator situation, going back to your room with an arm full of food was out, so we saw a lot of people just go grab a seat in the lobby and balance a plate on their lap. I'm sure management already knows this is an issue because they put out "to go" breakfast bags as an option. Nice try but it doesn't resolve the space limitations. The room itself was small, but clean. Room for two double beds and and a desk, that was it however its NYC, we were not in the room very much anyway except to sleep. Mattress was hard, not my style but it was fine for a few nights. Overall for NYC, with breakfast included and one block from 42nd street, I would stay again. Just bring your patience.P.S. I was told they had evening cookies but never got them. They disappeared too fast. Good luck to anyone who gets one. However I made good use of the coffee, tea, hot chocolate station.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: From arrival to departure, our stay was absolutely perfect. The entire hotel staff was great, very friendly and informative. Accommodations were very comfortable and clean. Breakfast was a good variety. The location was excellent for what we wanted to do... Broadway plays, Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Central Park, Fifth Avenue, etc.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location off of Times Square. Within walking distance to many local attractions...subway access was convenient. The front desk staff was very accommodating. The breakfast was good and extremely busy, difficult to seat a table of 6.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We're regular Hampton Inn guests as we appreciate the (decent) complimentary Internet access and good options for daily breakfast. We would normally have expected a drop off in service and accommodations so close to a tourist area (Times Sq) on a Christmas weekend. We were pleasantly surprised. As usual the Hampton Inn crew (front desk, concierge, breakfast area and housekeeping) were uniformly courteous and helpful. Additionally, the hotel is very conveniently located if you're in town for Times Square, Broadway theater, Bryant Park. Plus it has a subway stop adjacent to the property so you can easily get anyplace the subway will take you.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for a College Bowl Game. And let me tell you that the top notch customer service began while we were on our way. The front desk representative Letita helped us with everything we need prior to check in. She was extremely nice, caring and helpful, Hampton Inn is lucky to have her! Next, the breakfast was always stocked and outside of just having to wait for your turn to make a waffle, everything was fresh and most importantly very clean. Our room was on the 9th floor, and considering it was an extremely busy weekend in NY just days before the New Years Eve celebration, the elevator was getting a lot of use, however that was the only thing that we needed to wait on.Louis (valet) and Thomas (valet) were very professional while we relied on them for directions. We called for our car an hour in advance as recommended and we came down stairs our car was infront and ready for our departure.Finally, the room we had was clean and a decent size. The television worked (more importantly) and well the view wasnt much, but we werent there to take in the view.Overall this hotel was great! The customer service speaks volume and the employees are doing all of the right things. When I come back to New York I will stay here again.Oh, by the way this hotel is only 2 blocks from Bryant Park and 1 block from the middle of Times Square.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Nice accommodations. King bed rooms were a lot smaller than the double for the kids. The beverages made available in the lobby everyday was great! Breakfast was very good - be sure to follow the signage about crowd control, going after 8:30 will be limited tables available.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Really like the location of this hotel. Just a half block to subway. The gym here is very nice for a hotel gym. Stayed in 703. The wall sockets dont work on left side of bed. Room is small but a brand new hotel. The hotel is very sound proof. For other travelers, please be kind. Elevators are slow and saw people cutting off younger children to grab space on elevators. Think about it next time before doing this to kids or anyone. Staff is very helpful and considerate. Only had 1 bellman and he is maxed out. They do need more of him. Would stay again. Like the hotel and staff and accommodations, its some of the rude travelers i could do without.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Our family had a memorable get together in the Big Apple for Christmas.The Hampton Inn provide a great focal point for our 12 member family and was conveniently located to Broadway shows and Times Square.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location, friendly staff, room was of decent size. We stayed for 8 days and for some reason our room was not cleaned on 2 of the days. The lifts were painfully slow and often full when they arrived during certain parts of the day. The breakfast was included free with the room but was very basic and served completely on paper plates and plastic cutlery, which I hope is recycled! The gym was basic and laundry worked well. Would stay again if we come back to New York.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Location is great! The rooms are clean and modern, it's really cozy.The only thing about the roomsIs that they're a tad small and don't have place to put your luggage.Breakfast is included which is a really neat to have in a city where food is really expensive. It's not THE best breakfast you'll ever have but it's good enough to fill up your stomach.As it happens with lots of hotels in the area, it has only 3 elevators and they get pretty busy during pick hours (morning and evening). Sometimes you have to wait more than 10 minutes to get in one because when they open they are full. I recommend staying in lower floors so you can take the stairs without sweating about it.It offers free wifi, it kind of sucks. You get disconnected every five minutes, but you have to keep connecting because cellphone signal is weak inside the hotel.Staff was great and it really is a great hotel, just take note on those things.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Wonderful staff and location. Times Square was literally around the corner. Rooms we larger than most NY hotels we stayed at so very comfortable. They also made the accommodations we needed for a family stay.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Spent the week before Christmas, and LOVED the hotel. The location is perfect, right in Times square, without the noise! Great access to the subway, and theaters. Coin laundry in the basement clean, and accessible. Rooms small, but that's the New York thing. I would definitely recommend getting the 2 beds versus the King the rooms seemed noticeably larger. The fresh water, coffee, & hot chocolate is a nice service in the lobby as well as fresh baked cookies! Breakfast was crowded but we always found a seat. The only negative to this hotel is the elevator, there can be quite a wait or the elevator is full during breakfast hours and morning rush. Seems like either staying in a high floor, or a lower floor would be better than the middle floors. The Middle floors the elevator would be full before it got to you, and lower floors could use the stairs. overall, I would definitely choose this hotel and location for another NYC visit!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Staff let us check in very early, at 9am and told us to get complimentary breakfast, which was very kind. The room was spotless and very comfy. Only one issues were: (1) slow elevators that wouldn't always stop on our floor, and (2) extremely over-crowded breakfast room.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great staff. Very clean and modern hotel. Very close to Times Sqare and a very short walk to restaurant row. Rooms are small but very comfortable. Foot traffic is very heavy but the noise level not too bad.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location! The staff was wonderful and the room was clean. The included breakfast had many options and the coffee and hot chocolate in the lobby were always fantastic when coming in from the cold.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: No doubt the management will have some excuse about the busy 'holiday season' however none of that really compensates for the fact that we routinely lost 30-40 minutes every day in the mornings and afternoons waiting for lifts/elevators that more often or not during the busiest parts of the day were full of Hotel staff travelling between floors to clean rooms, move linen, etc. When you do manage to get into one of the three small lifts it stopped at almost every floor to reveal frustrated guests waiting for their turn - so that anyone on a lower floor typically just took the fire stairs. We even did that a few times despite the fact we were on a floor above 20. Our room had no mini-fridge or ice bucket and nor was there ice available anywhere near our floor. There is no room service, so we had to go out for everything - hard given the challenge of getting to and from our room using the lifts!!! Add to this the fact that breakfast is a badly disorganised scrum - with very ordinary food served to an overpacked room where we were often unable to find a seat - so we just gave up and ate elsewhere. To be fair, the rooms are comfortable and staff generally positive and friendly - but a free chocolate chip cookie doesn't make up for such an overall terrible experience. There is no chance I would ever stay at this hotel again, and to be honest the experience is so bad I doubt that I would even consider a Hampton Inn ever again either.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel was reasonably priced and excellently located. Rooms were clean and modern. But what really stood out was the staff. Every single staff member we came in contact with from the moment we walked in the door was above and beyond friendly, efficient, helpful, you name it. Because of staff, we would not consider staying anywhere else for future visits to NYC. Thanks to them for enhancing our stay!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel is reasonable and right around the corner from Times Square. It seems like it's either new or recently renovated, it was very clean. Breakfast was typical but good, and crowded. I really liked the staff, all very friendly and helpful. This is a good choice if you want to be close to Times Square.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Pros and cons to this property. Pros: great location, clean, comfortable, modern rooms... what you would expect from a Hilton property, free breakfast and 24 hour tea/coffee in lobby, free USA Today, courteous staff, quiet.Cons: long wait for elevator and sometimes you find yourself going in the wrong direction if you don't swipe the key fast enough, breakfast quality not consistent... one morning it was inedible except for the yogurt, cold cereal etc., room was too hot and only way to control temperature was to open the window, no refrigerator in the room, although they were available at an extra charge. When I made the reservation I actually thought I was booking a different property a few blocks away..The Homewood Suites, which offers breakfast, happy hour and full kitchen in a larger room for about the same price. When I first got here I was a little disappointed to see I had made a mistake, but overall I was not disappointed in the stay at The Hampton Inn Times Square.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed at The Hampton Inn for 5 days the week of December 14-19, 2016. What a FANTASTIC location. We were in town for shopping and Broadway shows. The theater district, Rockefeller Center, Macy's, Times Square, everything you would need to see within easy walking distance. Safe area only a block from Times Square. Many great restaurants close. Rooms were on the small side but VERY clean and accommodating. The staff was exceptional- it rained for two days while we were there and they offered umbrellas to use. Beds were very comfortable. We will return to NY in the near future and we will stay here.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: For the most part, a Hampton is a Hampton is a Hampton. So the grading range is pretty narrow. Have stayed at most of the Hiltons, Hamptons, Garden Inns in midtown, but first time here -- and probably last time. On the plus side, I think the location is great. A relatively quiet location one short block from the craziness of 42nd and 7th/Broadway. The rooms are a decent size (at least my room was), the A/C and heat work well, good TV and channel selection, very friendly staff. On the down side, the hotel is under-elevatored, so on a lower floor in the mornings, can easily have several elevators full of upper floor guests stop before you get one with space. On upper floors, can be a good wait while elevators work their way up. The breakfast area is undersized and a madhouse during much of the morning (we just ate at the Gleason a few steps down the street - well worth the extra expense). And our room and floor whistled. By that I mean that the heat/air system was sufficiently strong, and the door in our room hung in a particular way, such that there was a constant wind-like whistling in our room (also in the30th floor hallway). Solved by stuffing a towel under or room door. But the worst was the pillows and bedding. OK, you may think that's crazy, but the room is ultimately a place to sleep, and that was a bit of a challenge for me. The pillows were about the limpest I have ever had in a hotel (was at a dude ranch a few years ago that was worse, but never at a big hotel). Not sure if they were just lousy pillows or were well passed their replacement time, but virtually no support. And the hotel uses a very heavy duvet on the bed (I recall Hampton went this direction once, but do not know if this is still a system wide Hampton thing). In any event, unless you like to be VERY warm in bed, finding a comfortable sleep temperature can be iffy. So why stay here? Again, location and fir my stay, price for the location. Doubt I will stay here again. The Garden Inn on 42nd is a better hotel for me. A bit noisier location, and pay for breakfast, but better sleep quality for what is often about the same price.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Its a nice hotel. Really new. The rooms are somewhat smaller than other Hiltons in the area. Staff was polite. Hotel was clean and the location is very convenient. Breakfast included in the room rate. I do not believe there was a bar or restaurant available in the hotel. It was very quiet in the hotel. The only complaint were the smaller elevators and it could be difficult to get one. We would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The hotel itself is in a great locatin. Very easy to get around the city. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. Free cookies in the lobby is a plus.The rooms are very nice and some offer a city viewvas well.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Excellent hotel. Great location right near times square (2 to 3 Block walk). No real views but very nicely appointed rooms. The staff are excellent. there is a good amount of foot traffic outside and cabs are readily available. Bar54 is right around the corner, must go to it, but no kids allowed on the 54th floor which is the only reason to go. Had two rooms, a king and a double queen with no complaints. Breakfast is free and BUSY. plan your time if you have pressing engagements as there is a line for everything at breakfast.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Staff friendly and rooms good, BUT they don't have enough elevators and plan on spending a lot of time or planning working around that huge flaw. Whoever developed this either went cheap or didn't have enough space in the design as they slammed in more rooms.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Our stay at this hotel was excellent. The location was perfect for getting around easily. Breakfast in the morning was a great experience. The checking in online was great. The staff was excellent and very helpful.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location, small rooms; welcome to NY! Nice rooms, great lobby, good breakfast- wonderful coffee :) Wifi excellent ! So close to Times Square and so many of the theaters; very walkable and good access to subway! Go, stay! I am high maintenance and we'll be back! Just a great vibe.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel was AWESOME!! Just steps away from Broadway shows, Times Square, shopping, the subway, dining, etc. It is in an awesome location. Our room on the 31st floor was small, probably 12ft x 12ft. We paid extra for a view that wasn't spectacular but what can you expect when high rise buildings are everywhere! It had a safe, coffee maker, but no microwave or fridge (fridge is $20 per day extra). Our room was too small to have a chair but had an ottoman. Had a desk with a chair. The bathroom had a walk in shower. Even though it was small the room was well appointed and modern. It served us well as we were only there to sleep. They have 3 elevators and never had to wait long for one. The complimentary breakfast (6am to 10am) each morning was very good. Eggs (scrambled, hard boiled, or omelets), a meat (bacon, sausage), fruit, make your own waffles with plenty of toppings, cereals, oatmeal, yogurt, bagels, danish, muffins, etc... Even though we had read it can be very crowded, we never had a problem getting food or finding a seat. But getting there early is helpful to beat the rush. In the evening they have warm cookies at the front desk. 24/7 hot coffee, tea and hot chocolate at the front desk area as well. They have a concierge desk as well as a business center we used to print out our travel documents. The staff were all very knowledgeable, welcoming, friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I had a one nite stay here for business. Check in and out were very quick. There was a sitting area and 3 computers with printer in the lobby. Wifi in room worked great. The room was spacious by NYC standards with a comfortable bed. I heard some noise outside from my 16th floor room but not in the halls as there were only 12 rooms on the floor and seemed well insulated. The temperature could also be easily adjusted. The bathroom had very nice tiling and a somewhat small countertop. Breakfast had many selections of teas, coffee, fruits, yogurts etc. It was busy but food kept full and places to sit. After breakfast was the only time there was a wait for the elevator but was less than 2mins. Great location in midtown to Times Square, theatre, Rockefeller Center etc. Would recommend.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Clean newer hotel within Walking distance to Times Square, The Empire State Building, Saks Fifth Avenue, Rockefeller, Macys and Central Park. Early Check in was not available, but we did get a great room near the top with a great view..Staff was friendly and helpful. We did not experience problems waiting for an elevator as I read others did. Breakfast was decent, good variety, although crowded. Would definately return to this hotel and recommend it to others.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: You can't really complain about the location of this Hampton Inn if you are looking for shows and its proximity to Times Square.The rooms are in good shape and the bed was comfortable. The showers pressure left a bit to be desired and there was a horrible smell coming from the drain for my entire stay.I found the housekeeping staff to be friendly, but the front desk staff could use a revisit to customer service training. My request for an early check-in was not fulfilled and when I came back 15 minutes before the 3 pm check-in time it was still a hassle for them to find a room - it was like they were testing me in a way to see if I would walk away from the desk. I didn't and of course, they suddenly found a room.I didn't bother with breakfast - the place was a zoo and there are tons of places to grab better food within a short walk of the hotel. Word of warning - give yourself extra time in the morning and evening on waiting for the elevators. Hampton seems to have cheaped out on the 3 elevators that service this tall hotel and it can take some time to make it down when they are busy.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed here for 3 nights in December. We booked a last minute vacation to see the sights at Christmas time. Location was perfect. Walking distance to Central Park, Times Square, Rockefeller place, 5th avenue,Macy's, and one block over from Hell's Kitchen. Room was fine. Bathroom could use an upgrade. Found the room extremely cold. We couldn't move the heat past 71(?). Felt like 68. Bathroom had no heat. Floor was ice cold. I slept with my scarf on just to stay warm.Self serve breakfast was included, which was pretty good. We checked out at 3am. I was a little irritated that when we went to the front desk to check out the front desk attendant was on the phone discussing rates and our car service was waiting. Paid too much.3 nights =$1975 us. I'm disappointed with the value. (We are Hilton members offered 4bottles of water for 3 nights 2 adults. They said that was the max? Really?)

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This is a fairly new Hampton Inn close to everything. The service is 5+ stars. I spoke to Maria prior to checking in and she makes it worth it to be a Hilton Diamond Member. Nini checked on my stay a few times by text and was quite friendly. The rooms were super clean and had a new feel to it. They were actually spacious as city standards go. You can always tell the quality of housekeeping by the cleanliness of the bathroom and it was 5 stars. You are centrally located leaning on being very close to Theatre district And a short walk away from Penn Station This will be one of my go to locations during my work trips to the city.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location. Slow check in, foyer uninviting, wait forever for elevators so avoid the high floors, breakfast room overcrowded and noisy, internet slow and drops out frequently. Room and bed were comfortable and relatively quiet for location. Housekeeping staff were good.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Our city view room had a great view over the city. Great location, so easy to walk to theatre and all manner of restaurants so close. Times Square a few minutes from the door. Staff were friendly and gracious, particularly Geraldine in the breakfast room. Room was comfortable albeit not much more than cruise room size. A little pricey for our budget but in line with other hotels.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed very recently and found this place to be a little gem in the midst of bustling Times Square. Staff were excellent including John at Concierge but most especially Geraldine in the Breakfast cafe. So many little touches to enhance your stay from lovely clean rooms to superb breakfast to free wi-fi, water, take out snacks to the late evening coffee and home made cookies all contributing to a most enjoyable stay.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I stayed at this hotel on December the 10th to try it out. I usually stay at Hilton but decided to try something different big mistake. I check my account and they had charge me for taxes after taxes was already taken out. I went to speak to the front desk the guy was trying to come up with every reason to explained why i was charge for taxes until i showed him my email with my trip paid for including taxes. After Kris said he fix my issue i get home on the 14th to find my account in negative !!!!! I ask why am i being charge the whole amount i paid for then a extra 688 dollars on too of 7 hundred and something i already paid to stay for the two days. They say i should talk to my bank. The only way a hold is put on your account if someone puts it there. Im just irritated with this hotel ive never ever had this experience at any hotel in Time Square but this one .
user_name:
john l
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: For the price point (especially this time of year) this hotel is surprisingly good. It's contemporary clean and located near Times Square. The staff is friendly and the service is good. I was impressed by the property given the price point.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Just returned from our first ever visit to NYC for my wife's 60th birthday year celebrations.This hotel is in a fantastic location for almost everything you want to do or see in NYCrooms very clean coffee/tea maker and a king bed to die for so comfortable as you need it after the long days out and about in this great city the hotel had free coffee and other hot drinks 24hr in lobby plus bottle water and other treats, a light breakfast is included in your stay which was great to start your day off if you were in a rush they had grab and go food bags on reception every morning.Would defiantly stay here again and recommend this hotel we found the best price was direct with hotel as you would be best being a Hilton honers member the WiFi was very good everywhere in the hotel well done Hampton inn great hotel.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Just spent a chilly but lovely weekend in NYC with my extended family and stayed for the first time at this Hampton Inn. Very convenient location right off Times Square. Beautiful lobby. Very nice front desk staff.You have to swipe your room-key before you can push the button for any floor of this thirty floor hotel. It's so annoying sitting there while everyone swipes their cards and pushes their room numbers. Try having two cups of coffee and swiping your card and pushing a button. It cannot be done. I appreciate security but this is not the answer. I had several issues with the room. For NYC the room was a decent size. I did not like the sliding door on the bathroom as you really have no privacy due to large gaps in-between the door and the wall on both sides. It looks cool but it does not function well. The curtains are totally inadequate to cover the windows. I could not get the room dark and when you have a room right off of Times Square there is so much flashing light coming through the windows it made it difficult to sleep. This is a very noisy hotel. We were put next door to a room with multiple children. Interesting thing about that is that this family had two rooms and the hotel put their other room across the hall instead of next door so there was lots of kid noise early in the morning between those two rooms. It sounded like the kids were sitting in our room that's how not sound-proofed the walls were. There was no notepad nor pen in the room. I almost exclusively stay in Hampton Inns and have never not had a notepad and a pen. Usually I would travel with those items anyway but this time I didn't have any paper and needed some. Went down to the front desk to ask for a notepad and the clerk tells me that the whole hotel is out of them and she hands me a few post-it notes. That is either very poor management or a stupid way to save money at a $400/night hotel -- not providing a pen and a pad of paper. Also for $400.00 a night why was there rarely ever a doorman to help with bags and flagging down taxis? That's a NYC hotel standard. But I rarely saw one out there at this hotel. Bottom line...this is a really nice hotel. It is. You should try it out. I just want them to address some of these issues with the room and the other things that made this stay less than excellent.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Perfect location - close to transportation. Room was very clean and breakfast was ideal before setting out for the day. Loved all the pillows on the bed and the small number of rooms per floor. Very quiet considering its location.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The location was ideal but the room was very, very small and over priced. Breakfast was good, but trying to get a table was way to crowded and very difficult. Lobby is small but again the location was terrific. Subway was very, very close to the hotel and we used it often

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I chose this hotel because I had to visit a customer that was just 4 blocks away. The lobby was quite busy when I got here at 3pm but the desk was not. Although I had checked in online the day before the said my room was not ready but they had another room ready for me on another floor that was the exact same room location as the one I had chosen. It was nice that this hotel has 3 elevators.The room was very clean and quiet with no NYC street noise heard while sleeping. The breakfast area was clean and well stocked.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed on work trip December 2016. Hotel was booked by co-worker due to proximity to convention center.I was skeptical about staying here, but actually this hotel worked out great for us and I would highly recommend for business trip. Make sure you are looking a the right hotel - there are two other Hampton Inns at Times Square, and I think this is the nicest one.Hotel is well located, on 41st between 7th and 8th. This puts it in the center of the subway universe, with direct lines to almost everywhere. Of particular importance is the A-C-E train, connecting with JFK Airport and Penn Station; and the 7 Train, connecting with the Convention Center.The hotel is modern, seemed pretty new, and the room was big (for NY) and very clean. Everything worked great. It is not cheap but roughly in the middle of the market for cost; you could spend a lot more and get a place that isn't all that much better.Problems? Not enough elevators, the breakfast was way overcrowded, and long lines to check in/out.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Prompt check in. Our room really smelt of cigarettes which wasn't nice.Room was by the lift so very noisy.It appeared that the toilet was leaking and the shower door didn't shut properly.The rooms are so small. A couple and a toddler with 3 cases and a stroller was more than a squeeze.Breakfast was good and staff excellent. Reception staff were very helpful and even got our son some warm milk for bed. Really central location close to the main Times Square area, top of the rock,Empire State Building, grand central station. We also walked to the natural history museum and Central Park. Just a bit of a trek to ground zero/ battery park so we go a cab for $25.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Had an amazing time. Great staff. The location was perfect. The rooms were very nice and the city view rooms were great. I would definitely stay at this hotel every time I return to New York. Steps away from time square

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This property was in an excellent location for visitors to Times Square and surrounding attractions, Rooms were clean and neat, not enough light in the bathrooms for applying makeup better lighting would be great. Free breakfast was definitely a plus and another good reason to choose this property. Very good security

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Hotel open less than a year, so very clean & well kept. Rooms are small but nice. Breakfast staff Geraldine & Teddy are amazing! Both of these women went out of their way each morning to greet us, chat, and take care of everyone-paying special attention to our daughter. They are both wonderful assets to this busy hotel. Thank you Teddy & Geraldine!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: A brand new property in a most convenient location. On the outside edge of the theater district, just 1 1/2 blks from Times Sq and 1 blk from 42nd St terminal for all modes of transportation. Only 6 blks to Macy's and 9 blks to Saks 5th Ave and Rockefeller Ctr. And everyone on the property was extremely welcoming and nice. I can't think of more reasons than these to stay here. Oh yeah, costs? Hey it's Times Sq! Not so bad considering what you get!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Spent four nights here. The location is great for walking about town. It is located on a quiet street, for New York. The room was clean and the bed very comfortable. Marilyn did a great job with the room. The free breakfast was very, nice and hard to find anything free downtown. Andrés did a great job in the breakfast area and so did Geraldine with cleanup. If you like waffles ask Andres to make his special waffle using oatmeal. Really good. Chris at the front desk was also very friendly. Would stay here any time. I would recommend a low floor though.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Good location, very friendly and helpful staff. Complimentary breakfast was better than many places I have been and they offer free go bags if you do not have time to sit and eat. Walking distance to everything we needed.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Yes, I would definitely recommend this hotel as well as stay there again. Pros: Location is excellent and so is the breakfast. Rooms are clean and relatively large by NYC standards for sure. The women who are working during breakfast were SO nice and welcoming...Teddy was extra pleasant and friendly. Letitia was SUPER--very nice and professional. Other appreciated extras: complimentary bottled water, warm cookies in the evening, coffee and hot chocolate available in lobby at all times. Concierge was knowledgeable and helpful about tours, restaurants, etc Only Con: Some of the other front-desk folks were not particularly helpful. We asked for a map the evening we checked in and were told we could get one at the Concierge desk at 8 *the next morning*. Finally, after we asked other directions, one of the men walked across the room to the Concierge desk and got us a map. Also, I twice reported that our phone wasn't working to no avail. Again, I would certainly stay here again!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The room is small, the smallest Hampton Inn I have ever seen. I was not too surprised because it is New York yet I expected more. It is located within walking distance of theaters, Bryant Park, Rockefellow Center. The breakfast can get quite crowded so you may have to look for a seat. The staff was okay - some more friendly than others. Other than location, it is nothing to write home about. I still think I paid too much for what I got.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My wife and I took a weekend away in NYC and loved the experience. The hotel location was pretty good. The downside was the lobby was super small and always crowded making the experience painful. The meal area was crammed everyday... we could even make it to the buffet any of the three days we were there. I won't go back to this hotel

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Spent my November birthday at this hotel. The location was great. Very convenient to Broadway theaters and lots of good eating choices. We had a great room - very quiet for NYC. Very clean hotel. Great service! Wonderful breakfast. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Location is the reason you book here! Front desk could care less if you are here(they don't realize without us there is no Them) the bellmen were awesome. The breakfast was very good crispy bacon and oatmeal my favorite. Lol but again don't expect your front desk to help. Letisha needs to get customer service help

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel was in a great location for the Subway, Times Square and watching Macy's Day Parade. It was not the best Hampton Inn I've stayed at but it was pretty typical Hampton Inn amenities. Breakfast for my husband is always a plus.
user_name:
Michelle G
Deerfield Beach, United States

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Visited over Thanksgiving. The hotel's location is perfect. Steps from time square, theaters and the subway. Breakfast was good, all staff were very nice. In room fridge will cost you twenty bucks for the length of your stay. Pick up a cheesecake from Juniors and some milk from Walgreens and you'll be set for a bedtime snack all week. Beds were comfortable and room was roomy enough. About the elevators - slow. Plan accordingly.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed here for 2 nights. Hotel is clean & staff are friendly & helpful. Breakfast is great with lots of choice. There was always hot drinks available along with fruit & biscuits. Rooms were quiet, fairly small but when you're in NY you don't spend time in your hotel room do you? We had to wait a short time for a lift during busy periods, had we not been on 29th floor we would have used the stairs. Fantastic central location, would recommend for a great New York stay & would stay again!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: What a wonderful place to stay for a NY theater visit. I am a former New Yorker who has lived away for many years. Over the years we have visited many times and we have always stayed in five star east side hotels. This time we decided to make things easy on ourselves and stay in the theater district. We chose the HI Times Square Central for location and reviews. What a great decision. This is a terrific hotel. The facilities are excellent, the location is perfect and the staff are extraordinarily kind and helpful. We checked into our 28th floor room away from the elevator as we requested on the app and when we arrived close to 11:00 PM our process was swift and correct. Front desk personnel were charming and a small snack bag was provided. The extra pillows we requested were in our room. The room was small but beautifully furnished. Great bed, desk and chair, a real closet with a safe, ironing board and iron and nice hangers. Well lit bathroom and nice shower. Plenty of towels. Multiple USB charging ports at desk and near the bed. Good lighting in bedroom. Surprisingly quiet with no street noise. The hotel says the rooms are soundproof and ours seemed to be. The only noise we heard were a few voices in the hall for a few moments. Housekeeping was done early in the day and was very nicely completed. Breakfast in the dining area was well done. Hampton Inns have a nice breakfast selection and this was up to the standard. Hot and cold food, eggs cereals, pastries fruit coffee etc. very very nice staff in the breakfast room kept food refreshed and tables bussed cleaned and ready. Considering how busy the hotel was the breakfast experience was really great in large part due to the diligence and friendliness of the crew. Elevator service was fast and generally not overcrowded. We never had to wait more than a couple of minutes for the lift. There is a small convenience market in the lobby and 24 hr coffee and tea. Because of the excellent location we were able to walk to and from the theater performances. For other things we used Uber. Since the hotel is so centrally located waits were never more than five minutes for car to arrive. Maria and Letitia at the front desk were particularly gracious. Maria emailed us the day of arrival to see if we needed anything special and saw to it everything we asked for was in place. Letitia was always smiling and warm. Overall one could not chose a better hotel for a theater visit. Frankly the service put many five star hotels we have stayed at to shame. These folks really understand customer service and make one welcome and comfortable Thanks to everyone!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Location was excellent. In walking distance of Times Square and many other areas. Stayed up on the 26th floor very quiet. Front desk was very polite. Would stay their again. In walking distance matter of fact actually right next door great little Irish Pub. Nice for a night-cap.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I found this room online as we were trying to fit four in a room; very few hotels have two beds in a room. Good sized room, surprisingly quiet for being close to Times Square and across from the elevator. Excellent service. Would stay here again!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The room was clean and quiet, the beds were comfortable and the internet was fast. It was difficult getting an elevator during the morning rush, but other than that, everything was great.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Good hotel, right in Times Square. Easy to get to, clean, and friendly staff. The elevator was a little wonky and crowded, but it was a busy weekend, so that was to be expected. Staff was great and was able to check us in early, which was awesome!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: A block south of 42nd street is a great location for this hotel. It is a relatively new property with well maintained and contemporary-looking common areas. While all available space has been used efficiently, at times it makes you feel crammed with not enough space to leisure around. Check-in was pleasant. Despite a long line during the busy Thanksgiving holiday period, the staff efficiently and pleasantly assisted everyone. The elevator-wait felt long as we ended up waiting between 4 to 6 minutes for the handful of times we used them and generally the small elevators got full quickly. The included breakfast service was quite good. It wasn't hard to get a table and vigilant staff ensured that the food stations were well-stocked and the areas clean. Complimentary internet was easy to access and worked well during the entire stay on the 3 devices we connected. The king-bedroom felt quite small. After getting off the elevator onto a very narrow hallway, the room-doors were literally an arm's stretch away. Opening the door you are literally two steps from the bed. Two small nightstands on either side have USB charging plugs. The room carpet also felt cheap quality. A very small closet and a tight bathroom complete the accommodation. The TV had a wider selection of channels than at a typical hotel. Overall, probably commensurate with the price you pay. As a Hilton gold member, we got upgraded to a higher floor and were allowed to checkout at 2 pm (after some negotiation), which makes the brand loyalty worthwhile.
user_name:
AXP_MMA
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We recently stayed at the Hampton Manhattan and we weren't too impressed. The staff was very nice and friendly which is a big plus. The rooms were very small and the hotel was just off the beaten path. Not bad for a stay in NYC.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I am a huge fan of Hampton Inns. This one did not disappoint! It is in a great location and everyone working there was super pleasant. The rooms are smaller than other Hamptons, but you are in the city and they're big enough for what you need. There are three elevators, and you may wait some time before getting one, but steps are available. Breakfast area was clean and well stocked. At busy times you may have to wait for a table. Round the clock coffee, tea, and hot cocoa are always a bonus! Clean, clean, clean! I have nothing negative to say about this Hampton and I would definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We spent 2 nights at this hotel and could not have had a better experience! Front desk staff was great-so helpful. Our rooms were ready early and we were able to check in. Rooms are super clean and beds are so comfortable! The breakfast each morning was great and the young lady running it was awesome! Only complaint was the long wait for an elevator but our experience was so good it didn't really matter. Great job!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Service was spot on. Look up Geraldine in the breakfast room. She was great. Clean room. Slow Elevators. Super location. Easy access to subway and tour busses as well as casual dining. Easy to find hotel.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Our first time to NY the hotel is bang on top of everything, (cut through mc Donalds ) take a good pair of walking shoes. The hotel is clean tidy the room is warm and spacious with tea making facilities and a safe, a dim night light in the bathroom a great touch. Compliemtry tea/coffee in reception.Great choice of breakfast, waffle making machines omg I loved this, The staff are friendly and helpful.A great hotel which I would highly recommend.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We chose this Hampton Inn as it is a short walk from Penn Station and appeared to be a newer property which is always a plus when staying in Manhattan.We arrived in late afternoon and were greeted by a very friendly front desk agent who checked us in and gave us a number of recommendations for a restaurant close by.The hotel lobby was very busy as well as very tastefully decorated and most importantly very clean.Our room on the 27th floor had a very nice view of the skyline to include the Empire State Building and was not facing a street so the noise was minimal by NY standards anyway.The room itself was spotless as was the bathroom. The size of the room was small but adequate and probably the norm in the city. The room safe came in handy as did the coffee maker and ironing board and iron.The housekeeping staff did a great job with the cleaning everyday and was very responsive to anything that we needed.That being said the entire staff was very professional as well as helpful. The morning breakfast bar was crowded and busy and the food was standard Hampton Inn fare with everything clean and the food fresh. Again the staff there was very professional as well. Even with the crowd we easily found a clean table to sit at each morning.We were happy to have a concierge in the lobby that was very helpful with advice as well as making reservations for us at a fantastic restaurant, Arno, on 38th St. for us.The three elevators served us well after a few minute waits from time to time and two trips that were rather crowded. Not bad for a busy NY hotel.The location of the hotel is perfect as it is just off of Seventh Ave. which is busy but you can walk West over to Eighth and Ninth where there are a number of restaurants and a wine shop at 594 Eighth Ave that seemed to have reasonable prices even for NY.All in all a very pleasant stay and if and when we return to NYC we will stay there again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We spent 7 nights in this hotel in later September and could not have chosen a better located hotel. it is very close to Broadway & Times Square and also a few steps away from the underground but it was very quiet. We had no view (only of building on 40th street) but there's a roof terrace where you can get a reasonable view. I guess the higher floors do have rooms with a view.The room was not enormous but quite sufficient. It was cleaned every day and the towels changed too, even when we didn't ask for this. There are facilities for making drinks in the room but this was rarely necessary as there are free hot drinks (tea/coffee/hot choc) available in the lobby all the time - and there are also often fresh cookies!Breakfast was served over several hours to suit everyone. There was always plenty of fresh fruit, hot food and also batter to make your own waffles! It was quite crowded at 'peak times' but it was always possible to find a table. The kitchen staff were very friendly and helpful.The hotel has a small shop (and a microwave in the lobby) and an area for printing plane tickets etc... and every morning there's a desk where one can book trips and shows.On the last day we were able to leave our luggage in reception as we had a late evening flight. The reception staff were always very polite.The one issue we had was the lifts: too slow and not enough of them so you could end up waiting for a long time at 'peak times'! Only a minor issue for us but perhaps worth mentioning... We would go back to this hotel without hesitation.
