hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The price was much cheaper than many others in the area, so we weren't expecting much, but are pretty happy overall.Pros: -2 bottles of water per person free of charge- free snack (Doritos or Cheetos)- clean rooms- decent sized rooms for NYC- large shower- windows that open- friendly staffCons:- housekeeping woke us up at 8:30am trying to clean- observation deck was not open - breakfast was slightly below average compared to other Hampton Inn hotels- the bathroom looks nice, but no privacy for families...

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This is right at the time square... being at 41st str, the noise levels are much lower (than 42st str), which helps a lot. Location is the best part. It has complementary breakfast... good (not great), fresh, but no live kitchen. Serves the purpose. Rooms are large enough (relatively speaking), but lighting could be improved. Reception staff is very warm and friendly. Absolutely recommend this for a stay around TS@NYC.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This is a great location near Times Square. The subway station is right across the street and a big convenience. The staff was wonderful and we even were able to check in at 9 am. The bad is the elevators. We were on 30 and would plan for 5-10 minute ride. Breakfast lunch a crowded also, but hey, it's NYC. Overall would definitely stay here again

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Staff very friendly and helpful. Room was ready when we got in at 11 am and we were given water and snack bags. Very nice clean room! Great complimentary breakfast! Great location and was able to explore what was near the hotel and catch the hop on hop off busses.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We don't normally stay in the city because we live nearby, but we were there for a show at Carnegie Hall on Saturday night and thought we'd treat ourselves. The Hampton Inn is only about a block from the Subway- right near Times Square, and is really convenient to everything. The free breakfast and wifi make it a good value. The staff was friendly and the room was clean and had everything we needed.
user_name:
Cheryl D
Port Chester, NY, United States

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This is a very nice hotel in the heart of NYC and close to everything. The room I was in was fantastic, quiet and very comfortable. There is a nice breakfast in the morning but it can get crowded. There is plenty of food though so be patient.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I am a Hilton Honors member, and even though the staff received me as one, they did not explain the 100% satisfaction guaranteed. In addition, other Hampton Inn have microwave and fridge in their room, but this one did not have it. Upon questioning the front desk, they only advised that the microwave was downstairs. No additional effort was presented by the employee. Very disappointed.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Two problems... the bathroom door is a glass sliding barn style door which provides ZERO privacy, The door leaves about a 1.5 inch gap and is glass pretty much see through. The main entry door has an extra security latch that actually locked us out! Think of the latch you flip and your door won't close all the way, most hotels have them. This one is smaller and flat and actually locked us out! We had to wait 20 minutes for a guy to show up with a bent wire hangar to let us in. He says it happens all the time!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: First time in New York, stayed here with 3 friends for a few days. What a location, close to Time Square, The rooms are clean and cosy. All Staff are very friendly, and are very helpful. Food is excellent, and there was plenty to eat , There is cookies and fruit all the time. Also a hot drink machine in the lobby, that can be used. The hot chocolate is amazing. So overall a lovely experience and I would recommend this hotel to anyone .

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Nice room and great location. Elevator was a little bit of an issue, but stairs were available. There was construction going on out side my room and happened at midnight, but only one night. Overall, room was good.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I really enjoyed my stay here and I must say that the best part was the food and drinks. All day, every day, during winter time, they offer free tea, hot chocolate, and cookies in the lobby! I would not be surprised if they offer the cookies and tea year-round, but the hot coco is probably a winter thing. The hotel rooms had a lot of space as well as relaxing. The only problem I had was that the shower got stopped up from a mass of hair (It was literally a MASS of hair) that was apparently deep in the drain. Aside from that, I had a very pleasurable experience and I greatly recommend the hotel.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: What a terrific hotel! The best Hampton Inn I've ever stayed in. Ideal location, cozy room with an ideal view, and the staff who greeted me were the best! Thank you, Emanuel, Thomas, and Nini. You are exceptional!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Location wise and quality wise that is.Just between the theater district and garment district. In the rather quiet 41 street, you just leave to hotel go either east or west, to find your self near theaters , shopping and diner possibilities .Great reception / 24/7 coffee, tea on the lobby , breakfast starting from 6:00 am. We had two spacious double beds, with 4 pillows each.A good working AC ! A lot of amenities, great bathroom , large HD Led TV, wifi .This is where I will certainly return to Highly recommended.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Found this hotel really by accident, and so happy I did. I spend a lot of time in Manhattan, but this caught me by surprise. 41st, I generally ( in the past ) didn't pay much attention to. Was looking to come in for a weekend with friends, and it popped up in a search.The staff couldn't be more professional, and friendly. Above & beyond. In fact, I was so impressed, I went back the very next weekend. That initially appeared problematic, since it was the Columbus Holiday Weekend, Alicia Keys concert, parade, & Comic Convention. Gerry Hughes was able to make it happen for me & friends. The rooms are spacious and immaculate. Even though I prefer to have a mini fridge in my room, I was willing to overlook this since the breakfast was more than adequate, and front desk supplied an endless amount of bottled water. Jonny ( the greeter/ doorman/ baggage storer/ taxi finder, is truly incredible. Along with front desk greeter Maria. What ever they are being paid, ( which I hope is well) tip them any way. They are deserving.I am planning another trip to Manhattan in February 2017, and would love to stay there once again.
user_name:
LauraD181
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel exceeded all expectations. Staff was very helpful, and positive. We've stayed at many Hamptons, but this one tops the list. Excellent on all fronts. Location is great, rooms while small seemed larger, and bathrooms were super.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The hotel was nice.. small and quaint but it did the trick. Breakfast was nice they offered a few waffle irons that allowed you to make fresh waffles which was plus for me since I hate cold food and I'm not a buffet person. I did miss them offering an omelette station. They did offer coffee and a to-go meal bag which was nice. The room we had was small but comfy and clean and staff were helpful and polite.My only con would have been the fact that our room was not ready and the hotel was busy and they allowed you to leave your bags but they wee literally left on the side of the desk for anyone to touch or take. I waited because I was concerned about my items being taken and was told that bags were fine and would be moved but I watched them sit for at least 15 minutes..again they were busy. I even went into my own bag at least two times and no one ever looked my way or questioned whether it belonged to me. That wouldn't have been so bad if I was the only one there and they could have remembered that particular bag belonged me but the lobby was packed with people checking in and out and standing on top of each other and near tons of luggage that had been left sitting right next too the counter.I politely pushed ours to the bag of the luggage area where someone had to move other bags to get to them and hoped for the best. Everything was put up behind a closed door area when we returned and nothing was missing.Overall a great stay in a good location. I would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We just returned from a 2-night stay, our second of the year.THE GOOD: I had a positive experience a few months ago so decided to stay again last week. The staff here is excellent - very helpful, friendly, and there's a lot of them. The room is a pretty good size, above average clean (bathroom corners could use some attention, however), the windows open, there's enough hot water, the shower works, the toilet flushes properly, the beds are comfy, free coffee in the lobby, the breakfast has more than enough variety - there's enough here to make this a good choice. I booked on Expedia w/ airfare and the price was one of the least expensive.THE BAD: Its a relatively new hotel but the furniture was already marked up. The bathroom door opens directly into the room (when it should have opened into the hallway right by the entry door), they use a barn door that is open at the sides so if you're not staying with family, it could be awkward. Elevators are slow and often packed - get a room on a low floor and take the stairs.Overall, I'd enjoyed my stay, as last time. As long as the price and room condition is in check, I'd stay again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Very friendly staff, great location . I definitely recommend to family and friends. We will stay again. Close To Bryant Park,Macy's and many good restaurants. Hampton inn Times Square. Definitely a place to stay in New York City

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Best Service and value in Times Square! Rooms are new and beyond expectations, staff service is excellent and certainly better than at a widely known 7 star hotel in Geneva; great job at keeping guests happy. Rooms are clean and spacious but not luxurious.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The location of this hotel is good but it is almost like a student hostel! Breakfast is held in a small room & guests simply push past to feed themselves & grab items. No sense of courtesy. I know this isn't the hotel's fault but the area is simply too cramped. Quality of food on offer is very average. Nothing terribly appetising.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The hotel is an excellent location and the staff was extremely helpful. This is the only hotel that texted us upon arrival at the airport to ask if we needed any assistance during our stay in New York.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: It's not a 5 star hotel, but the location, service, rooms, and value make this a great pick. Rooms are not small for NY, I'd say more like about average. However, they are fine, enough room for what you need and everything in the rooms is top notch.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I stayed with my spouse and daughter. Everything is ok. Room may be small but is ok. The door man is very helpful. I arrived at 7:00 am but they allowed me to checked in earlier at 12:00. I will come back to this Hampton Inn when I visit NYC again

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My wife and I stayed at the Hampton Inn at Times Square. It was an ideal location, had very friendly and helpful staff, and was very clean. Many options at the complimentary breakfast. Highly recommended fit anyone traveling to NYC.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Just a quick review. Stayed here for 1 night. Friendly staff, comfortable public areas and rooms. Great location, but expensive (it's in Times Square). Will stay here again. My only complaint would be the limited hot selections for breakfast.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This is a fairly new hotel that is nicely decorated. I liked this hotel a lot and would recommend it. The pros for this hotel are as follows:- The front office staff were very friendly and helpful. - The room had adequate space for all of our stuff- The shower was large- The mattress was comfortable- The air conditioning worked well- The Wi-Fi was free and it worked well. More than one person in the room could use the Wi-Fi at the same time.- There is a free breakfast- The concierge was helpful- The hotel's location is good. It is close to Times Square, the Broadway plays, and the beginning of the hop-on hop-off bus toursThere were a few cons that I'm going to describe but these items do not out weigh the pros. The cons are mainly minor issues. The cons for this hotel are as follows:- The rooms are on the small side but I think most NYC hotel rooms are like this. - The flat sheet on the bed doesn't overlap off the sides of the bed far enough, maybe 3-4 inches. I don't like this because when you turn over or your partner pulls on the sheets a little on their side of the bed, there's not enough of the sheet left on your side of the bed to fully cover you. I've seen this same situation at other hotels so I don't know what the deal is with the sheets. At home my flat king sheet overlaps about 12 inches on each side.- It was a little too dark in the bathroom for putting on make-up. They have lights behind the mirror in the bathroom but it's still too dark. - The breakfast buffet didn't have any English muffins (very minor issue)

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Location is good, easy on and off subway, and some nice bars and restaurants in the area. Price was better than average for the area and quality. Staff was friendly and helpful. Room was clean and maid service very good. Room was older and hotel could use to be updated. Breakfast was average for a Hampton Inn. Probably would stay here again, but nothing there to keep me from trying a similarly priced Hotel in the area .

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Excellent choice and location, 1/2 block off time square. Great great location, service and staff, breakfast and all the Hampton niceties. Very good choice for NYC. Weekends crowded due to tourists but still a great place to stay. Easily walkable to Central Park and SOHO
user_name:
Frank E. T
Park City, United States

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Had an amazing time at this hotel, which is at the heart of New York City. As a family we had an amazing experience all together, would be definitely staying back at this property again . Loved every bit of our stay, the rooms were very clean, spacious and comfortable. Had an amazing city view room which made our stay even way more special. Would definitely recommend this hotel in terms of the quality of stay, value for money and most importantly for the great experience of staying at Times square.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Loved everything about this hotel..It was all a great experience, would be staying at this hotel again. It's in a great location, the rooms are very neat and spacious, staffs were very courteous and friendly. All together as a family we had a great time and an amazing view of the city.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We really enjoyed our stay here, we even left and can back the same day to stay an extra night! It has a perfect location if you want to be near time square. It is new, clean, affordable and has free breakfast! The only thing that would make it better r if the rooms were a bit bigger, but then again, its new York city and not Texas.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This is a great place to stay! I am an Hhonors Diamond member, and I was able to choose a great room on the 25th floor. I recommend the back side of the hotel if you mobile check-in for views to the South.Check-in was quick and easy, but I could image it could back up quickly during busy times. Elevators were always quick and available. The room was small but clean, and in NY, I will take that any day. The rooms are also modern and functional, and the bathroom is great with a good shower. The sheets are silky and nicer than what is in most Hampton Inns. I also found the room to be surprisingly quite; you can also set the AC fan to always on - a huge feature to me!Breakfast was very typical Hampton; it's fine for what it is, but you could definitely find other way better options nearby. With that said, if you have lunch and dinner plans, it is fine for grabbing a quick, light bite before heading out. You can also grab a to-go breakfast. Finally, enjoy warm cookies in the evening.The location is good for several train stops and for Times Square.The only real disappointment for me is that the rooftop was locked. There is a deck up there with elevator access, but you can't walk outside. I would have liked to have enjoyed the view.All told, I would stay here again in a heartbeat. Great hotel with good prices.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel is in a great location. We were able to walk from the Penn Station to the hotel in 10 - 15 minutes and able to attend Wicked in another 10 - 15 minute walk. Besides location, the service and staff are wonderful. We arrived in the city very early and they took our bags for us while we spent the day sight seeing. At check-in, the gentleman who helped us was quick and courteous. There were also cookies, tea, hot chocolate, and coffee available in the lobby. That was very nice considering we had been caught in a downpour and were cold and wet. We had two rooms on the 20th floor, each room was clean and a decent size. Both had two comfortable double beds and a nice sized bathroom. The coffee maker was appreciated! In the morning, we enjoyed the free breakfast. There were plenty of choices: waffles, eggs, breads/muffins, yogurt, coffee, etc. The girl who was stocking the items was more than patient with the customer's somewhat rude demands - I guess that is part of being in NYC, dealing with rude people, but the girl handled it all very well and maintained the breakfast bar like the superwoman she was dressed as - it was Halloween. I hope her manager recognizes that she is wonderful with the customers. The breakfast area was swamped and it was difficult to find a seat, but the staff did what they could with what they had. I consider this hotel a value for NYC, we paid about $210 per room on a Sunday night. This was one of the lowest rates I could find after multiple searches for the area and it included breakfast! Thanks to all the staff that made our family trip to NYC memorable.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Centrally located on 41st between 7th and 8th avenue. Plenty of places to eat within a stones throw. Tons of restaurants along 9th - less than 5 minute walk. Lobby well-appointed, and water, coffee, tea and hot chocolate always available in lobby. Even though our room wasn't ready, check-in was a breeze, and the text us as soon as the room was available. 2 double room completely adequate, and we were even able to open the window a bit for fresh air. Breakfast was great, and complimentary daily. Verrrryyyyy busy at breakfast time, but the morning staff are so accomdating, you hardly notice. The only complaint of the entire stay....and yes, I only had one complaint....was that the three elevators are very slow in the AM. A couple mornings, we lugged baby and stroller down 9 flights to get downstairs, after waiting for an elevator that would accommodate the four of us. Other than this small annoyance, everything was wonderful, and we would definitely return for a future stay in Times Square.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: It was our first time in New York, but had stayed at previous Hamptons around the US. By far this has been the best one. The staff was wonderful, friendly and just awesome, from the desk staff, to the bell staff, cafeteria staff, housekeeping, everyone! And a special shot out to John at the concierge desk, he helped with with broadway musical tickets and tours! Can't wait to come back!!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Right in the middle of all of the action, this was the tallest Hampton Inn we have ever seen. We were on the 30th floor out of 31 so we had a few issues waiting for an elevator to come all the way up and get us. Breakfast was standard Hampton and quite crowded. Our room was small- but just fine for two. We had a king bed and a wonderful view of midtown Manhattan. This hotel is between 7th and 8th Ave on 41st street just a few steps from Times Square, and across the street from the main subway station.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel is centrally located a block from Times Square and Broadway. There are metro stops a block and a half from the hotel for easy access to NYC sites. The staff is very friendly and helpful. This hotel come with a free hot breakfast to get you ready for a day of sight seeing.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I had heard stories about how small hotel rooms are in NYC so I was expecting a tiny room on a girls trip that I took last weekend. The room with two double beds was good size (not huge but definitely bigger than I had imagined). The front desk staff and the concierge were very nice, friendly and helpful. Location of the hotel was great-- 4 blocks from Times Square and just one block from the show we went to (Paramour). And very near to 2-3 subway stops. It was a bit on the pricey side, but location and and staffing justified the price!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Hotel is in a great location. Walking distance to theatres and Times Square. Room was clean. Front desk, bellman and concierge are superb! Breakfast was disappointing. Hard boiled eggs were literally frozen. Selection was ok but there aren't enough tables for a hotel of this size. Biggest problem is the elevators. The customer elevators are also used by the hotel cleaning staff. Frequently, our party of 4 small women couldn't get on an elevator because hotel staff had their cleaning carts which took up half the elevator. It seems like there should be a staff elevator, or they need to keep elevators for customers only during busy hours. We were on 21st floor so taking steps was not an option. Plan on at least 5-10 minute wait during busy times

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Easy walk to numerous tourists attractions, restaurants, shops, the hop on/hop off bus stops, subway, etc. Nice hotel with friendly staff. Rooms were decent sized for NY. Recommend the car service to the airport.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My wife and I stayed for four nights in late October and found it to be a nice property overall but a couple of areas for improvement. Location, immediately south of the Theatre District and a couple of blocks west of Bryant Park/ Library is great as a base for exploring NYC. Rooms are nicely appointed with good amenities and while a bit on the small size are certainly more than adequate but thermostat could control better (too big a range from when AC cut in to when it cut out) . Friendly and helpful staff but it took three requests to get extra towels. The breakfast was OK but not up to the standard of other Hampton Inns (fruit seemed frozen, no white bread, a couple of the hot items not that tasty). Hotel is busy so elevators and breakfast seating area are pressed at times. However the negatives were much outweighed by good room, good location and friendly staff so would we stay here again? Yes without hesitation.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Wow is this a Hotel in a central location or What! If its the Buzz of New York that you are after then this is ideal. 5mins walk from Times Square. Close to many theaters and restaurants. And still you get a quiet nights sleep in a comfy bed. Free coffee in the lobby 24/7 is a winner. Breakfast is perfectly adequate if not superb. However you have to accept the disposable table ware. Great hot and cold choices. Efficient friendly staff.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The service front desk staff was fabulous and the rooms clean and plenty big. There is a big problem with the size and number (3) of elevators. One has to time it right to not have significant wait time or crowding. Everything else about the hotel experience is an absolute 10.
user_name:
Stephen L
New York, United States

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We specifically wanted a location central to Times Square for a family visit to Manhattan, and this facility was perfect. Very welcoming staff from the first moment we drove up to the check-out. As a Hilton Honors member, the process was easy. By Manhattan standards the double-double room was generous with room for all three persons and their luggage. The breakfast suite was fantastic. The hotel is ideally situated across the street from a subway station and within several blocks of a couple of other stations. Easy walk to all theatres, tons of restaurants and easy access to various NYC attractions. We'd stay here again in a heartbeat!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The hotel is a great location to restaurants, theaters and the subway. The hotel staff were very helpful and friendly. Room was clean, small but fine. The elevators were the only problem, slow and inefficient, but I would recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I've never been to NYC before and was absolutely blown away at how genuinely kind and helpful everyone was. Luis was so kind about holding our car and making suggestions for outings. Maria at the front desk went above and beyond to help us. John, the Concierge was spot on with his recommendations. I would come back just to see my "new friends".

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Great location if you don't want to drive as it is central to everything. Great service and clean rooms (wish they had queen beds instead of full). Nice breakfast included and Geraldine will make you feel like you are at home. She was so friendly and nice I felt like I had known her for years. Had to wait for elevators in the mornings which could be frustratring, but that was the only minor complaint. Front desk friendly, concierge friendly, breakfast help friendly, clean rooms. What more could you ask for. Thanks again!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Location is just great. Time Square behind the corner, number of metro lines in short distance. Madison Square Garden, Macy's, MoMa etc in walking distance.Rooms are not that big, but I guess that that's the case in NYC. Breakfast room was also a bit busy in the morning, but we were always able to find a free table. Breakfast itself was not luxurious, but good enough to start a day.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We could not have been happier with our choice of lodging while visiting New York City in late October 2016. This Hampton Inn is literally only a few steps from the theater district, wonderful restaurants, and shopping. The staff was amazing and always helpful and professional. The Breakfast Ambassador, Geraldine Meehan, greeted us each morning with a smile and gracious service. The rooms were new, clean, comfortable and met all of our needs. We will definitely stay at this same Hampton Inn when traveling to the Big Apple in the future. Highly recommend.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This newer hotel has the perfect location right off the main spot light of Times Square. My family and I enjoyed the friendly and helpful staff, excellent service, and complimentary goodies each day. I would definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I stayed here for only one night and had a very business day. I was quite impressed with the service, even though I had a late arrival. The breakfast was good as always, and I thought the gym was very well-appointed and clean.
user_name:
J G
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The hotel has insufficient elevators for it's number of floors and rooms. Massively long waits for elevators, as they speed past your floor because they are already at capacity. Plan 10 minutes to get an elevator back and forth to your room. Or request a room on floors 2-4 so that you can walk the stairs. In all other aspects the hotel is quite good.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Wonderful location of the hotel, early check-in. Was very helpful to have complimentary breakfast, very few hotels offer this option. The wait for elevator was a little long, and limited sitting space at breakfast. However, if you do it very early, it should be fine. Staff is very friendly. Bathroom could use a little more attention, had a smell. But towels and sheets were nice and clean.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Been here for a week and it has been as you would say in New York'AWESOME'Great location, superb complementary breakfasts,friendly helpful staff and very comfortable bedrooms.Amazing good value, could not fault it at all.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed there for 6 nights.The rooms are pretty small but clean and accessorized. On the first day, our room has not been cleaned and we should call the lobby to ask for it (After the Housekeeping hours).The Elevators are awful! you should wait 5-10 minutes every time for them to arrive.The Breakfast is just o.k, not something special.The location (this hotel's big advantage) is just great, 2 minutes by foot from the Times-Square.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The staff here is wonderfully warm and helpful. A man at the front desk, Thomas Collazo, even helped my friend find a quiet place to work through the wee hours of the morning. The location is great for Broadway shows - we walked there easily. The hotel offers free, warm cookies at the front desk and a free breakfast (just avoid the horrible eggs). The only minus is that the beds are doubles, rather than queensize. I would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed at this hotel over a weekend in Oct 2016. I would not recommend this hotel. The elevators are undersized (only 3 for 20+ floors) and it has the wrong elevator technology. We waited on each trip on average 20-25+ mins for an elevator and we were on a high floor otherwise I would have just taken the stairs. What an awful experience!!!! People pressing up and down buttons to get an elevator as everybody was frustrated. I am sure somebody was bribed to get approval for occupancy in this hotel.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Pleasurable experience and the staff was excellent, we would stay here again. The bed was very comfortable. The conseier service was very helpful to us to get find our way around the city and the best way to get there. Very thankful to have there help.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This is a newly built hotel and the rooms are spacious and well-furnished - but why didn't they spend a few dollars more on some double glazing? The sound of sirens, here just a block from Times Square, is deafening, and goes on all through the night. As for the "free breakfast" they boast about ... it's appallingly bad! I just don't understand the thinking: a tiny corner in the basement, way too small for the dozens of guests trying to fight their way to the food ... which consists of some canned fruit, some yoghurt pots, a tray of powdered scrambled eggs, some horrific fried pork patties, and a few stodgy and stale pastries ... and they serve it up on plastic plates, with plastic knives and forks! And in the bedrooms they supply only a couple of plastic cups - no glasses in the bathroom. Why? In this day and age of "green" thinking - surely that's not environmentally friendly? I paid extra for a "city view" room - but even tho it was up on the 29th floor, I could still see only the back of other skyscrapers. (I've included a pic here of the view from my room - judge for yourself if it's worth the extra money...) The view from the "viewing deck", two floors up, is no better. Lastly, the morning I left I needed to get to Brooklyn pier: the bellhop told me it was just as cheap to use the limo service he recommended as it would be to call a cab; $70 - so I took his advice. But it turned out, on the way back, the cab fare was only $30 - so another ripoff! This was my first stay at a Hilton, after joining their Honours programme. I don't think I'll be racking up any more loyalty points..

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I stayed 2 nights in this hotel. I paid over £700 for 2 nights. I had a less-than welcoming check-in - no smiles, a mumbling receptionist, and was sent to the second floor. The elevators took forever (there are only 3 to service 20+ floors - I started just taking the stairs). From my room there was no view. Other than a building and bit of roof. I called down and asked on the off chance if there was a chance of moving to a higher room - no. Everything was fully booked. The room is basic. Big bed but: a stained welcome book, no hotel notepad, no glasses, only paper cups which weren't replaced as I used them. I didn't even have a bathmat the first night. The air con smelled funky and all in all just the basic of basic amenities. Huge TV sure but I wasn't really there to watch tv.  After heading out to meet a friend I returned and called down to ask if they had a corkscrew. After much mumbling I was told to come down to reception as they might have one there. I went down and there were multiple parties checking in. All assigned double rooms higher up than the 2nd floor - I know that it depends on length of stay but the overall service was of 'can't be bothered' so wouldn't be surprised if there were rooms I could have moved to. After being made to wait 5 minutes without acknowledgement - not even a 'I'll be with you in a minute' the guy behind reception just looked up and said: "it was you who wanted a cork screw? We don't have one."Next morning for breakfast - paper plates. All in the name of the 'environment'. I don't believe it. Paper plates and plastic forks and a poor selection of food. I ate out the second morning. Every single request of mine was met with disdain. I don't know if it's because I'm a woman travelling alone, or if it's just total complacency of 'hey, we have a hotel in Times Square, we'll fill it and we don't even have to try!'I love travelling, I love trying new hotels. I have a lot of great experiences and it makes me sad that somewhere like this can charge so much and treat customers with such arrogance and indifference. I would absolutely NOT recommend this place. The location is not worth the treatment you get. What’s best is that I know by posting this, the complacency of the hotel will only show itself to shine. There will be a stock response that will say something like this: “ I hope that in the future should your travel plans include New York City that you would reach out to me directly and consider giving us another try. Thank you again for sharing your recent experience.”I did reach out and contact the hotel directly a week ago in the hope that I would get some response. I got nothing.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I stayed in this hotel for my first NYC city visit. I'm a Hilton diamond member so get a free room voucher each year and chose this hotel because it fit the bill for the room type we needed to fulfill the voucher. Due to its high price tag, I also chose to use points to pay for another night because it was hard to justify at almost $400 per night. We had a basic 2 double bed room on the 24th floor. No rooms were available for upgrade but they did put us on a high floor for viewing.The good: Ridiculously comfortable bedsTons of outlets available near the tables to plug devices intoVery quiet hotel given the hustle and bustle of Times SquareLocation to subway is perfectVery friendly and helpful concierge (John)Decent free breakfastLightning fast elevatorsFree snack bag at front desk for breakfast on the runCustomer service check in via text to be sure your stay is good.Housekeeping done in the room mid afternoon.Great car service booking available at front deskAir conditioning works great!The bad:Mildew smell in bathroom - fan doesn't work wellSome front desk help weren't very friendly.No bar/restaurantNo rooms available for upgrade - very basic hotelTiny roomsNo fridge/microwave in roomMinimal vanity space for toiletry itemsHard to block out light in bedroom and light on ceiling flickers all nightNo outlet near bedroom mirror to get ready outside of bathroom (no way 2 people can share the tiny bathroom)To be honest, we just really weren't in the hotel very much each day of our 3-day stay. Personally, I wouldn't stay in Times Square again because I felt it was much too touristy for my liking. That being said, it was an excellent location for subway use and walking to many local attractions. The street its located on is quiet with much less noise than others. John at the concierge desk helped us find a great show to see (Paramour) which was right across the street, though we found out later that we paid about $100 more per ticket than we should have...so beware of the mark up and fees associated with using the concierge and look for a good show app or discount tickets instead. Some of the front desk staff were nice but others refused to smile and seemed annoyed by our questions. They did have a great black car service for $60 to the airport that proved to be much better than a taxi or Uber. We felt very safe and secure in this hotel. If you like small hotels in the middle of a big city, this hotel would be great for you. I would never, however, pay the $400 price tag for Friday/Saturday nights for this hotel - its just too basic to pay that much.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: The hotel was great and I would definitely stay here again. Each staff member I encountered was friendly and helpful. While our king room was a little small (although probably not by NY standards) it was very well designed,very clean and quiet with a view of the Empire State Building. The bed and pillows were also very comfortable and the bathroom had a separate large shower rather than a combo bath. The room was equipped with an HD TV with DirecTV. The location was quiet and just a very short walk from Times Square and numerous subway lines. We were on an upper floor but never waited more than 2 minutes for an elevator. The breakfast was average, about what you would expect for something complimentary. Overall I was very happy with the room, the service, the staff and the excellent location.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We enjoyed our stay at the Hampton Inn right near Times Square. It was a great centrally located hotel right in the middle of everything. Despite that fact, it was a very quiet place to stay. It was a great jumping off spot to see all the sites, hit the theater, and find great restaurants nearby. The staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean and comfortable. Breakfast was what you come to expect from a Hampton Inn with tasty variety and friendly staff as well. What more could you ask for in your stay in NYC?

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Spent a night in Manhattan to take in a show. The hotel is very convenient to Times Square, subways, etc. Our room was on the 20th floor (room 2007), and we had no problems with noise. There was a nice breakfast spread included. Because we were a Hilton Honors member we got a "gift basket" with a couple of bottles of water and snacks. The hotel and room is exactly what you would expect from a Hampton Inn, clean, well kept, friendly staff. The room was perhaps a little smaller than a normal non-Manhattan room. The one complaint was the slowness of the elevators.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Came to city with grand girls ages 3 and 5 to see Alladin!! Stayed here after reading tons of reviews. Perfect spot as theatre is right across the street. We loved the location and the hotel was very nice. Clean and accommodating! Front desk very friendly and even texted me to see how we were finding room!!! Gave us water and said to come back if needed more!!! The Bell hop helped us with transportation. He said because there was 5 of us we could do two taxis or get a car for $50 hour. We did the car and it was fantastic!!! Would do that again for sure. They picked us up in a beautiful escalade and we took it for two hours . They dropped us at the American a girl Doll store. After we shopped we walked to St Patrick's Cathedral. We texted the driver and he came back and picked us up and took us back to hotel! 100 plus tip, not bad! So go stay here and enjoy!!! PS hotel have great recommendations for lunch and dinner spots !

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My wife and I stayed for a weekend getaway the hotel was great. I ready many reviews people complaining about the long wait for the elevators.We did not have any issues and we stayed on the 15th floor. The location was great time square up the street. The room was nice and clean and updated, staff was also very helpful and friendly. When in NYC we will return to this hotel.
user_name:
KWimbush
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This is a great hotel in a great location. I really enjoyed everything - from staff to to the room to the bathroom. It is a steal for the price. It's in the heart of Times Square and close to everywhere.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Perfect location- one block from Time Square, lots of restaurants, bus station, shopping...and so much more! Fantastic hotel service and concierge, complimentary hot breakfast, free wi-fi. Rooms are a little small, but nice and clean and beds are so comfy. (there is no pool/jacuzzi) We would definitely stay here again!!!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: If arriving via Port Authority this is a great place to stay. Just a short walk from the PA and you are in the front door. Central location close to Time Square. Complimentary breakfast is good, but crowded - get there early.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I was in a party of 7 that had a total of 5 king rooms at this hotel. We arrived before 10am from a cruise ship and expected to just leave our luggage at the hotel until we could check in. We were pleasantly surprised when 2 rooms were available immediately, and we were notified by text when the other rooms were available. Extremely clean and modern rooms, and staff was incredibly friendly! I would absolutely stay here again!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed in two different hotels over 2 nights in the same general area. The Hampton won hands down. Great location, check-in was speedy, employees were friendly and elevators were moving everyone around pretty efficiently. Three things I liked about the hotel. First, great location. Second, it was pretty quiet at night. The other hotel I stayed at had sirens throughout the night, which is more typical in New York. But I wasn't woken up once. Finally, the room I was in had the restroom at the back of the room. It was something different and made the room feel a little bigger than it actually was. I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed there for four nights on our visit to New York The location close to Times Square and the subway was greatCheckin was very good and friendly We were given a room on the 28th floor and which was a lot roomier than we expected Although on the 28th floor we had no problem with the lifts , and never had to wait very long.The two queen beds were very comfortable The bath and the shower in the bathroom were goodThere was a good choice of food at breakfast incl. hot food, cereals, porridge, bagels, muffins, toast, waffles, fruit, juices, tea and coffeeThe breakfast room can get busy but that was dependent and the time we went downWe would definitely stay there again

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I love the Hamptons because of their standard of service and free breakfast. This one was well up to their standards and is particularly convenient to Times Square and several subway lines. If you can, plan your breakfast either early or late as it can get crowded mid-morning.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel is amazing. The staff, especially Tobo, were so helpful and kind. The breakfast was amazing and the rooms were clean and very comfortable. HIGHLY recommend. The staff was so great giving us directions to places and remembering my name each time we came in. The location is superb, steps from subway and the middle of Times Square. Rooms were very quiet.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Good choice for Manhattan stay. Location ideal, complimentary breakfast is fine, helps with scheduling and helps hold down food cost. Staff very friendly and bend over backwards to be helpful. Good quick sandwich place just down the street when you are in a hurry - Schnippers. Lots of other good restaurants close.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I booked it in combination of price and location. The online pics looked great. I travel a lot for work and stay in a LOT of hotels. The staff truly was one of the most engaging, friendly, helpful that I have encountered in 18 years of traveling for work. The ticket guy helped us as well to get 911 memorial tix which allowed us to bypass the really long line at the museum. It was the difference between us getting to see it and not having enough time. The front desk allowed us to check out at 2:00 and even held our bags after that. I will absolutely make this my top choice to stay when in Manhattan. Super clean, one block from the bus/subway station, and about 2 blocks from Times square. When you walk out the front door, you are in the middle of everything. They also had a driver on hand who took us to the newark airport for a flat rate. Much cheaper than a cab and the same price as an Uber. My new place to stay in the city.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My wife and I stayed for 7 nights on the 10th floor. The receptiomist Thomas, was very friendly and welcoming. The hotel is very modern and our room very clean and we'll equipped. People have mentioned long waits for the lifts but we only encountered one occasion when staff were helping a large arrival group by controlling two of the lifts so they could get to their rooms. Breakfast was more than adequate and all staff were pleasant and helpful. Special thanks to Geraldine and the other staff who signed a birthday card for my wife. We can definitely recommend the hotel

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Exellent base to do your sight seeing - within walking distance of all main attractions (Times Square, Empire State Building, Rockerfeller Centre, Fifth Street, Broadway). Don't expect luxury or a brilliant breakfast in the morning (someone actually took all the fruit for themselves and refused to share!!) but you're only using the hote as a base to sleep and leave your luggage !!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Location is perfect. Close to main attractions and subway station 100 m from hotel.Very pleasant and satisfying complimentary breakfast but dining space insufficient and it is agglomerated and noisy.Staff kind and courteous but my request for additional blanket was addressed at 2 am and of course we refused to be disturbed at such an hour.Beds are about 140 cm wide, a bit on the narrow crowdy side.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Absolutely tremendous location in Times Square. Very close and easy access to the subway. Hotel staff was very warm and friendly. Rooms are smaller than typical, but it is New York City. Breakfast was always excellent and well stocked and staffed. Valet service to the airport is easily accessible at the front entrance with pricing very comparable to a taxi. Could not be a more perfect hotel for Broadway/Times Square!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This was a great hotel to stay at centrally located, breakfast included and free WiFi.We were within walking distance to many attractions and close to the hop on hop off bus stop, so was easy access to many other attractions in New York. restaurants were only a couple blocks away and Broadway theaters within walking distance as well.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Was here with the family for Comic Con. Convenient location to get to the Javits Center as well as the other off-site locations. Down the street from Port Authority. Room was very clean and a nice size for NYC. Only improvement needed here is to have an exhaust fan in the bathroom. Free breakfast in the morning was very nice and saved us money and time. Would not hesitate to stay here again!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed here for 6 days and loved every minute of our stay! The hotel was located walking distance to Times Square, many other NYC attractions and a subway station. Hotel staff was very accomodating, from front desk giving recommendations for food, holding our luggage, and calling for a car service to drive us to the airport. Geraldine, in the breakfast area, was very friendly, greeted us daily and always genuinely asked what she could do for us. We stayed on the 18th floor and amazed at the fast moving elevators, never waiting more than a few minutes. The beds were comfortable. Our only complaint was the bathroom door faced the beds and was fogged glass, so you could tell if someone was on the commode :-(. There was a front desk staff, Maria, that was very accommodating when we asked about the possibility of extending our stay due to a possible flight cancellation from Hurricane Matthew hitting our home state of Florida on the day of our travels. Maria was able to put a special note in the computer due to our extenuating circumstances. The hotel had water bottles and daily grab bags packed with snacks for hotel guests. It had a coffee, water station available 24 hours a day in the lobby, free computer use and hotel Wi-Fi. All staff was very nice and professional!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I stayed here with some friends. The location can't be beat. You are right in the heart of everything. Front desk staff is very friendly and helpful. Fitness center is clean and updated. I like that they provide water and coffee during the day. Rooms are comfortable and clean.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Half block from Times Square. Around the corner from the subway. Breakfast is always a plus and Hampton has a great one. Room was clean and very spacious for NYC. I will stay at this property each time I'm in NYC.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I visited NYC with my sister and mum and we stayed at the Hampton Inn which gave us a great base to explore the many attractions New York has to offer. Our stay was made more special by all the friendly and welcoming staff but especially one of your breakfast ambassadors Geraldine who was fantastic and went out of her way help us and chat to us about where to visit and how to get places. Geraldine was really friendly and approachable and a credit to your staff team

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We don't even check in until Nov 2nd but I had the pleasure of talking to Chris at the front desk.My wife & I are coming to NYC to celebrate our our 5th wedding anniversary and I called in with a couple questions. I have never dealt with such a pleasant front deck person. He was so helpful and went above and beyond in such a pleasant way to address the few items I brought up with him.A+ Hampton Inn - After my experience on the phone I'm really looking forward to our stay!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Hotel is in great location in Times Square. We were on 6th floor and the elevators were extremely slow. Had to use the stairs many times. Breakfast room was always crowded. Hard to get a table together. Geraldine Meehan is the Breakfast Ambassador every morning we were there. She was wonderful helping us find seats close to our children. Always had a beautiful smile on her face and greeted us first thing every morning. She is an important asset to your company.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Good quality and service at breakfast, clean and quiet room provided, the overall service of reception staffs are very good. The elevators have to wait for too long during the peak time in the morning.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed here for 4 nights in Sept 2016 on the 24th floor.The room was 2 double beds with nice & quiet A/C that worked well.There are only 3 lifts servicing this hotel which from memory had 30 floors. Our room faced Times Square but due to the surrounding buildings there was not much of a view. Being on the 24th floor there was little road noise except for the occasional police/fire sirens which never seems to stop at street level.This Hotel had a supplied breakfast which had a very good selection of hot & cold choices.The hotel had a fitness center which my daughter used every day & she commented on how clean it was.The hotel package we had included free wifi which in the end supported Viber Video back to NZ with little or no buffering. We used the wifi even though having TMobile US Sim cards in our iPhones. (The reception around NYC can be spotty.)We took in a Broadway show whilst at the Hotel & it was one block from the theater, a 5 minute walk.I would recommend this hotel for people who are taking in a Broadway show or just taking in the sights around Times Square.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great hotel. Conveniently located next to Times Square with somehow still quiet rooms for this location (which was something I was a little worried about when I booked it). The room was bigger than I expected for NYC and our family of four fit nicely in a room with two full beds. Room and bathroom were extremely clean and comfortable. The complimentary breakfast and free internet were very helpful. Beautiful view from our room. Would definitely go back in future visits to NYC.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Could not have been more pleased with this hotel and the staff! Very clean room, great location. Close to theater district, across from subway, walking distance to great restaurants! Highly recommend this hotel!
user_name:
Jean B
New York, United States

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great room size for NYC. Breakfast provided in cost of hotel however we only ate there once as there was nothing we really liked. Asked for a fridge in our room to store my medication and this was provided with no issue. Great location in the heart of Times Square. Close to subway which we used daily.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This is a great spot in the city one block from the Port Authority bus station two blocks from times square. The price was great more than anything the staff was above par. Granted we were there for a football game supporting the opposing team they were fun friendly knowledgeable and ready to help. The rooms are fully updated with wifi usb connections throughout the rooms lobby. They have a very good almost full breakfast from 6-10 am that is good. Even the servers for breakfast were very nice and accommodating; it gets packed around 8am so come early. The money that I saved on breakfast I gave as a tip to the breakfast staff. They were so nice. Over all there is nothing bad to say about this place. The rooms are NYC style smaller but everything is taller...

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel staff was over the top helpful, friendly, and efficient. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. The concierge, valet, front desk staff, dining room staff, all super friendly and helpful!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I found Hampton Inn to be a modern, clean, well equipped and conveniently placed hotel. The staff (in particular Thomas and Ray on Reception) were extremely helpful with travel advice, friendly and courteous. There was plenty of items to chose from for breakfast to set you up for a days sightseeing. Would definitely recommend this hotel :)

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel is right on the edge of the busiest part of Times Square- great location for tourists visiting broadway plays and the attractions nearby. Staff is friendly, property is well taken care of. Room was spacious with two double beds and a view that included some of the neon lights that make Times Square famous. The only complaint is the lack of privacy allowed by the bathroom. The bathroom door, instead of being solid is a pocket door with a huge pane of frosted glass. Maybe the designers think this adds to style or decor but it's transparent enough that people using the bathroom have no privacy and are on display for everyone else in the room. That's a little uncomfortable.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Best staff,cleanliness,security,location.You cant beat it for the price.They offer "happy bags' small lunch bags to go (nice treat).Five minutes walk to Time Square,and steps to the subway.Book with them you wont regret it.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We just stayed there, Maria was able to check us in extremely early! Wonderful room, great view! She was professional, friendly and efficient. The room was immaculate, had all the amenities needed. Bed, very comfortable! Breakfast was included, simple but plentiful with a good variety. The location and staff are great. An excellent value. Will stay there again!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Excellent facility. Friendly staff. Easy access to all accommodations of Times Square. This facility is fairly new and my family and I were excited to stay there and weren't disappointed. The front desk staff as well as the kitchen staff were extremely helpful to us.
user_name:
Michael N
West Hempstead, United States

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel is hidden away off of the hustle and bustle of Times Square, however still close to everything NY has to offer. It is a central location for all landmarks and Subway. This was my fourth trip to NY and this was my favourite location and hotel! Service was excellent from beginning to end. I arrived on an early flight and upon arrival was told my room was ready, nice surprise:) the front desk staff were helpful, friendly and very pleasant. The breakfast area was lovely and items were replenished quickly, staff in the breakfast area were also very pleasant. The rooms were spacious, newly renovated and good size for NY standards, an adequate gym facility as well.I would choose this location again for future stays and would recommend this property for anyone traveling with children.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Hotel location was perfect for those wanting to be close to Broadway, Times Square and fabulous restaurants (Wolfgang Puck's Steakhouse located several doors down). Although located only 1 street over from Time Square would never know it while in hotel room as very little street noise. Also very convenient to subway and Port Authority Bus Station. Definitely would stay here again while visiting NYC.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Clean new hotel at the centre of it all. But still in a not so buzy street.Though it can be noizy some times. Guess garbage is picked up early in the morning.Rooms are small, but since you're in NYC who spends time in his room except to sleep.Breakfast was more then satisfying. Just one negative point, the breakfast room is, for the size of the hotel, way too small.Only thing I missed, a pool. :-)Would have been great to take a dip after a hot day.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great value for the hotel. At the heart of Times Square. Very clean room, great complementary breakfast and internet.Helpful staff. My only concern was staff knocking at my door trying to deliver something I did request, and the staff trying to apologize at midnight and trying to apologize at 1:30 in the morning ! But other than that, it was a great stay.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location in the heart of the city. Easy access to Broadway and close to lots of restaurants and things to see.The staff was friendly and pleasant. The breakfast is the standard Hampton Inn fare, hot n cold stuff, pastries, cereals, coffee.The rooms are tiny which is standard for the area. The bed was comfortable, the bathroom had plenty of toiletries and there was plenty of water pressure.Would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We have just returned from NY after a very enjoyable stay. The room was very comfortable and spotlessly clean. A wide choice of food was available at breakfast. The staff were friendly and polite. The location was quiet but close to the subway,bus station and many of the theatres and within walking distance of the Blue Circle Cruises, and Empire State Building.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Nothing bad to say at all about this hotel, everything was great about it. I just found it high in price for the rating of a such a hotel, but then again nothing is cheap in NYC. Only thing missing in this hotel is a restaurant/bar, you have no choice but to go out

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Clean, excellent customer service you would see at a 5 Star, accommodating, good size room, perfect location to Time Square, friendly, helpful, and will definately stay here again. I have stayed at many Hampton's and this one exceeded expectations in so many ways. We requested extra pillows and personal items which were already in the room before we arrived. I had a text prior to arrival anticipating our check in and asked if there were any questions. The valet were extremely patient and friendly. The check in was fast and efficient. The room was large for NY and clean and comfortable. The breakfast had many options and the staff was like having Mom take care of you bring Soy milk to our table, picking up our dishes and sharing stories with smiling faces. The check out was easy and we called ahead to valet to have our car brought to the front and it was there as promised. Just an all around EXCELLENT positive experience. We will definately be back. I would like to see queen beds added to the rooms instead of doubles. Most Hampton's come with queen beds as standard.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This was a perfect location for accessing Broadway and Times Square, numerous subway stations and the bus station a 2 minute walk away. If stay here again and very clean, well run hotel. Could not fault the staff as they were very helpful at all times.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Just spent 11 magical days in New York using this Hotel as a base. It's central Midtown location just round the corner from Times Square and 42nd Street is excellent. You are within very easy walking distance of The Empire State Building, Grand Central, Penn Station, Madison Square Gardens and Macy's to name just a fraction.The Staff in this hotel are very helpful, friendly and very keen to please - no request was too much trouble. The rooms are not spacious but fine, comfortable and very clean and that's all we needed.Our only slight criticism is the Breakfast area on the ground floor can be very busy especially after 7.30 am onwards and is not big enough for the amount of rooms. (Special mention to Geraldine at this point - a lovely warm Irish American welcome awaits all from her at breakfast). The hotel offers a flat rate private car service to JFK for not much more than the flat rate Yellow cab fare you pay coming from JFK, which we thought was good value in the circumstances.One tip is eating out. The further away from Midtown/ Times Square the better value you get. After the local taxes and obligatory tip/ service charge ( which is included most of the time but believe is still optional), a basic lunch can be quite expensive even without alcohol. Just to put in context we found like for like restaurants in somewhere like East Village half or less in price than around Midtown.If you are in New York for a few days or more the get the weekly Metro card for the subways - Currently $32 dollars and you can go anywhere on the system.Finally if you want a relaxing time out from the hustle and bustle, a walk in Central Park is a marvellous experience.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Needed to be in NYC for one night for a business trip / reception at the NY Public Library. This Hampton Inn was very conveniently located, and a nice oasis in the midst of the hub-bub of Times Square. Very quiet room, clean, and chic. Even the breakfast in the morning, which can usually feel like rushed, crazed experience was pretty pleasant. the staff was friendly and helpful every step of the way. My only complaint was that our room was VERY pricey, possibly due to coinciding with the UN General Assembly, which was happening the same time as our stay. Otherwise, I think i'd stay here again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Hotel was in a nice location but rooms were very small for the price. I would not recommend paying for a room here when you can get a room at a much nicer hotel for the same price. However it was clean

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My company held a sales meeting at this establishment. We were overwhelmed by the thoughtfulness, responses, and performance of the staff. The rooms are modern and nicely furnished. Elevator call times are convenient. The breakfast offering is more than adequate, and the staff in the breakfast room couldn't be friendlier.The meeting facility was fine for our group of 13, but it could not accommodate many more than that number. One slight drawback is the telephone reception, which was spotty, probably owing to the room's location in the cellar.Chevelle Campbell was very responsive to our needs - she's an asset to the organization. We owe the success of our event to her.Since Hampton Inn does not feature a restaurant, the hotel arranged to have food brought in from an outside vendor. We ordered both cold and hot lunches over the course of our 3-day meeting. Food quality was very good, with something for everyone. The cold food was cold; the hot food was hot, and the quantities were plentiful.I would return to this hotel in a minute!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Stayed for a few nights while getting acquainted with how manhattan works. Nice place, feels modern, with friendly and helpful staff that catered to my every need. Location is obviously great, with just a few steps walking distance to Times Square, 42st subway station, etc.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: My best friend and I stayed here Sept. 10-16. From the moment we walked up to the front desk to the minute our car drove us away it was marvelous!!! I even received a text before I arrived welcoming me! Anytime I needed anything I just sent a text and it arrived at my door. The hotel is in the perfect location for everything in Times Square and the Theater District but without all the noise. The beds and pillows are some of the most comfortable I have slept in anywhere. The breakfast looked good however, I only ate one day due to early commitments. I will stay here again for sure!! Thank you Thomas and John you made NYC the best for these two KY girls!!!

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Hotel was in a good location... close to everything, although the city is a mess and all torn up! Rooms are nice, modern. Very busy hotel with only 3 elevators, so often times we waited over 10 minutes to get an elevator from the 26th floor. Weight limits made them pass us by. Busiest in the morning.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This hotel is centrally located, in a great location in Times Square, and the employees aim to please. They are all very friendly, helpful and professional. We were very pleased with our room and our whole stay at Hampton Inn. (The breakfast is awesome too).
user_name:
BeckyBock
South Jordan, Utah, United States

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We stayed for 2 nights after we got off a 10 day cruise. The location was great for Times Square and Broadway. The staff were friendly and very accommodating. The room was clean. I would definately recommend.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Location is amazing, 2 steps from Brodway st. and the bryant park. The staff was very friendley, breakfast includes, free wifi, clean and modern style rooms, free coffee&tea all day long and homemade cookies afternoon! Great value for the price in the middle of manhattan. Perfect for couples.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We travel to New York often, and had never stayed at this hotel before. We will definately stay here again. The staff, throughout the hotel, was very friendly and always helpful. The rooms were comfortable. Also, great location.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: I have previously stayed in another hotel near Times Square and this one was far superior. The hotel has everything you need, reasonable size rooms, and all is modern, clean and tidy. They had a welcoming reception area with free tea and coffee all day (and cookies in the afternoon!). The complimentary breakfast was pretty good for the price paid - reasonable selection and quality. The only issue was insufficient seating areas. And they need to do something with the elevators as at times we waited 10 minutes! The location was great, so close to Times Square but we heard no noise from it on the 21st floor. Would definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: We tried to use a free weekend night at this hotel. It took about an hour on the phone to set it up. We gave them our certificate number and they told us we were all set. I checked my card this week and saw we weren't credited the night. I called the hotel directly and was told there was nothing they could do and that I should call Hilton. Hilton said there was nothing they could do. Come on. There is always something that can be done. They were both choosing to not do anything. Maybe I'm not important enough. I am a Hampton Gold member. Super, super disappointed. The desk told me that the certificate is like cash so they had no way of knowing that I was who I said I was - and yet, they had the cert number in the reservation and checked my ID when we checked in. This is sub par and poor execution. I've asked Hilton for a response, but we'll see what they do. READ THE FINE PRINT. I DIDNT EXPECT TO BE PENCIL WHIPPED BY HAMPTON OR HILTON

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: It has been a long time since I stayed at a Hampton Inn and I have to admit I wasn't excited. However, this was the easiest and most pleasant stay we could have imagined, especially practically in busy Times Square.The staff went beyond the service we normally expect in many ways.First, we requested valet parking and the front desk clerk noticed my son left his ipad in the car. He personally walked it to our room and explained he didn't want to risk it being taken by the valet service.Then, a dining area associate overheard me worrying that we wouldn't have enough time to sight see and check out in time. She personally made arrangements for a late check out. We were still late getting back, called ahead to apologize and were told not to worry, they would call valet and our car would arrive by the time we gathered our items and checked out.The rooms/beds were clean and comfy with decent city views. The ample complimentary breakfast was a great way to start an active day.Bonus, there was plenty of metered parking on the street in front of the hotel.you could easily leave your car free 12-7 am...but we were staying in the city most of the day.The valet parking price (55 SUV) was the same as what we found for self parking on our own.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Chose this hotel due to its proximity to a 7 like station as I was going to the us open in the evening and wanted a safe and convenient location. The hotel is definitely well placed to access the subway and all the major sights you can easily hop on the subway or just as easily walk. Not adverse to walking I happily walked up to Central Park approx 20mins at a steady pace. Times Square is right around the corner, getting in and around here is pretty chaotic, on an early visit I stayed further up above Times Square and would probably chose this in the future simply to avoid having to walk through this busy area. Hotel offers breakfast decent basic spread to get you going in the morning however due to the size of the hotel the breakfast room was often overflowing. The room was pretty basic just two beds tv and bathroom, there was no fridge in the room - pretty standard hotel expectation this was a little annoying as we stayed 7 nights and would have been convenient, you can hire a fridge for $20/n... There's 3 lifts to service the 30 something floors often one being used for cleaning service makes the mornings a tricky time to get up and down found ourselves using the stairs from the 11th floor quite a few times! Overall the room was clean, cool and convenient.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: This Hampton Inn location is definitely the best in my opinion. I especially enjoyed the 24 hours complimentary coffee. The rooms including the bathroom at this hotel are quite spacious for the NYC standards. Their complimentary breakfast is also great. I also appreciate the early check in.
user_name:
Anna L
San Francisco, United States

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Hampton Inn in Times Square Central is an excellent hotel in an excellent location. Located on W 41st St., between 7th and 8th Avenues, it is right outside the busy part of Times Square. The hotel is located on a quiet street and no street noises can be heard inside the hotel room. All the staff are friendly and helpful all of the time, despite the sometimes large number of guests coming and going. The complimentary breakfast gets everyone off to a good start every morning, with one egg and one meat dish, fresh fruits, waffles, different kinds of bread, cereals and juices.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Great location, value, staff, and accommodations in the heart of Times Square with easy access to subway, restaurants, and shopping! Hotel staff was professional and courteous. Continental breakfast and beverages were good.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
review_body: Located in a very, very busy area near Times Square this Hampton isn't one of the better ones in the city. The elevators are horrible in the morning for the center floors- opt for a floor where you can easily walk down or a top floor to get on before they fill up- not fun. The advertised "roof top terrace with a view of Times Square" is just a smallish area fenced off from the air conditioning units on the 32nd floor, there are no chairs or tables and the view is of the buildings across 41st with a peek-a-boo-kind-of Times Square if you know which direction to look. Concierge is not at his desk very often and doesn't leave maps where they are easily found when he is not there. Rooms are small. Hotel has been redone, bathrooms are nice and as well kept as all Hamptons, the breakfast , run by Brittany, is probably the best we have had at various Hamptons and David that works the valet desk outside could not be more helpful but we still will not be staying at this particular Hampton in the future too many other choices in New York.

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central
